column4: The hotel is located in a residential area, 10min walk from Marrakesh railway station and ca 30min walk (10min in a taxi) from the old town. The hotel has 2 outdoor pools - one heated, and plenty of sunbeds available around the pools - at least in November, when the mornings were too cold to lie by the pool, we did not have an issue finding sunbeds around midday. We had breakfast included and there is plenty to choose from including fresh fruit, various cooking stations, etc. Our room was quite spacious, with decent size bathroom, clean and with all the expected amenities. The staff is friendly and helpful, just watch out for the taxi drivers outside - their asking prices are always 2-3 times or more what it should be, so negotiate before getting in!!

Perfect balance between work and leisure if you are on business trip. Perfectly relaxing if you want to forget business and only think leisure. If you really want to discover Marrakech, do it from M√∂venpick Hotel.

I advise you to chose this hotel if you ever wanna spend a good moment in marrakech. Everything was perfect Clean and organized If you go there ask for nezha in the reception she is a golden woman Thank you again

Movenpick is an excellent hotel in every way possible. The staff is the key to make your stay at the hotel enjoyable as it should be namely Nezha, who went above and beyond the call of duty. Nezha is patient, professional and accommodating. Praise her, she‚Äôs a wonderful asset to the Movenpick chain.

column3: The best place to be for kids;)
column4: I am simply in love with this hotel!! I particularly appreciate the kids club, so spacious and colorful ! My kids can spend all the day playing, dancing and painting. They can also enjoy a delicious meal specially cooked for them:) Special thanks to kids club team, you‚Äôre doing a great job guysüòò

I have decided to celebrate my birthday in Marrakech and M√∂venpick hotel was an obvious choice. We had a warming welcome by Hanane who accompanied us all along our stay at the hotel. Hanane was professional, friendly and very much client oriented. The room was great and the breakfast delicious. We highly recommend M√∂venpick.

A great experience above our expectations. The hotel has all the right installations to keep you inside. The team very warm and you feel all the time very welcome. Jamra Restaurant next to the pool offer a healthy menu w/o gluten and lactose next to the pool to allow you enjoy from the sun. Urban brasserie is the great choice for dinner or even the buffet menu at the pool terrace. The SPA open long hours with free access to Jacuzzi, Hammam and Sauna, reserve the hammam and massage on time! Thank you to FADOU, Dauaa, Jamila, Kamir, Mr. Bennani, Chef Ahmed & Chef Tariq. We look forward to come back soon.

The spa at Movenpick Marrakech was a really good experience. I got the hands and feet treatment done by Najia at the Spa in Movenpick Marrakech. She took her time and did not rush. I would recommend asking for Najia as she will do it with care and pleasure. The 1 hour treatment was worth the money. I could tell the difference before and after the treatment and the service by Najia and the Spa overall was excellent.

I had a spa package while on a business trip. The hotel was great and the overall service was wonderful. The spa package included a hammam, a massage and beauty feet. It was my first experience with hammam and I was a little nervous but my skin never felt so exfoliated and refreshed. I‚Äôm very picky about massage and am always worried when there‚Äôs a language barrier. The massage with Najia was probably one of the best I‚Äôve had, just the right pressure, very intuitive and very patient with the communication. The following foot treatment was also wonderful. The overall spa experience at movenpick and with Najia was exceptional.

Compliments to the staff of the M√∂venpick Marrakech! Beautiful entourage, super cool graffiti art, √ñm Yoga studio, fitness, Spa, 3 pools, bars & restaurants! Great possibilities for all kind of travellers! Special shout-out üòÅü§© to the following people: Sa√Ød & Mohammed at the reception. Hassan at the pool bar. Kaltoum at the Spa. Skiriba at housekeeping. And the rest of the team! They all made our holiday a big succes! Shukraan lak! Thank you very much! Already looking forward to come back to beautiful Marrakeck!

Staff are excellent especially in Saray. Breakfast staff Mohammed and all waiters, the ladies making msemen and sfinga bread are super and deserve my special appreciation. Special thanks to Mustapha and Fatima Alzahra. Great hospitality

Our tour started with 3 nights in this hotel. Considering how tired I was after first a long flight and second after a day of touring, the only things that I was really interested in was sleep and recharging batteries for my electronics. As far as sleep goes, the hotel was very good - I fell asleep quickly and slept soundly. Recharging however was another story. Like many of the hotels outside the US the room's electricity was disconnected when you took your key-card to leave the room and as a result all recharging stopped. I solved this problem by asking for a second card, which more or less worked except when the maid removed the card while I was out during the day. Since it was part of my tour, I have no idea of how much we paid, so I can't assess its value.

We have been staying in Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech for 5 days in February. Couldn't have been happier with the hotel that we choose. We had a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious, the heated pool makes our stay even more pleasant. I want to write a huge thank you to the ladies who run the kids club. With 2 small children it was a perfect choice, since the kids have been entertained, busy with different types of games, and fed for most of the time of the day, and we had some spare time.

The hotel is fantastic very good service and clean rooms. A lot of facilities to use also. The staff are great especially one named Moshin! He really took care of me during my stay, helped set up activities for me and even sorted out the refund for me when it got cancelled honestly made my trip very smooth. I‚Äôd definitely recommend here and can‚Äôt wait to return.

column3: Incredible customer service especially from Hanane
column4: Customer service here is exceptional but Hanane made our stay much more pleasant. She help us book our tours and assisted with anything else we needed. She is the best always helping out with a smile. Will definitely recommend the hotel and have them go directly to her.

Honestly apart from the room, facilities, and overall experience the staff at this hotel is exceptional. Laila from reception is a dream to work with, as she made sure our stay was pleasurable and memorable. Her knowledge about the city and recommendations were always valued and sought for. It honestly makes me so happy to experience such a service as it can make a huge difference.

column3: Superb first experience in Marrakech, was amazed by the hospitality and was way beyond any of my expectation!!!! :)
column4: Went on holiday for my mums birthday, was very hesitant at first as of what hotels in Marrakech would be accommodating to what she wanted. Extremely satisfied to say the least, staff offered excellent service (V.friendly, gave us excellent recommendations) Thank you Layla :) Hope to see you soon

5*service from Poolside team,Monsef,Jihane,Tarik,Mohammed and Bar Tender Hassan. They made us feel very welcome. However the reception staff Laila and Safa were rude,lacked basic customer service skills and treated us with no courtesy.This is not what I expected from Movenpick as I have heard lots of fantastic things about this hotel,and also had recommended friends and family to visit,I have even thought about booking another visit there.Due to my experience I am not sure I will visit again.

Extremely happy with the service provided to us by Layla she went above and beyond for us, she was extremely helpful and sorted any problems with the accommodation. Layla was very patient with us which you don‚Äôt get from many other hotels. If you want to witness excellent customer service then Layla is definitely the standard to which it should be. I want to thank Layla once again for her support and her professionalism to make sure that we will have a pleasant stay. Incredible service.

column3: Excellent first experience in Marrakech with M√∂venpick
column4: We were there on a company business trip, and have to admit that it was an excellent choice of Hotel. The outdoor pool is amazing, they have clean and very nice rooms, also one of the most comfortable bed ever! The staff is amazing! I had an experience with one particular staff member, called Hanane, that made the best suggestions for the free time activity. She was very professional and kind, making our stay easier and comfortable. Definitely worth a visit! Enjoy!

After a few days of intensive visit of beautiful Marrakesh I treat myself with a well deserved pedicure ‚Äògriffe‚Äô by the beautiful Ghizlane in the O de Rose spa center. The staff is very welcoming, friendly and customer oriented. Many thanks. I now have ‚Äúhappy feet‚Äù again and ready to enjoy the evening. Christina from Luxembourg

I decided to go this place.i look on mobile this hotel. This is very good place. I am very interested in this. Very nice and beautiful place all services are available. Excellent customer service and best services provided by hotel.

I've decided to visit Marrakech for the first time to celebrate my birthday and couldn't have chosen a better hotel for the special occasion. From the moment we checked in, everyone was very attentive, kind and accommodating. My husband had recently injured his coccyx and they managed to get us a room with a bathtub for his recovery. They also spontaneously gave me a cake to celebrate my birthday, which was really yummy and covered with macaroons, which I love!! The hotel's facilities are also impressive and you can tell that each area is well maintained. They have 3-4 pools, including one calmer and more private, perfect for people with kids. Overall, my experience was very positive and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. A special thank you to Safa and Leila for‚Ä¶

This hotel will take you into a fairy tale world of Moroccan interior combined with class and tradition! Well-trained personnel,great breakfast, warmed up outdoor pool and a beautiful room is awaiting for u. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

column3: Nice experience if you can even get in
column4: Me, my boyfriend and his mother (on holiday in Marrakesh) tried to access this hotel on a day pass to use the pool and restaurant area. When we arrived we were told by reception when we enquired there was NO ROOM and we would not be able to get in the pool because it would be so full. One member of staff rudely dismissed us and directed us to someone else. We then just booked the pass online, which we would have done before but we thought it would have been better to book face to face at the hotel and make sure everything was in order with the deal. Once presented with our booking She then eventually admired us entry but said we would not be able to get in the pool. Once inside, the pool area and loungers were basically empty, expect for a few families and couples sun‚Ä¶

We are a very lucky family ,we have stayed at some beautiful hotels. But the Movenpick in Marrakech is simply one of the best. The hotel is stunning, there's incredible art work in the reception area and you are greeted with beautiful sofas in stunning colours and it's obvious that this is a classy hotel. Our room was beautiful , it was incredibly clean and very modern and we had a lovely terrace which overlooked the well kept gardens. In the afternoon , I would sit on the terrace and I would spend hours, enjoying the absolute peace. The bathroom was great and had the most fantastic shower. The WiFi was excellent, there was a very strong signal. Breakfast was a wonderful treat. There were so many staff who would constantly make sure you had everything that you needed. The food‚Ä¶

Upon our arrival the reception was full of guests waiting to check-in and most appeared to be tired and somewhat frustrated. Our check-in process was overly long and it appeared the front desk staff were overwhelmed. The chap who checked us iin was a bit of a smart alec who was speaking down to us until he was taken down a peg by me. I am annoyed that I failed to note down his name. We also didn't feel the usual Moroccan warm welcome, there was no mint tea (or any beverage) offered upon arrival. In addition, of the 4 rooms booked only 3 were ready and it took 2 hours for the fourth room to be ready. We eventually had to make a fuss and were given a complimentary dinner at the hotel's top restaurant, the Urban Brasserie, for later that evening. The hotel's interiors are‚Ä¶

Professional staff and pay attention to details they are welcoming and warm, thank you abdellah and all the team, tr√®s jolie h√¥tel avec une piscine amazing d√©coration as well, tr√®s bien plac√©, pr√®s de palais congr√®s

I really enjoyed my hammam in √¥ de rose spa in movenpick h√¥tel, fatimazahra chouabi was wonderful at exfoliating my body and washing my hair so gently, she was amazing. I definitely recommend it and recommend her for anyone wanting to relax and enjoy the moroccan hammam but with a luxurious touch.

column3: Great service, nice resort but with tiring amenities
column4: We stayed a week in January 2020 here as a family of four. The service at the hotel was near perfect. From the pool staff, through to the restaurant staff, and especially our room cleaner - Mina - they were excellent. For example, the kids loved to come into our room and find how their toys had been set-up that day by her. All were very attentive and kind. In terms of the rooms and amenities the resort is looking a bit tired. From mosaics coming away from the main pool floor to a number of faulty lifts it is in need of a little tlc. Equally we got adjoining rooms but they were connected by an antechamber that then had a separate door onto the hotel corridor which made us feel a little vulnerable with the two young kids in the next room. Our room had a balcony overlooking‚Ä¶

Taha was a fantastic host, he was extremely kind with a great personality and provided excellent service at breakfast everyday. He was very welcoming which really made my family and I feel at home. The hotel was beautiful and modern but still maintained the Moroccan ambience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Marrakech.

Our company stayed here for our global sales meeting, buying out the property. It is a beautiful resort with multiple buildings for rooms, the spa, yoga, the gym, restaurants, etc. and it‚Äôs connected to a convention center, where we had our meetings and event nights. There are also a couple of swimming pools. The food was pretty good considering they had to feed about 550 people 3 meals a day plus coffee breaks. Mostly it was buffet, so it did get repetitive after a couple of days, but breakfast was always awesome and a few of the dinners were quite good. My room was quiet, clean and spacious. It had a mini fridge and water bottles were replenished with maid service. Huge bathroom with a large shower (no bathtub), robe, slippers, good towels, etc. Just no wash cloths, for some‚Ä¶

The staff was very friendly and took care of us. At the front desk, Mohssine helped us booking great and interesting tours. Lovely ambience with jasmine-scented lobby with Morrocan music and mint tea. Great amenities.

It was a great pleasure to take photographs in this gleaming hotel, with its modern Moroccan colors and motifs, fountains and small streams flowing beneath suspended huge golden filigreed lanterns, and beautifully landscaped and lit pool area. Breakfast was very complete and the bar was a fun place to chat with fellow tour members. It is located within walking distance of the square and the souks and is also near the mall.

column3: A message for the hotel and Mrs Nadia guest service
column4: Since my arrival Nadia was the best guest service I've ever met and she has to work hard to make me feel happy also she offered me a lot of help and she was so nice to me ... as a woman I was afraid but she helped me so much ... About the hotel I liked so much it make us feel comfy tbh I hope to see more guest services like Nadia / thank you so much Nadia Iwish you all the best I hope you receive this message

It was marvellous, the hotel was beautiful and the staff were so nice and welcoming. The breakfast was amazing with so much to choose from and we want to thank most of all Mohamed Skiriba who was so nice and helpful and made our stay so memorable, my dad was very happy with his caf√© cr√®me every morningüëç A big thanks to our favourite Mohamed from your Irish guests Mary, Alex & Sandyüíãüòò

column3: A beautiful hotel with a few shortcomings!
column4: On arrival the reception was totally packed with tired, frustrated visitors and only two staff members were on duty. We were given absolutely no tourist material or a map of Marrakesh. I had to ask for one the next day. We were upgraded to a very nice large room because our bedroom backed onto the neighbouring hotel's disco - we could not hear the TV in our room because the music was so loud. There were not enough sun loungers at the pool. And somehow they were reserved every morning with hotel towels until the "special" guests arrived. Otherwise all was ok..........

From January 7 till January 11 my daughter and I were guests in this wonderful hotel. The staff was unbelievably nice!! All of them were really friendly and helpful. I‚Äôve travelled all around the world but this is really hard to find! Thank you for the great 4 days! If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with good prices, in the middle of Marrakech with a wonderful staff don‚Äôt look any further! This is your hotel. Even my Maroccan friends told me so!!

Asma was my masseuse.. she was absolutely excellent.. her technique was perfect and her pressure was right on point. If I wasn‚Äôt leaving I would book her again. The room was comfortable and warm. The reception area was clean and the clerks were very hospitable.. and the tray served after was great!!

Lovely hotel with good facilities and good location.staff at hotel were very warm and helpful full. Nassima was very pleasant and allways smiling to all guests.In the busy morning breakfast restaurant. The heated pool was not warm at all,but overall all the hotel was very good.and would recommend.

We stayed in a variety of accommodations in Morocco and this place was the least welcoming. This might have to do with its size however as far as large hotels go, we also stayed in an all-inclusive and in another luxury hotel and these two were VERY welcoming. You know, have a seat with the mint tea upon arrival. I chose this hotel as I thought the photos made it look rather exotic. Quite the opposite. Again, just too big. Lastly, though the staff was very accommodating in keeping our two rooms within close vicinity of each other, we ended up in a wheelchair accessible room and it was not very comfortable: ie. stationary shower chair is right underneath shower head, difficult to shower. Fabric desk chair was in bad shape - quite filthy. For the price, everything should‚Ä¶

Nadia, is the best guest service staff I have ever met since from my arrival and she has worked so hard to make us happy. very helpful and offered me the best services with hospotailty ,welcoming. She can handle pressure so well and I really appeciate. In future I am sure the hotel would recieve more guests with the extreamily well behaved services of Nadia. Apprecaite her knowledge and know how skill in guest handlinging. I wish Nadia a better future. Hussa Alqubaisi

A very large hotel , well appointed and comfortable, set in lovely gardens with two outdoor swimming pools (one always heated to 26degrees). It is a brilliant place for a yoga week as the Om Yoga centre there is fabulous and has classes running through the day. Excellent breakfast and only about 10 minute taxi ride to the M√©dina. Polite, attentive, staff . Excellent Spa ( ask for Fatima to have a traditional Hammam ... she was great) . I plan to go again with my daughter for a mother-daughter yoga weekend and a relax by the pool. Lovely and good value .

I and my husband joined Insight Vacations for Morocco tour. We arrived in Marakech on Dec 25, 2019 and stayed there for 2 nights. Our Tour Director handed us the room key and confirmed that our room was twin bed as we strongly requested upon booking the tour. We were shocked the room given to us was not twin, instead it was double bed. The staff then re-arranged twin bed for us. However when we opened the door, someone was still occupying the room with her stuff all over the bed, so we quickly closed the door and informed the staff. They did not seem to show any concern or apologetic at all. Thereafter, the staff again re-arranged another twin bed for us which was away from the group. On the same night at around midnight, after washing my hair only then I realised the hair‚Ä¶

We travel almost every month to Marrakesh. I stay for the first time at the Movenpick together with my husband from December 8th till 12, 2019 at Movenpick Hotel in Marrakesh and we have been very satisfied and surprised about the quality of the hotel and the excellent service by all the Staff. Mr Mohssine from the reception and his colleagues where very professional and very helpful. Since my husband is an Accor Platinum (now Diamond) member, the "Reception Staff" ( Mr Mohssine and also two very kind and helpful ladies) treated us accordingly including the room upgrade. Check-in and check-out were quick. Since 2013 we stay always in another 5 star Accor hotel at Hivernage in Marrakesh. We both had a wonderful time at the Movenpick despite our short stay because we were‚Ä¶

column3: Wonderful Hotel in a beautiful city with amazing staff!
column4: The Movenpick hotel is an amazing place to stay while visiting Marrakech! It really is a vacation in itself, due to the kindness of staff. The rooms and grounds are immaculate. I actually extended my stay at this hotel because it is so good. Today, I walked into my room and the staff had placed roses and rose petals. Thank you to Baali Hanone,Ait ouarker Najaf madamme hilali for the beautiful presentation of roses. Also, the breakfast staff for providing a wonderful start to each day. Thank you also to Mr. Khalid Mawloud, manager, who took time to make me feel welcomed in this beautiful country.

column3: The Spa and Hammam are a Must Visit.
column4: I had a Hamam - The spa centre is fresh, clean, hygienic and tranquil. The therapist who did the Hamam is called Kalthoum - she was absolutely brilliant. She was very professional, polite, courteous and she made the utmost effort to ensure you are comfortable and to maintain and to maintain as much privacy as possible. I highly recommend Movenpick and Kalthoum.

Lovely week-long trip to Marrakech with our family! Lots of positives, including an excellent kids club with great, motivated and attentive staff. Taha & Abdulkarim at breakfast were fantastic - they took great care of our large group. Thank you!! Amina (housekeeping) was lovely too. Thanks to all who made our stay comfortable :)

I normally stay at the Sofitel when I travel to Marrakech, but due to the hotel being fully booked for part of my stay I decided to try Movenpick for the dates I couldn't stay at the Sofitel. Well It ended up being such a blessing! As Movenpick is now a new favourite place that I will stay when visiting Marrakech! I had a wonderful time! Everyone was so lovely, especially beautiful Nezha at reservations she was extremely professional, helpful and very sweet and she would always greet me with a big smile! I would also like to thank a few other special people like Taha my waiter, he's truly an amazing guy, he seemed to genuinely love his job! Also Kamal the chef, ibtissam and Mahdi they both did the most amazing omelettes for me!! The lovely cleaners Noura and Fatima and finally‚Ä¶

I stayed with my wife begin December 2019 at Movenpick Hotel in Marrakech and was very satisfied about the quality of the hotel and the excellent service. Mr Mohamed (Reception) and colleagues where very professional and helpful. Has an Accor platinum member the Reception Staff treated me accordingly including the room upgrade. Check-in and check-out were quick. The food at the restaurant was excellent and also the staff. Breakfast could in some way a little bit better regarding the choice. The room was very clean. The wifi in the room was not so good especially because I need very good Wi-Fi for my work. LAN was not available. The IT manager have done what was possible to help me and reception told me that next time the Wi-Fi will be ok. I‚Äôm travelling almost every month‚Ä¶

The experience was not 5 star, we paid extra for a room garden view result of it we were next to a big outdoor condenser that we could hear while trying to sleep.. Service is so so... i would not recommend as you will have for a lower price much better alternative arounds...

Spacious rooms well appointed ,beautiful pool with comfortable sun-loungers ,breakfast with healthy freshly squeezed orange juice and delicious omelettes But the most note-worthy factor to mention must be the helpful friendly staff . On arrival after a long day travelling unfortunately our booking couldn't be traced despite being prepaid ,but NEZHA managed to sort the matter out and throughout the remainder of our stay was so helpful in supplying valuable local advice ,always charming with a beautiful smile Thank you Nezha -you made our family visit very special and we look forward to another Xmas in Marrakech

My wife and mother in law stayed here for one night and thoroughly enjoyed our time at Movenpick. Amazing massage from Najia, worry every penny paid! Beautiful spa and jacuzzi with very attentive staff.

Taha and AbdulKarim were fantastic servers. They went above and beyond. Would highly recommend staying here. Very safe and clean and friendly staff. December would be best time to visit you! Don‚Äôt miss out

We stayed at Movenpick Hotel for 4 nights over Christmas and came away very happy with most aspects of the experience. We arrived a couple of hours ahead of the check-in time of 3pm but our room was ready for us and the check-in process was handled quickly and efficiently. The hotel is situated in the new part of the city and some distance from the Medina and main tourist sights so you do need to think about using taxi's or tour company's to get around as its a long walk otherwise and there is not much to see nearby. Our room was one of the classic rooms but it was spacious, clean and well-equipped and the only negative aspect was that our room in block 2 was overlooking a service area with the aircon units and this was periodically very noisy if you had the balcony door‚Ä¶

column3: Excellent place to stay in Marrakech!
column4: One quick story first to tell the sort of place this is: We were a group of 6. We booked 5 nights + half board. Upon our arrival, we found out that our half board plan entitled us to one restaurant only (the brasserie) and that this restaurant was serving Italian food mainly. We like Italian cuisine, but hadn't come to Morocco to have anything but Moroccan cuisine. We complained about this to the reception whilst we were checking in. We saw the Head of Reception Leila taking our disappointment in earnest and doing her best to address our problem. Minutes after this, we received confirmation that the Chef, Tarek, would cook special menus for us. And so he did! We had 5 fantastic dinners cooked specially for us by Tarek and his team. One of the best couscous I ever had, a great‚Ä¶

Mohamed Skiriba was very attentive during our daily breakfast at your lovely hotel. He came round to ask if we needed anything else, tea, coffee etc and was very polite. Breakfast variety was also very good in addition to the top customer service from Mohamed

column3: Wonderful stay at this five star beautiful hotel!
column4: The hotel is beautiful and underwent a major renovation and it shows. Very chic but comfortable. The staff is incredibly attentive and want to do everything to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. I was collected from the airport by the hotel transport that is outstanding. It went flawlessly as it was my first time visiting Marrakech and didn't feel comfortable taking a taxi right away. The cost was affordable for such service. We drove up to the property and I instantly knew this was going to be an experience. Once checked in I was greeted by Asma, who invited to show me around the hotel at my convenience. I'm glad I took her offer and got to learn a lot about the brand and the hotel. To my surprise I was upgraded to a suite, which was truly magnificent for my ten day‚Ä¶

The hotel breakfast is located in a spacious restaurant with nice decor and has quite a few selections including local pastries which I recommend. They also have outstanding service. Our waiters Mohamed Skiriba, Yousafe and Amine Ouzit were very helpful to serve our big family. Thank you!

Wonderful experience. Staff are helpful and friendly. Located in the new part of the city, it's just within walking distance of the Koutubia mosque and Jemaa El Fnaa. The highlight though has to be it's design and amenities. It's spacious and has a lovely pool. Would certainly recommend it.

column3: Quality Breakfast at Movenpick Mansour Eddahbi Hotel
column4: We stayed overnight at Movenpick Hotel, Marrakech and we truly enjoyed our time. The hotel courtyard is beautiful surrounded with hotel building that exudes Morroco's cultural architecture. The people here is also very friendly as we got acquinted with Mohmaed Skiriba and Amine Ouzit, who are serving us well for breakfast.

Excellent spa & hamam treatment/experience provided by Kaltoum. Beutiful Hotel and the service,breakfast buffet,restaurant is excellent. The food quality is very good. I loved my stay here and would recommend anyone coming to marrakech to stay at Movenpick.

We stayed here for 7 nights and no other words other than wow!! We were very satisfied with every aspect of the hotel. When we first checked in we had a very warm welcome, staff at reception desk were very friendly, especially Safae, she went extra lengths to make sure our needs were met, very knowledgeable and professional. Hotel room was beautiful, lovely black marble bathroom very clean. Nasima welcomed us everyday at the breakfast hall with a warm smile, always ready to help. Nasima is an absolute asset to the the hotel, she is extremely professional and really stands out, She is always on hand ready to help her guests in a very professional enthusiastic manner. I don‚Äôt have a bad word to say about this hotel, all the staff are always smiling and helpful and the hotel itself‚Ä¶

I can only recommend this place for those who are thinking about having some days of relax in Marrakech. This place is absolutely amazing and the customer service is outstanding (special mention to Mourad who kindly showed me everything around). I am pretty sure this place is one of the best in Marrakech in terms of quality-price. Rooms: I booked a classic room with a king size bed. Very clean and well equipped. Facilities: they have diverse pools, gym, spa area (they offer special treatments which are quite reasonable in terms of price), boutiques inside the hotel, different restaurants, yoga studio, etc etc. Customer service: As I mentioned above, it is outstanding. The staff is extremely helpful and kind.

Excellent Customer Services was provided by Imane from SPA. She was amazing üòâ... lively and extremely kind in providing services/ assisting. Definitely visit again SPA and ask for her Imane. Thanks B

Spent 4 days here, the rooms were sparkling clean and bed super comfortable. What deserves particular mention is the exceptional service during breakfast from Mohamed Skiriba who greeted us every morning and paid particular attention to each of our preferred hot drinks and had them ready for us at the table before we even sat down to eat. Great young man along with all the other staff at the hotel. Not a bad word can be said about our experience.

with arts every where. Very big lobby without any guests. The garden is green all over and beautiful! There are few pools and a lot of benches, for many guests! The staff is very friendly and helpful! Breakfast is good the Coffee shop ok. The distance from the airport is 4 km. Only the room service needs a upgrade. Our refrigerator has wine but no corkscrew. We asked few times for one, at end we got one, but took us few calls ! They prefer to send some waiter to open the small bottle of wine. Second morning we wait until 3pm to clean our suite. Few calls and walk to the lobby helps finally ! Excuse was we have so many guests! But we are guest too! Our suite is costly for Marrakech. We are still at the M√∂venpick and we want to enjoy our last night! We lived many years in‚Ä¶

column3: Wonderful staff, beautiful facility and great location
column4: I visited Marrakech for the first time with my family and I sincerely hope to be back soon and will definitely be staying at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and were keen to ensure we had a good stay. The hotel has a few pools, spa, yoga, restaurants, bars etc. On checking in, Hanane was very welcoming and set the scene for a lovely stay. She was caring and made sure our room was spacious enough for our family of 4. She was also there on checking out to say her goodbyes. The hotel has a lovely kid's club where we were able to leave the kids for hours while we had a relaxing holiday. The club is managed by Nehza who was absolutely caring and looked after the kids like they were hers. They were well fed and engaged in all sorts of activities (all free) The kids kept‚Ä¶

Beautiful hotel, would highly recommend it! Some days we preferred to stay in the hotel. Food is great, service is great and surroundings! Couldn‚Äôt ask for more. Mohammed Amine provided us with the best service I‚Äôve ever had. Lovely man, well mannered, well presented, always attentive. He is a great advocate for the hotel!

I stayed in October 2019 in this hotel. I would like to share my experience that I enjoyed from the moment I arrived. The hotel is outstanding located by Hivernage, where plenty of other hotels are. The rooms were very clean the staff were very helpful and especially Abdeltif one of the front desk memebers went out of his way to help for everything. "Thank you again for this memorable stay and if ever I come back to Marrakeck my stay stay will be in Movenpick Hotel."

We stayed here for 4 nights and the stay was perfect! When we checked in we got a warm welcome,Hind at the reception desk was very helpfull and we got an upgrade! The room service was very good,Noura and her team was very kind. Shower facility was excellent! The Breakfast was very good with a lot of different choices. Nassima welcomed us every day to the breakfast hall with a big smile and she answered all our questions about the city every morning! Meriam,Shiham,Mohammed and Abdel Karim was equaly helpful. A very big thanks to Naima,she is an asset to the organisation and very professional on her approach when dealing with hotel guests.She gave us personal attention for our breakfast and drink requirements,she is sincere to her work. Also very kind was Med Aimad and Lahcen! My‚Ä¶

column3: "Brilliant 5 Star Experience " from a frequent traveller !
column4: Excellent stay at this Hotel - An experience to remember - Warm welcome at the reception desk and service with a smile - Mohssin at Reception Desk was very helpful and accomodating for any requests . Room size was big and very comfortable - shower facility was excellient . Breakfast was very good with varied choice and Abdelikarim giving us personal attention for our drink requirements .Messaoud Mohammed served us well . Special mention to Douaa from Human Resources - She is an asset to the organisation - very professional in her approach to dealing with hotel guests and her people skills are excellent - her interaction with the guests is on friendly terms and her local knowledge helps the guests to experience Marrakech and the hotel facilities in the most enjoyable way . ‚Ä¶

We really enjoyed Movenpick hotel for several reasons : the hotel ( bar, swimming pool , spa , ..) is just great. The room is big and comfortable! Breakfast is excellent : big thanks to the lady and gentleman who made us excellent eggs ! Also special mention for the relaxing massage of Imane at the Spa : Imane takes really good care of you ! Also Hind from the reception desk made sure we had a great welcome and good advice during our stay ! Just one last advise : the crepes marrocaines are delicious !!

I stayed at the hotel for more than three weeks for business. The breakfast is a highlight, though I wouldn't recommend the restaurants for dinner. I found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Special thanks to the team of "service du soin": Nezhatari Touri, Roqia Eloussoul, Sedki Khadija, Elhilali Khadija, Elmachmachi Amina, you made my home away from home!

This is a brilliant hotel with amazing service. The staff are all extremely helpful, in particular Yusuf who is part of the breakfast team has been amazing. After the first day he already knew what hot drink we wanted and brought them over without us even having to ask for it. Highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Marrakech. Location is great too!

We stayed 7 nights for a golf holiday. No matter where you stay you will always find something to critisize, but really I cannot think of anything at all we were unhappy about. It is a massive hotel arranged in blocks and as a result impersonal. After 7 days we did not really know any of the staff at all, but that was fine. Remi on reception was very helpful indeed, as was every single staff member we met. They could not have been more helpful, respectful and kind. The breakfast is superb, the best we have had anywhere, and the impressive boss of that service runs it like clockwork and clearly commands huge respect from his staff. The rooms, sheets, cleaning, pool etc etc were without fault. We relaxed poolside late afternoon and whilst it was crowded at times there was no‚Ä¶

I stayed at the hotel for 4 weeks. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. Ghizlane was particularly amazing, attentive, gentle, professional and thorough. She and the service staff keep the luxury standing of this hotel.

I‚Äôve been to several Movenpicks around the world but this one came on top, good servicing, great food and the rooms very clean. I knew that is was going to be a great experience in This hotel from the receptionist and all the efforts she did to make our waiting time a joy. Thank you Nezha for your time and dedication, your recommendations were very helpful during our stay in Marrakech. Hope to comeback soon

I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for a business trip. I was surprised by the new renovated hotel called now the Movenpick. They renovated the rooms which are very clean and well decorated. They have spacious bathroom with beautiful marble. the bed was also very comfortable. The service exceeded my expectations. all the staff was professional, helpful et smiling which is very important. I had an amazing service at breakfast. Taha who is one of the staff who took good care of us. he was very nice and gave us great service. I highly recommend this hotel.

Thank you Movenpick for this amazing week @ the International Film Festival. It was unforgettable. Thanks to the cleaning services people who were so kind to us during our stay. Thank you Khadija El Hilali, Amina Mechmchi and Samira Zouhil üåπüåπüåπ

I stayed in this hotel for one night, and it exceeded my expectations. The property is well maintained and I loved the classic d√©cor. Room was spacious with a nice view on the garden and pool. The staff I interacted with was friendly and professional. I would especially like to thank Amine the Concierge for his helpful tips and for finding me a great tour guide. Lahcen from the Concierge Desk was also very friendly and attentive. I would stay again!

I was there for a business and I have not much time to explore the city and its restaurants that's why I wanted to eat in the hotel I slept in. Simply Great experience with a splendid service especially at the Level of food. Haven't regret it thank you

I had an amazing Hamam experience with Keltoum who scrubbed away all of the dead skin making me feel brand new. I then had an amazing back massage with Bouchra - so good I actually fell asleep. Thank you so much for making me have a restful holiday!!

We came late at the restaurant the Urban Brasserie and the manager took us in without rushing the food or service. We came back every single night during our stay as the drinks and the ambiance were too satisfaction. Thank you again for the all team and their management.

We were staying in Movempick Marrakech and we had one of the best meals in the Urban Brasserie Restaurant. The service was excellent and the welcoming of their manager Jawad was just perfect and made us feel like we're home so thank you because it was a special occasion 20th anniversary. We ate there every day during our stay and service and food was consistently great. Thank you for make our stay memorable and we will definitely come back. And of course we will miss the food!!

If your looking for 5 star service then this is not the place. We stayed there for 6 nights and had multiple issues, during the night our shower went off by itself multiple times. I told the manager Amin who was very hard to get a hold of then finally when we did speak to him he was very dismissive of the issue and didn‚Äôt have any empathy of the fact that we both had a sleepless night and as a result told us we could change rooms with no upgrade offered, this was on day 5 so we asked him to send a technician to fix the problem which was fixed finally. He then offered us a drink at the bar, I was horrified by his response and refused that and said you should be offering us a lot more than a drink he then went onto say well you can have a meal. I‚Äôm sorry but if I can afford to‚Ä¶

We stayed here for 5 nights as a family with half board for my daughters birthday. Location was great, located centrally in Marrakech all the touristic sights were 5-10 mins away by taxi. Hotel room and layout was superb, staff were all very kind and really attentive during our stay. Breakfast was excellent a wide variety of foods to choose from, great selection for kids too. Pool and gym facilities were good and the small lounge restaurants nearby were convenient for grabbing a small snack during the day. If your looking to relax and unwind from the madness of the medina then the Hotel Spa is where you want to be, its fantastic and my wife loved her treatments there, would highly recommend it. The kids club was the best thing for my 4 year old daughter, all the team looked‚Ä¶

One of the best spa treatments i‚Äòve Ever had. I had a 30 min Massage Done By BOUCHRA in the spa area. She has done a excellent job. The spa area is very pleseant and all of the treatments are top. I was Here for 1 week and all of my Treatments were Done By Bouchra! Just ask for her!!

I was surprised with a full body massage with Bouchra at Movenpick and she was very lovely, professional and I feel very relaxed. We arrived late for our appointment however the manager allowed us to come through and still gave us a smile. I would return here.

Stayed two nights whilst on tour. Comfortable rooms with outside balcony. Huge hotel to walk around, delicious breakfast, walking distance to shopping centre with food court, and other restaurants near hotel too. Money changers also plentiful.

Stayed at the hotel with my family for a week, and felt like at home. Very clean rooms, excellent breakfast variety and very friendly and detailed service. Had lunch at the pool restaurant several times, and got a great service and they even remembered all my family‚Äôs names! Delicious cocktails and very friendly service at the hotel bar, where we had drinks daily before dinner. Tried the Italian restaurant twice, and my family and I loved it. Overall very personalized service throughout the hotel , and will definitely come back next year. Thank you Movenpick Marrakesh for making our stay a memorable one

Provided room was quite good but being next to Lift that caused lot of noises every 2 -3 minutes. It was very disturbing mainly at night. Having raised issue to Laela Haily, Supervisor who was very considerate and helpful, changed room to Suit room. It was very commendable of her action. Room cleaners Rogia, Khadija, Nezha who were very very listening and leaving room spotless and attentive to our requests. They are really very good to her assignment. Morning breakfast along with waiters and waitress were great. Hence overall our stay for 7 days was fantastic.

Luxury at its best ., breakfast buffet was amazing and delicious. People at reception like ottoman helped us to book dinner at best dining places , Fatima zahra served us with great hospitality at breakfast . The facilities of spa , Hammam were outstanding. Will visit again

The Movenpick is a beautiful hotel set in a great location in Marrakesh. Its a quick walk to the mall and to the bus station. The breakfast is amazing and the artwork is breathtaking. When you enter the lobby, the smell is lovely and everything is just perfect. However, the best part of the hotel was the staff, on our second day we visited the Medina and I left my phone in the taxi. We attempted to chase down the taxi to no avail. I had lost hope, but later that evening I went to the lobby and the three girls (Nezha, Afaf, and Hind) helped me track my phone via Find my phone, in addition, they used their personal phones to try and ring my international number. Story short, two additional guys one named Faisal, and the other guy who translated for my husband also helped.‚Ä¶

A week with my friend in movenpick . From the frist moment de felt very welcome. Afaf and leila from the reception were very kind, professional and helpful, Otman too . We enjoyed every moment, a place of 1001 nights. The junior suit was fantastic. We will definitely come back. Thanks to amina, Rokia and Khadija for the fantastic care. An absolute must...

column3: Amazing stay and amazingly thoughtful staff!
column4: My stay was absolutely fantastic. I would like to say a very special thank you to Hanane from reception, Nora from Housekeeping and Imad (the best Bellboy) - they made my birthday super special by surprising me by singing happy birthday to when I entered my room - I‚Äôll honestly never forget it. They all deserve every kind of bonus available. The food was great, the room was fantastic, the staff were awesome - I‚Äôll definitely be back again insha Allah. Thank you so much again for making my birthday weekend so special. Tosin

I was so glad I booked this hotel when I arrived. It was beautiful and it really felt like you were at a five star resort which was a great start to the holiday. It has several pools, restaurants, onsite shops, funky modern art and a spa. It is also in a good central location within 10 minutes taxi ride to Jemma El Fina and the popular clubs and high end restaurants. It's also a 10 minute walk from Menara Mall which is a modern shopping mall with many shops and restaurants. The best thing about the hotel are the staff. They are very hospitable and friendly but I'd like to make a special mention for Nezha who was really welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble so it really made our stay enjoyable and memorable and I'm really looking forward to going back and booking‚Ä¶

Great hotel. The facility is absolutely beautiful. The service was top notch. Really enjoyed my stay. I would like to give a special shout out to Med Admine, a server in the restaurant. He went above and beyond to make sure me and my friends were well serviced. Thank you Med Admine!!!

column3: A very nice resort style hotel
column4: We stayed at this hotel as a part of a tour. This is a very nice hotel with multiple pools, restaurants and a poolside bar. It is located in an area of large hotels. The Medina is walkable but a long walk. You would probably want to take a taxi to the Medina and back if you want to visit it, It is a resort style of a hotel and there were a lot of families there. If that is what you are looking for, this is a great choice for a hotel. If you are looking for a hotel that is convenient to get to the Medina, there would be more convenient hotels.

The walk up the hotel reception is just something else! This hotel impressed me for the price I paid! I was checked in by HANAN who upgraded us to a suite and was very helpful! SAID the concierge was friendly and gave great information! Thanks to you both - they gave insightful information that was good value for money. Hotel breakfast was a good variety. 5-6pm was chocolate hour at reception - free chocolate and biscuits! I‚Äôd pay double what I paid for this hotel easily! See you all again soon!

column3: Best service ever...üòç with Mohammed amin
column4: He make me feel very comfortable, and I felt like home ... I will definitely came back here thanks to him... He‚Äôs service was super nice and kind. The hotel is very clean and nice. Hope to find him again here.

column3: This hotel made my stay very enjoyablew
column4: From the second I checked in, the staff at this hotel made my stay very enjoyable and smooth. The customer service was impeccable - from the staff ensuring you are comfortable and happy to recommending the best foods and places. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms are a good size with comfortable beds you struggle to get out of in the morning haha. Whilst staying here, all the staff were helpful but mainly Brahim who would look after us in the morning by serving us moroccan tea and checking to see if we wanted anything else, to a lady called Naima who was very kind and ensured our stay was of not only the best.

Good morning, Just to say Brahim the waiter at the food hall was so amazing! Always welcoming and helpful. Always attended to our needs. The hotel as a whole was amazing. Housekeeper however don‚Äôt really speak English so it was abit hard but overall 5*!!

Just left the spa and had to recommend khadija for massage. The hotel is great. The beds are like clouds. The pool is like a bath. Breakfast, whilst a little frantic is good. The room behind the pool bar with the massive chairs was like a place to curl up and sleep. And when you‚Äôre relaxed, there‚Äôs chocolate hour!! Great find and would certainly return.

I just loved my stay at this lovely hotel my four day stay I just wished it was longer the staff here were the most friendly I‚Äôve ever come across right from day one I was greeted by a very friendly host Naseema who showed me everything around the breakfast hall Fatima zahra a sweet young waitress couldn‚Äôt do enough for us nothing was too much trouble and everything with a smile brahim was equally good and Dua who I believe was in charge of the HR was very professional and actually helped us to extend our stay as our flight was quite late in the evening a true gem in the midst of Marrakesh

I want to thanks M√ñVENPICK for their welcoming Also and especially i want to thanks MERIEM MAZL & OUMAIMA BEN LABSIN for their services and hospitality. #MyRoomSmellSoFresh&Clean You guys have made my days better, thanks a lot.

5 days stay in October, full hotel, but the service was still impeccable! Clean and comfortable rooms! Helpful and kind staff! Full international breakfast but also full of Moroccan specialties! All great! But I especially wanted to thank the gym staff who knew how to fulfill my daughter's needs perfectly, competently and attentively. we had a suite for 5 people, and it was wonderful, cared for in every little detail from rose petals to flowers and the ever-present macarone decorated with funny emojis that the children loved!

column3: Salaheddine the worst employee on the Hotel
column4: If you want to enjoy your stay.avoid any contact with this person.so rude doesnt know how to speak with the clients.infortunately there is a lot of good hotels at marrakech.never come back.No thanks..

column3: Amazing Hotel, Staff very well trained
column4: We stayed last week in hotel Movenpick , family holiday. The Staff are very well trained , profissional and helpeful. My mother and daugther were sick and we could saty 2.5 hours after check out in room , thanks to the reception and the wonderful cleaning women which were so careful with us. I speak about Jamila and Noura, wonderful professional which made everything that we felt better. They were amazing , how effort made for us. I will be grateful forever . The SPA is great , massage there is full recommended. GYM is very well equipped , fabulous Trainer Abderahim prepare 1.5 hours training focus on lose stress , he is highly qualified and friendly. Hotel location close is close to shopping several restaurants. I was well impressed with this hotel and will come again Next‚Ä¶

We had a family holiday and stayed at the movenpick which I had previously been before and again the service was excellent. The staff especially the waiting staff Layla and her colleagues made us feel so welcome the Chef even accommodated for us, the manager sorted a problem out very quickly and efficiently! We all loved it including the children and definitely will be back again God willing.

I stayed at the Movenpick hotel for 3 days between October 21st to October 23rd, I checked out because I was planning to stay in different hotel for experience. The hotel I changed to didn't meet up my expectation so I decided to go back to Movenpick, all the rooms were pretty much booked at the Movenpick, How ever the reception girl Hannane who was super friendly and have helped us few times with our staying and places tips, have put more effort to assist us of finding room. I do appreciate this great service this girl have offered us even they were super busy on that day, all hotel team were super friendly and helpful and they always put the time to answer your questions but Hannane was absolutely a person that made things happened and made us appreciate how this hotel value‚Ä¶

Really like the hotel. The junior suite was spacious and very clean. What lets this hotel down is the service in the bars and restaurants. The pool bar service is particularly bad as the staff just want to huddle at the side of the bar talking rather than serving. You could die of thirst waiting for a drink. Very poor.

column3: International chain with a Moroccan twist
column4: Positives about this place: - Impressive entrance and interior design which gives an image of Moroccan grandeur - Large selection of food at breakfast buffet which stays till 10:30. I sincerely appreciate the young gentlemen who prepares the eggs (he can make a very delicious omelette). - Clean and spacious rooms - AMAZING and highly resourceful concierge. Mr. Amine is truly a gem in this place. He truly presents a 5 star experience with his positive and warm attitude. He is very attentive to all guests and the Movenpick is truly lucky to have him on board. - Great location. Safe in the Eglise area of Marrakech. Negatives (potential to improve): - Slow check-in and check-out (they really need to improve their reception service) - Huge property. We were not aware of this! Our‚Ä¶

column3: Nice Hotel with lots of potential but not five star
column4: There is a lot to like about the Movenpick Marrakech - Superior rooms are of a good standard. Breakfast is excellent. The pool area is spacious. Pool and cleaning staff are extremely conscientious and friendly. We had nice meals at the various Resturants. Notable employees included Ghizlane from the cleaning staff, Hind at reception and the lady who made the Omelettes. However there are a number of things which lets this hotel down badly but notably Reception staff - genearlly have little attention to customers needs. On one day, we asked for assistance about a tour to the Majorelle Gardens and was told to look at the internet or come back the next day when the concierge would be available. Even worst on checkout, we were asked to stand in a separate queue and were left‚Ä¶

Having never experienced a Hammam before I didn‚Äôt really know what to expect. The staff at √î De Rose on the M√∂venpick Hotel, Marrakech are all very accommodating and welcoming. I was given water and tea before my treatment and made to feel at home. Then I was put in the very capable and reassuring hands of Kaltoum, who very professionally provided a detoxifying, relaxing and cleansing Hammam experience I will never forget and will definitely have again! For anyone wondering about Hammams, I can certainly recommended having one, especially at the wonderful venue √î De Rose and I hope you are lucky enough to meet and be treated by Kaltoum. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüßñüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüôè

It has been three months in Morocco and have not found a better tech than Najia. To anyone visiting whether or pleasure be sure to request Ms. Najia for your services, and the reasons why I would come back to M√∂venpick Marrakech.

column3: What a great pleasant surprise for such a huge hotel.
column4: Great surprise for an extended weekend in Marrakech. Every year we celebrate our honeymoon. Having stayed in Marrakech many times before like the Mamounia and different Riads in the Madina. we didn‚Äôt know what to expect and are pleasantly surprised. Despite the hotel being so huge it doesn‚Äôt feel that way, the spacious rooms are spread of a number of Villas, the walkways are surrounded by lush greens and great lighting. Plenty of pools, from large to small. Breakfast is amazing, difficult to restrain oneself from eating too much, the fresh made orange juice and Moroccan pancakes where my favorite. We had dinner at the hotel for our first night, too tired to go out, it was exceptional especially the service. Special thanks to Hasna in reservations, the front desk, i wish i got‚Ä¶

Lovely hotel with lots of hidden treasures by way of art work and decor of the public areas. Just loved the ambiance of the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Stayed in the main block and the lift was a bit hard to find initially - all part of the fun!. My room didn't quite live up to the rest of the hotel. Despite being a non-smoking room it smelled of stale cigarette smoke and was rather small. Loved the rest of the hotel so much I didn't really mind. Truly awesome breakfast spread with a wide array of continental and Moroccan dishes. Nice pool area with a resort feel which could get a bit noisy during the day with the loud music played by a DJ. However there were several other pools including a quiet one near the spa. Several different eating options available within‚Ä¶

Definitely highly recommend this hotel. Very comfortable, friendly attentive staff and excellent food. The rooms are spacious and the beds heavenly! Gorgeous black marble bathroom with separate loo. Also the hotel is very quiet. We had a massage which was lovely, the spa and gym facilities are beautiful. As you walk through the hotel you are surrounded with gorgeous smells. It‚Äôs about a 10 min taxi ride to the M√©dina, there were always taxis outside. There is a street next to the hotel that has modern restaurants and a supermarket. If I went back to Marrakech I‚Äôd stay here again.

Just fabulous,the staff were very helpful and friendly specially MRS harbi saida ,she makes us feeling very welcoming and also she provides us everything we need for our kids in Mehdi,we really apreciate the quality of the service and how clean were the suit,absolutly i r√©cord it

Special thanks to coach Abdou au centre de remise en forme Movenpick Marrakech Kind helpful and so professional always here to help and show u the right steps Thanks Abdou again for ur help and kindness

column3: Beautiful Nice Hotel with Unfair Service Treatment
column4: The hotel it's impressive from the arrival. The architecture and the forniture and decoration it's amazing in all corners. But, to check in with a non smiling reception staff that takes 350‚Ç¨ from you credit card as deposit without warning firstly, it's not a good start. Another collegues travelling with me were taken up to 900‚Ç¨, this while our accomodation was previously paid. So they charge as they feel with the excuse that this way you have money in the room account to pay any orders at the bars or restaurants. This is another point to review. The prices of the food and beverage it's simply too expensive. 9‚Ç¨ for a glass of house wine or 7‚Ç¨ for a local beer it's too much in a slow and not smiling service. About the service, as low is the job position as more as they smile and‚Ä¶

The Kids Club Staff is very nice and friendly and professionel. Program varies every day. Rest of the hotel is pretty old. Pool area not maintained. Spa staff professional but premises neglected. Spa Manager is missing. Watch out mainly Conferences and reception staff is not very friendly.

I came here with a Gate 1 tour and was very impressed by the grounds and public areas. It's beautiful to walk around and discover all the art work and decor. The room was nice, mostly average with weak air conditioning. The bed was very comfy. I did the Royal Hammam treatment in the spa which was a unique experience. Not totally relaxing because it's a serious exfoliation, but the spa set up was lovely and the attendant gave good service. My only gripe was the service at the pool bar as it was slow and not attentive. I had to finally get up and ask for the check at the bar because the server never came back. I did get a margherita pizza there and it was pretty tasty. I think you'll be pleased to stay at the hotel and only a couple minor adjustments would make it 5 star.

column3: Rooms are fine ac is missing
column4: The hotel is fine the rooms are nice the breakfast is fine the one criticism is the AC was practically off Even after service by maintenance that got the air flow to work there was still no cooling effect from the noisy unit

Wow - modern large hotel with great Moorish touches. Impressive pool, very professional staff, wonderful food and easy walk / taxi to many other restaurants and sights. Wonderful public areas, comfortable discrete seating - recommended!

Great hotel and staff, the pool is amazing, Abdelkarime et Mohammed Amine looked after us with big smile everytime, they where warm, friendly and helpful. Thanks to both of you and thank movenpick....

I travel for work a lot, and I stay at chain hotel most of the times. I have never been disappointed at all using Movenpick Marrakech. Thanks for the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception personnel, namely Nezha, she‚Äôs been incredibly helpful which I am great full for. She‚Äôs an asset to Movenpick Marrakech, praise her. The breakfast was also my top highlight. The buffet has almost everything you need. The coffee is sooooo good. The staff were helpful especially the smiley lady I don‚Äôt remember her name. She‚Äôs great.

column3: Restaurant at breakfast... excellent service Mohammed Amin and Karim were superb
column4: I come here regularly and breakfast is always a pleasure. Hotel a real maze but beautiful. Porters excellent too. No complaints. The pool and the pool bar really nice , very comfortable . You must try the pancake at breakfast it‚Äôs delicious.

Beautiful hotel in a great location. Only 15 mins from the airport. Staff are very attentive. Special shout out to Taha in the breakfast room, he was superb. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Be careful with the taxis outside the hotel (or anywhere in Marrakesh). The guys on the front door to the hotel can advise a ball park figure for what you should be paying which is handy. Make sure you agree the price before getting in the cab. Once you are in, enjoy the ride, because the way the traffic flows and driving is an experience.

5 star hotel and service. Ideally located. The breakfast was truly marvelous and had everything that one could wish for in the morning. The servers were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends visiting Marrakech.

Booked as a 60th birthday present the hotel went out of their way to make it a very memorable experience. We arrived late morning but recognising very quickly that we would have caught an early flight and would be hungry, Mohammed (Manager) from the restaurant treated us like guests in his home. Despite the breakfast service being over with he served us everything he thought we would like. On arrival our room was upgraded to a suite, and during the stay the hotel had arranged for the room to be decorated, and a cake to celebrate. Waited on like royalty every morning by the waiters at breakfast and the staff at reception always offering exceptional service, there was no single thing one could fault or complain about. Thank you to all at the hotel whose path we crossed,‚Ä¶

Hi! this was my first time visiting Marrakesh, Morroco and I had the pleasure to stay in this awesome M√∂venpick Hotel. I just want to share my unforgettable experience since day one of my arrival.....I was greeted by the Hotel staff with a very friendly smile. I want to point out specially every morning in the Restaurant when I was having my Breakfast a waiter a very young nice looking man approached to my table and a very polite way he introduced himself as Mohamed Skiriba. He asked me how are you Madan ? And if I want a coffee. For the three mornings that I have a breakfast there he with his kindness really made me feel like at home. This Hotel itself is amazing, beautiful, comfortable, relaxing, but with the upstanding service by the charming and friendly employees like‚Ä¶

I visited the hotel in September with my mum and it was amazing from the beginning. The decor is stunning, the staff were attentive and welcoming but one particularly stood out for us. His name was Mohammed Amine and he went to every length to ensure all our needs were met during breakfast. He‚Äôs a fantastic waiter and really made our stay all the more enjoyable. The hotel are lucky to have to him on board! The rooms were really nice too, well air conditioned and clean! The house keeping staff always fulfilled our requests too which was perfect! Overall we‚Äôd rate our stay very good and we would definitely recommend staying here; we both really enjoyed ourselves. The only downside was everything you pay for within the hotel, whether it‚Äôs food/massage etc is a lot more expensive‚Ä¶

The Hannah bath was something to die for. The 90 minute massage was excellent. The therapist were sincere in assisting. My wife and I were happy with our treatments. We forgot we were in another country and we wanted to book another appointment immediately.

column3: Kids club at M√∂venpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi
column4: Words can not express our gratitude to the ladies from the kids club, namely, Nezha, Zahira, Touria and NouJoud. Not only did they look after our son with care and attention. They also organised a birthday party for our son at a very short notice, which he celebrated with his international friends.The ladies did an amazing job, which exceeded our expectations, we are truly grateful. Thank you again ladies, and keep up the great work. We look forward to seeing you again on our next visit.

column3: Very, very good! (And it is not too big!)
column4: Very good hotel, service and location. Beautifully decorated and nice garden and pool. Super friendly staff. It has a large number of rooms, but it feels like a much smaller and cosier hotel. I can really recommend this place.

Excellent service here! The front desk agents (Nezha & Souhail) and the restaurant staff at Urban Brasserie were friendly and helpful. The pools were never crowded so it was plenty relaxing. We had two adjoining rooms - with a lot of space and a back patio for each room. Bathrooms were extremely spacious I could do yoga in it. The only thing I would be wary of are the taxi cab drivers that linger outside of the hotel looking for someone to overcharge for a ride to the Medina. With careful bargaining you can avoid the switch and bait. However, this should not deter Western travelers from enjoying this beautiful place (it's only a small nuance which you'll laugh about later).

Namaste! I stayed at your property during the PURE Travel event and I really liked the hotel for its central location, large rooms and good service. I would especially like to thank Bouchra, Front office, for the help extended to me during my stay. I will certainly book myself here for next years event.

column3: Customer service, timeliness and 5 star standards
column4: I am on my 6th out of 8 day stay at the M√∂venpick Marrakech. The hotel‚Äôs entrance is quite grand which gives a good first impression to guests. However the standard goes downhill from there pretty quickly. 1. 4 out of the 5 staff at the Jamra restaurant are rather abrupt. Service is very slow, and inefficient regardless whether busy or not. That was my first stop to grab a light lunch after I had checked in. I returned the next day for a quick bite in between outings. Same experience: forgotten to set my table whilst I was waiting. Had to go and get salt and pepper from another table, olive oil from the main counter..I have not gone back there since. Visit was @afternoon of Sunday 8th September around 3pm and again on Monday 10th September at the same time. Needless to say I‚Ä¶

column3: Not my kind of 5 star hotel
column4: Not sure how this is considered a 5 star hotel but it doesnt fly by my standards. I met 2 friendly staff members and thats about it. The hotel room is small, okay, however the shower pressure or just the shower head was so poor that my head was basically against the wall in order to get water on my head. The hose that is next to the toilet was broken and broken on the wall as well. The toilet stopped working at one point and didnt flush and my biggest concern was the the sliding door (we were on the first floor) didnt even shut / lock. I couldnt sleep the entire night knowing that the door was just open. zero security around the premises (unlike the four seasons). Our suitcases were lost so we had to keep calling out to call our credit card company and airline and we had to call‚Ä¶

I spent 6 days at the hotel, and during working days, we left our son in the Kids Club. All the ladies there were extremely friendly! Our kid loved to go there, and when he arrived, he hugged them. I would like to thank Touria, Nezha that were very friendly and took special care of our son. And specially Zahira, who was taking care of our son most days! Thanks a lot, and next time we are back, we know we have an amazing place to leave our son! Regarding the place, is quite big, it has different type of games, for different ages. And everything seems to be very baby and toodler friendly!

We're staying here for a trade show in the attached convention centre - this is definitely not a place I would choose to stay at otherwise if it weren't for the convenience of it. Most of the staff are friendly, but don't ask for anything one minute past their "closing time" because you won't get it... I had to beg for just a glass of wine after a long day of work and literally one minute past their closing time of 6:45 pm. We had dinner at their restaurant one night - it was buffet style and all the left overs that we had been served for lunch that same day. Housekeeping is never consistent and comes at all different times, half does your room and then comes back again. I never get the coffee / sugar / cream supplied in the same fashion every day. There's always something‚Ä¶

I booked an hour facial just to get relaxed after been jet lagged going for a few days. What a great decision as it was one of the best facials I've ever had (and trust me i've done facials at several luxury, 5-star resorts throughout the world)! Khadija was my therapist. She did such a phenomenal job I immediately went to the reception and booked her for a full body massage. Khadija is amazing and very knowledgable. If you ever get the chance I highly recommend the spa services and please make sure you ask for Khadija as you won't regret it!

I had the pleasure to have my hair done by a very professional stylist, Ms Khadija at the hair salon at the Moevenpick. I highly recommend her, she is amazing! I will surely come back and ask for her next time!

Housekeeping rather poor, bathroom not very clean. A very noisy hotel more like a Spanish party hotel for teenagers. Tiny balcony. Expensive drinks & wine with prices not consistent from one eating & drinking venue to another. A very nice spa pool & terrace away from the rest of the noisy & crowded hotel leisure areas. Certainly not a 5star hotel experience.

After reading some of the reviews I was a bit skeptical about staying new in this hotel however from when we got there till the end of our stay the service was beyond amazing and everyone was so helpful and polite. We also had dinner in the hotel which was amazing and the breakfast was delicious every morning too. We also stayed in a superior room with a garden view and the view was beautiful! Would definitely recommend staying in this hotel and would love to come back again :)

Excellent service, she is very good at the job. She is every experienced and deserves to be rewarded. She is a good professional. She is friendly and kind and offered me water. I will recommend her to all my friends and family and I will definitely come back.Her name is Najia.

Good time and quality massage. You should try!!!everything was excellent, good atmosphere and perfect techiques. Once in a lifetime experience. She is a great person and a great professional. You will wish the massage it will last forever:)) try it, you will never forget!!!

column3: Movenpick Marrakesh is simply the best!
column4: My family enjoyed our stay at this very beautiful Movenpick hotel. The decor, grounds, ambience and service is outstanding. The hotel is very well located near the airport as well as in close access to the city center and easy access to transportation. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The restaurants were also exceptionally nice. Shout out to the beautiful and very professional staff at the front desk - Laila, Nadia and Hind. They helped to make our stay very pleasant indeed!

About breakfast lady FATIMA EZZAHRA at MOROCCON TEA service at Movenpick Very nice girl excellent service always smiling Well done Really impress with every person here Very nice ppl Really like the service

Me and my friends stayed here for 4 nights in the junior suites. The hotel is in a great location, scores of restaurants and the mall close by. It is also close to the airport around 10-15mins via taxi which is great after travelling all day so you can get to your room and relax asap. NOT in our case, we arrived at the hotel around 8pm and our rooms were not ready. I found this absurd as that room would have been empty when the previous guests checked out at the very latest 11am that day. Reception simply told us to wait in the lobby. I was not happy and after complaining was offered a drink. I said I'm hungry after a long day of travelling and to the hotels credit they gave us pizzas and drinks by the pool free of charge. The junior suites were incredible inside,‚Ä¶

Excellent experience at the SPA this afternoon. Special thanks to Khadija massage and Touriya Goumez. A service worthy of the quality standards of a movenpick. Very good location at the city center near to Menara Mall

This hotel should never be a 5 star. Maybe maybe it should be a 4 star. All over booking places it says family hotel, that‚Äôs ok, because it‚Äôs lots of pools. So you think that‚Äôs no problem. But this hotel should be named to Movenpick KIDS hotel. Way to many kids. And the hotel is big. There is not enough sun beds at all! People wake up at 8 in the morning and ‚Äúreserves‚Äù the beds, even the swim guards reserves for family‚Äôs and they get paid by them! This is very annoying, and the hotel just accept it! The breakfast is the same every day! The rooms are old, the aircoindition in the rooms sounds like a jet engine. It‚Äôs a a lot of loud music at night. I recommend this hotel ONLY for family‚Äôs with kids! This hotel is just hyped up by the name.

column3: De Rose Hammam and Spa a must.
column4: Having not had a hammam experience before I found Julia to be exceptional at guiding me through the elaborate process brilliantly. The 5 minute steam followed by a series of vigorous scrubbing and rinsing left years of dead skin on the cool marble slab I was lying on. Julia had firm hands and a ready smile which added to the whole relaxing experience. Now I just need to add hammam to my beauty routine regularly! Thank you Julia!

I have stayed in this hotel many times during the past 3 years, this year for several weeks. After 43 years in aviation and close to 100 hotel nights per year, this hotel is certainly on my top 10 list with regards to value for money. The facilities and restaurants are hard to match, but what impresses me most is the friendliness of the staff. Aspecially the pool staff, but also cleaners, reception and waiters appears to be top motivated and always receive you with a smile. Whatever you need they will provide it, always with a pleasant attitude and some kind words. I can most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially frequent travellers.

column3: No air conditioning and lots of noise
column4: PROS: The hotel and grounds are lovely. The staff of the restaurant and restaurant was extremely good. Unfortunately, those positives end there. CONS: Where do I start? There were two major issues with this property. NOISE: Until about 12:30am there is extremely loud banging that goes on from the music they play downstairs. This music wasn‚Äôt that much of a bother to me because I stay up until late and it happens at other properties. If you are a light sleeper, DO NOT stay here! HOT ROOMS: Marrakesh tends to be pretty warm in the summer. The first room I had, 1303 was extremely hot. They sent in engineering, which brought the temperature to 25C (about 78/79F). I stayed the night and while touring, I asked my tour manager to call and ask them if the issue was solved. ‚Ä¶

I am staying here on business. the hotel on first sight looks nice enough with separate buildings and a pseudo Moroccan architectural design. The interior is a strange mixture of oversized furniture and bizarre decor. There is a large and smaller swimming pool with bars attached, the problem is the larger pool is dominated by a sound system that plays continuous loud music throughout the day and night! It can be heard from 200 metres away and means one can't have the window open without the incessant noise ruining one's time off. It seems bizarre such a hotel that appeals to everyone has this policy more suited to a 20-30 something age group. I'm only glad I'm not paying to stay here. Other than that, things are okay, the staff are nice, but it took an inordinate amount of time‚Ä¶
