Very bad connection with the hotel by phone and when the receptioniste called from our hotel to the pool they said it is only for hotel guests. On the website it says that it is possible but on the phone it was not. Bad service

impressively splendid kidz club, friendly and approachable staff. Well led, supervisor is apprachable and always smilling Great hotel to choose if you have children Suitable up to 12 years old My daughter Suraya loved it, full of fun and every day different activities I would not hesitate to recommend to families with children Well done team - Keep it up

Wonderful hotel. Very convenient I enjoyed everything in the hotel, the room was great, very clean and i am very happy with how well the housekeeping staff cleaned the room everyday, the room service i got with the happy birthday cake was beyond amazing, and the staff in the pool were just great. No negative comments in this stay, everything was amazing. Good job to all the staff and looking forward for my next visit. Thank you

I‚Äôm writing this review halfway through my current stay, that itself speaks to something. Don‚Äôt get me wrong the setting is beautiful and our room is well kempt. But appearance does not make a hotel 5 stars. The place is teaming with staff, you‚Äôll never see more employees in one space, but the service is beyond slow and on several occasions already they have attempted to overcharge for drinks etc. The hotel also advertises several restaurants that do not in fact exist. As I‚Äôm writing this I‚Äôm sitting in my hotel bedroom nursing an all day bout of food poisoning which I am positive I got from here as it is the only place I‚Äôd eaten in the 40hrs before the illness started. Worst of all for me the brand prides itself on ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù. This is the most unsustainable establishment‚Ä¶

This is our second time at the Movenpick. We love it because it's family friendly, the design is beautiful, the staff is super friendly, and the breakfast buffet is just great! The kids club is what absolutely sold us on coming back. My girls have so much fun doing lots of activities, swimming, cooking and playing.. Touria was exceptionally helpful and knows how to deal with children. honestly, the best option as far as family friendly hotels that doesn't skimp on the other things..

I have stayed in the Movenpik Marrakeh in july, it's one of the finest in the world. the rooms are fantastic, the staff extremely attentive and what you would expect at a Movenpik. The grounds are impecably maintened, the pool is an ouasis, amazing spa, great kid's room, restaurants are all wonderfull. a big thank you to the pool crew tarik, abdulhaq and imad and to everyone who made our stay an unforgettable experiene. We had a wonderfull week and are definitely coming bak.

Wonderful memorable experience staying at the movenpick hotel. The hotel staff were all so accommodating especially Naima who helped with breakfast every day. She made it very easy by delivering breakfast to our tables. She was brilliant and nothing was too much effort for her Adil was so accommodating with helping with delivering the luggage to our rooms even after changing rooms a few times. Lubna was very accommodating with housekeeping making sure our rooms were fully equipped with all the necessities.

We had a wonderful stay in a quite, spacy and very clean superior room in this outstanding Hotel in July 2019. We would like to thank the staff to make our stay memorable and comfortable at all times. Our special thanks to Nossima M.from the pool restaurant and Brahim from the breakfast area for their always lovely and helpful asisstance!

From the moment we arrived the staff were welcoming and friendly. a Adil was so patient with us taking our group luggage between 4 separate rooms and dealing with a family of 8 adults and a baby. Lynn's the housekeeper excellent cleaning up after he young ones, and Naima at the breakfast lounge was so attentive to all our individual needs/allergies. All the people and more made our stay very pleasurable. The hotel is beautiful and peaceful.

I am currently here with my family and 1 year old grandson. Customer service is brilliant. All the staff are friendly and polite. The rooms are lovely and there are lots of communal lounges to sit in. Breakfast buffet is excellent with something for everyone. Naima looks after us every morning and brings us our endless cups of tea to the table. Thank you so much to everyone at the Movenpick for making our stay so enjoyable. We have a few more days left and are going to make the most of it. BRILLIANT!

Had a lovely trip to Marrakech and stayed at the Movenpic hotel. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. As I was travelling with my 1 year old, I was very worried about coping but staff took care of everything. During the breakfast buffet, one of the staff, Naima, was beyond helpful. She would bring things to the table, even though it was a buffet to make things easier for feeding my baby. During breakfast she word help us with plans for the day and even suggest good things to do.

column3: Great fun, amazing food, super service
column4: It was the best steak I ve ever had. Cooked perfectly to my order, amazing taste. Food was beyond expectation as well as service. Really good fun and really awesome attitude DIEGO/ Mohammed. He made our experience absolutely unforgettable. Even a little detail like a ketchup, or pictures... or simply anything we needed to have a great experience he did!!! 100% super service!!!! When I go to Marrakech again- MOVENPICK - will be first in my list!!! Thanks you guys for a lovely dinner! Special thanks to Diego ( bosa bosa)

column3: Great hotel but could be better, careful with the activities they sell you.
column4: Outstanding resort that needs a facelift in the elevators ,lobbies of the rooms buildings and spa.Great location close to shops, central station, restaurants and airport. 7 minutes taxi ride to the Medina and the Fna Square at EUR 5 a ride or 50 DM nice rooms with great bathrooms.Outstanding pool area and amazing main lobby. Great breakfast buffet in a nice patio . On the negative side, be very careful with the activities and excursions you buy from the front desk...They play with the prices as they wish.

Absolutely love this hotel. We used the pool facilities nearly every day of our holiday. Everything is brilliant, the beds are really comfortable, the swimming pool was a perfect relief to a very hot day & towels are readily available. There is a newly added pizza oven which I took advantage of regularly. The team who attend to customers by the pool are so attentive - we were remembered again by Jihane & Anas. Their attention to detail is beyond excellent. Spotting when things need fixing. I am already planning my next trip for 2020 A***

Me and my boyfriend we have been there one week in August 2019 and we can say that it was a great place to stay in Marrakech. The breakfast was amazing, our waiter, Mohamed Skiriba was gentle. The only thing that we didn‚Äôt appreciate was pool that was always overcrowded.

yassine hadhoumi @ restaurant saray give d me and my family an exellent service. Verry Nice and helpfull. Next year i Will comme back! Also Naima and brahim where out standing People with a verry classy service thx for that moment off real vacation feeling. I Will recommend this service to my whole Family.

Very good stay, service was amazing and staff were very helpful especially Fatima Zahra, she was a great help during the breakfast service making sure we had everything we needed and more. Would highly recommend.

We stayed in the h√¥tel last week and the service was nothing short of excellent. All the staff are very helpful.i was very impressed with laila restaurant. She gave us excellent servise in restaurant. Always looking dor ways to help and always smaling. The h√¥tel room are very nice.clean and have their own class about room The pool area is beautiful Breakfast is really good All in all reccomend this place

Overall beautiful hotel - pools are amazing - the restaurants are jot overpriced - all the staff is very polite - breakfast came with our room and the buffet was wonderful - Yassine waited on my table a couple days in a row and he was lovely. Merci beaucoup!!

We spent four days at this outstanding resort in Marrakech. Customer service was excellent with the help of Afaf and Nadia. They were both excellent and knowledgeable. Breakfast was also good with a big variety of options. I can only highly recommend this resort!!

Great hotel, lovely clean space, amazing service! Hind at reception desk and arrival was probably the most friendly and helpful. Overall, good accommodation for a reasonable price. we would definately stay again

Hi , I would like to point out this amazing person me and my friend met at the hotel reception. Hanane is the best employee of the hotel the most smiley person and the most helpful. She helped us book restaurants and assisted with anything else we required. We laughed a lot and made our stay much much pleasant.

We visited marrakech in July 7th for my birthday celebration. I could only say without Hanane (she is the receptionist at the Hotel), my trip would not had been so memorable. What Hannane did which made it so special? So I went back to our hotel room as you do, I saw a cake with a beautiful flowers all over, it took me by surprise and what a nice surprise! Not only did she went over and above her call of duties, it was really the thoughts she put in which made it so special and unforgettable. Truly a kind young lady. I would think all company would want an employee like her. Thank you Hannane we will see you again really soon :)

We wanted to spend a day at a hotel pool towards the end of our trip, and saw a few (recent) articles which recommended the Movenpick Hotel. Unfortunately when we arrived they said that the pool was for use by guests only, and they no longer allow visitors to use the pool. We went to Novotel Hotel instead which I can thoroughly recommend.

This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff were very polite and helpful. Unfortunately the food and minibar are way over priced.Brahim at breakfast was very helpful and couldn't do enough for you so I thank him.we had a junior suite which was lovely but again over priced. We had a lovely time at the hotel but ¬£6.50 for a small can of coke and ¬£15.00 for a club sandwich ruined the experience.

We stayed here in July . The hotel can arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel if pre booked . Unfortunately Marrakech airport is very busy and it took ages to clear immigration . We didn‚Äôt see our driver in the arrival hall and missed him so don‚Äôt go outside the airport otherwise they won‚Äôt let you back in, in the end the driver found us .. excellent Check in was good , we booked a junior suite OMG it was huge , large lounge and bedroom, fantastic bathroom and terrace to sit out on, the suites are located in the quiet part of the hotel -it‚Äôs worth up grading as far I can see the standard rooms balconies are very small . Unfortunately the costs of the mini bar are crazy as well as room service , ¬£6 Euro for a can of coke , ¬£15 for a burger- I know it‚Äôs a 5 star‚Ä¶

Stayed in this hotel for a week with my family and everything was great! There were multiple pools and the hotel itself is located near a number of attractions and restaurants. The staff here are also super friendly in particular Hind at the front desk was very helpful and Youssef who works in the restaurant was always very attentive and ready to get us anything we might need. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

I had excellent experience at Movenpick Marrakech that is cause best service Offered by stuff at Movenpick . Let me correct my words it is become excellent experience with help of Hanene ( reciptionist) . Thank you for you smiling all the time , Thank you for your perfect english .

Stayed in this hotel for a week! Everything was great! The pool is amazing and the food is outstanding. We spent most of our time in the hotel because it was too good! They have some of the best staff i have ever seen! Really friendly and always happy to help! Special mention to Hind, Nezha, Hanan and Sounail for making me feel at home. Cant wait to be back again!

From the moment we walked in we loved the feel and look of the hotel. Hind is the beautiful lady at the front desk. She is absolutely amazing and a superstar. She is always happy and always smiling and extremely helpful. She should manage her own hotel one day.üíïüíï Mahmoed and Hamza at the pool bar are the perfect gentleman. They are always making sure that you are having a good time and that you do not lack anything. They make you feel good and welcome every minute. Omar and Amien at breakfast is so friendly and very attentive to you. Always asking if you need anything and always happy to assist. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are cosy and spacious. I will definitely come stay here again.

I don't enjoy writing negative reviews but our stay here was way below the standards of a 5* hotel. On arrival, the staff at the hotel looked utterly miserable and helping us with our luggage seemed as extra work to them. One of the bellboys dropped a few of our bags upto the room, spilling some contents and didn't even bother to apologise let alone help pick the contents up. The rooms were fairly well equipped, however one of our rooms had a broken toilet seat, broken locks & a crib bed rather than a proper bed. We promptly complained to the manager who arrogantly refused to do anything about this. He also refused to give us his name. We spoke to our booking agent and they reported that the manager had offered us a different room which was an obvious lie as we would have‚Ä¶

No complaints about this hotel. Nice and clean. The hotel bars service wasn't great- often hard to find a server. But this could be due to how we arrived about a week before the start of peak season. By the end of the week there were more waiters. The inclusive breakfast was very good.

Currently visiting the beautiful country of Morocco with my girlfriend, attempting to enjoy our first time in Africa and we have been repeatedly served with mediocre service from every staff member here. From the time we checked in we have been rushed, from grabbing a drink at dinner to laying out, ordering food at the pool. I was told today that I needed to hurry up and pay for a check in order for the attendant to ‚Äúwatch a match.‚Äù We obliged and attempted to pay with a debit card, the card declined and we were told ‚Äúdo you have another card?‚Äù in a very accusatory tone. We asked whether or not it may have been the machine, and when he ran the SAME card with a NEW machine, TRANSACTION APPROVED. After we paid, we wanted to continue to enjoy our day by the pool (still here) and‚Ä¶

I am currently staying at this hotel my boyfriend and I have had both drinks at the bar and lunch at the pool. Both times the service has been below average. We are constantly being rushed and quickly asked to pay right after receiving our food. Today at the pool our server asked us if we could please quickly pay so he could go watch a soccer match. Then when trying to pay the card machine would not work and he insisted that there was a problem with my card. I asked him to run my card again and the machine worked. We are trying to have a relaxing holiday and this has made it somewhat unpleasant. We are trying to pay money to their hotel you would think they would at least be friendly.

Excellent hotel I‚Äôve stayed in Marrakech a couple of times now at different hotels and this is the Best one to date The hotel is kept clean to a high standard the staff who greet you as you enter the hotel are polite and courteous this started the weeks stay off well. The accommodation we had was a suite 5103 it was kept so clean and tidy by the maid who was so polite and helpful üëçto this young lady. Kind regards Laurence. PS. To management and staff please kept up the good work you do I will be coming back to stay.

We had an amazing time in this hotel. The service was excellent. I'd like to say a special thanks to Hind at reception for being so much help. She knew what we needed, when we needed it and most of the time she'd anticipate it before we did! The rooms were fantastic and thoroughly clean and breakfast was excellent!

We got a great deal on secret escapes - ¬£300 for 3 nights, which we thought was good for a supposed 5 star. The hotel has an impressive reception and lobby area, rooms are fairly standard but the bathrooms are nice. Our room was advertised as ‚Äògarden view‚Äô but overlooked a couple of trees and the bin area. Breakfast was good, lots of choice and the lady serving the omelettes was lovely, however every morning the omelettes were quite undercooked with a fair amount of raw egg in the middle. The location isn‚Äôt great for the M√©dina - about a 30 minute + walk. Pool area good, plenty of sunloungers and the majority of the life guards were very attentive in getting towels and umbrellas when needed. The night prior to our departure we asked if there was anywhere we could store our bags‚Ä¶

Everything in this hotel is way below expectations from declared 5*. Lifts and pool area have a lot of wear and tear, mold, broken tiles and carpet and look more up to 2* standard. Morning buffet is also very basic, minimal selection of food. The hotel is terrible value for money. For the price they charge you can be in real 5* somewhere in Dubai, or in amazing All Inclusive in the best resorts in Egypt. The only place which really lived up to my expectations was the Kids club. Very professional employees perfectly managing their little crew of (sometimes) misbehaving kids, well diversified program 10-18. Great job and thanks for what you are doing!

This was a stop for our tour group in Morocco and was absolutely perfect! It is drop dead gorgeous filled with incredible art pieces, shops, bar, restaurants and anything else you need. The rooms are comfortably furnished and tastefully decorated. Bedding was great, air conditioning was great, drinks, even with ice that‚Äôs been made with distilled water, were great. There‚Äôs a lovely pool and so many nice touches of fresh roses everywhere. The staff was so helpful, especially since it really is a sort of maize that seems difficult, but becomes easier to navigate with the help of the staff. Highly recommend this lovely gem!

This hotel is really great and would warrant 5 stars but several issues need to be addressed. The elevators are terrible. Broken buttons, broken floor indicators, frequent bumps and lurches make riding them quite uncomfortable. For a luxury hotel chain this is not acceptable. Also guest services staff is not attentive or responsive. We had to call and go to the desk 3 times for a simple request to be handled. Others in our group had similar issues. Pool, restaurant/ Buffett and rooms were great. The parent company of this great hotel chain needs to visit here and see the issues and get them fixed.

We stayed for three nights and most of our experience at this hotel has been pleasant. The landscape is beautiful and well maintained. Staff around the pool and breakfast area are fairly attentive and friendly. Plenty of choices are available for breakfast as well. The room is well sized and comfortable with fair level of furnishing. The room services needs to be improved as staffs are not attentive / trained to a 5 stars hotel standard. I need to ask for an item for three times before it was delivered. Overall, we did enjoy the stay. Could the experience be better, yes.

We had very pleasant experience in this hotel, reception people were accommodating. The restaurant people not as much. Nice pool, great breakfast. We stay for long weekend, could stay little longer. Recommend!

I had very nice experience at Movenpick Marrekech, or just let me correct my words: it became nice experience with the help of the stuff at Movenpick. First day, I arrived I had some minor problem with my room ( like wash room door does not close correctly), I reported that at the reception. So, they transfer my report to the problem solver Hanane ( receptionist). She render my experience totally different: first she speak perfectly english ( no one else could understand me),she upgrade right away my room, she took care of the transfer my language... She was smiling all the time even after 8 hours of work. If you would like to have nice experience go to Movenpick a‚Äô and go to see Hanane. She will offers you the best service

Marrakech would rate a probably the most interesting place in Morocco to visit. There are lots of high end hotels, lots to do and the Movenpick is up there with them. Public areas are huge, rooms OK for size. Meals were fine, would certainly stay here again. Visiting the Medina especially at night is a must. Taxis are cheap and easy to find. We felt safe here.

My husband Peter and I stayed at the Movenpick Mansour Eddahbi, Marrakesh from the afternoon of the 9th June until the morning of the 11th June 2019 . We were travelling as members of an Insight Vacations Group Tour visiting Morocco. Our time at this hotel in Marrakesh and subsequent enjoyment of our tour, was ruined by the incompetence, irresponsibility and totally unprofessional attitude of the management and staff of this hotel . Not only did the porters fail to deliver my husband‚Äôs suitcase to our room after our arrival , the management there denied receiving it and blamed the company we were travelling with for its disappearance . Mr. Badr who was in charge of porterage , was most unhelpful , and hours after the suitcase went missing , having been given a full description‚Ä¶

Stayed here the weekend of the 7-06-19 for 3 nights. I‚Äôll list the things as I seen them. Check in: Basically very poor levels of service, the 2 x people on reception didn‚Äôt understand English, yes I know I‚Äôm in a foreign country but I have never had an issue in any other country in 5 star hotels. We eventually got told at 10:00 am no room was available till at least 14:00 we had no problem with that but at 14:00 was told still no room, what seemed to be a senior staff member who could actually understand English then got involved and got us our room. The first experience of a couldn‚Äôt care less attitude. They then gave us a cheap photo copy piece of paper which was meant to be a map and drew 2 circles 1 which I believe was reception and the other was where our room was. No‚Ä¶

Would be 5 star review except for the Internet being on and off at times. Great breakfast and nice rooms. Lovely pool and big stand out was Hassan, a super friendly and helpful lifeguard who guided us on the best places to go. I have nicknamed him Hassan the Hassel Hoff, dark hair and big muscles lol.

This hotel was nice and very modern. I stayed in the King suite with my hubby and baby and must say enjoyed it. The bathroom was nice and big with his and hers sink. The balcony was lovely to sit out and chill. There was an issue with the kettle not working. This was a nightmare as I couldn't make up my babies bottles. The staff were very reluctant to give a new kettle until right at the end when they realised after 6 attempts the one we had was broken! Nevertheless. Despite this everything else was pleasant. The suites are a bit out from the other rooms but it is quiet and no one disturbing you. The strange thing about the suite is not having many plug sockets. They were either used for the kettles etc or on the skirting board which meant my UK adapter couldn't fit‚Ä¶

The hotel is nice and is in a beaituful location. But the service is quite avarage. We had dinner with> 10 people . There was not enough number of waiters. They forgot and missed some orders. The requested iron to the room. I called the room service 4 times it took them 4 hours to brung. I ordered a hard pillow and called 2 times. No response still waiting for it. Quite expensive and not good value for the money...

+Very Nice staff +Clean and spacious lobby + comfy beds - bad smell in WC in room - there were some small dirts, for example on pic - restaurant should have better food Location: kinda far for those who wants to explore real Marrakech From my point of view this hotel is kind of ‚Äúall inclusive‚Äù hotel which is bad for those who wants to really take a rest not in a crowded swimming pols

column3: Excellent hotel in a nice neighbourhood
column4: Stayed at this property for 2 nights with gate 1 travel .Beautiful hotel with different wings.Great decoration, Very fresh and comfortable rooms.Great buffet breakfast and great onsight restaurants offering local and int'l deicasies. Only complaint is all lobby, restaurant and room furnƒ±ture are very low making it impossible for elderly and disabled people to get up once seated. It is impossible . Normal height dinning room chairs and couches etc. should be provided. NOT EVERYONE IS 18 YEARS OLD......

column3: Plush is This Hotel's Middle Name
column4: While visiting Marrakesh we stayed two nights at the Movenpick Hotel. We would have preferred to stay a month. This is a great hotel and the staff is incredibly cordial. What a treat! The rooms are very comfortable as are the beds. A refrigerator, safe, wifi and coffee (with a heater) are provided. Plush robes and slippers are also provided. The biggest criticism about this property is that it is very large and you can easily get lost. The friendly staff can quickly get you going in the right direction. Food at the restaurant is excellent and sitting by the pool having breakfast makes the entire experience perfect. Dinner by the pool was an equally enjoyable experience. You will not go wrong staying at this hotel.

Our stay at the hotel was pleasant, and this hotel was beautiful! The centre piece lighting, and the various forms of art work were mesmerising. Pro: The majority of the staff were friendly and approachable Pro: the hotel itself was very clean and kept at a high standard Pro: the range of facilities at the hotel were good, such as the spa and swimming pool! Pro: the hotel was also located in a convenient area! There was a mall just up the road, the Medina was a ten minute drive away. The main attractions such as Jardin Majorelle, Le Jardin Secret, the Saadian Tombs and the Bahia Palace were approx a 10 minute drive away! Pro: the restaurant provided a good range of food from, starters to desserts! The deserts were notably the highlight of my dining experience at the‚Ä¶

column3: Hotel grounds nice, service is poor
column4: The lobby and grounds of the hotel are nice. They are visually pleasing and have a nice smell. Staff is not helpful. I booked 2 day tours with the hotel and the actual experience was very different than what was promised. The waiters at the restaurant are slow to serve you. I got up during my meal to get something from the buffet and when I came back my drink is gone. When I asked them about it, they said I had finished it and would have to purchase another one, even though I know it was not finished. i had to call housekeeping 3 times to request a simple bed sheet. They repeatedly told me they would bring it but they never did. Poor service at this place. Save yourself the aggravation. Book your stay somewhere else.

I stayed 5 nights at the Movenpick Hotel and I couldn‚Äôt fault it. I booked a transfer via email, got a swift reply and on the day they were waiting upon my arrival. My room was spacious and lovely, maybe a little tired in places but you‚Äôd only notice if you were really looking. I used the gym, and it was very well equipped. I also booked a few massages in advance via email with Bouchra in reception. She was very helpful and responded to my emails quickly. I met her each day and she was very warm and welcoming, it was lovely to meet her in person. I had 3 different therapists each time Fatin, Khadija and Bouchra - they were all very professional, made me feel at ease and the massages were excellent. The spa was very calming and I‚Äôd recommend a visit. I had breakfast and dinner at‚Ä¶

Beautiful lobby!! Beautiful rooms. Heated pool, kids pool, mini pool. Great breakfast! Great service at the restaurants (¬£¬£¬£¬£). Everything was great...we made my parents go the month after to the same hotel :)

As soon as we walked into this hotel, with its gorgeous lobby, we felt great about choosing to stay here! The hotel lobby is stunning, and the rest of the property, pool, etc. are equally grand. We were also very satisfied with our room, with its black marble bathroom and luxe linens. The staff was very helpful, providing change for our larger denominated bills. The breakfast buffet is incredible - extensive and delicious. We ate dinner at 54 Steak. The ribeye was cooked to perfection. Service was superb. We also ate at Dada's Diner, which was a nice option for quick, casual meal. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

My husband and I came chose this hotel for our mini vacation plus other things. The hotel is gorgeous and the views are breathtaking. The staff are respectful, friendly, welcome and are willing to go above and beyond to help. Breakfast is free and naima and Mohammed were always there to help us. Naima especially was always there to recommend things and chat with us. I surely fell like I was at home. I would recommend this hotel to.lots of people. I will definitely comme back again in the near future ü§óü§óü§ó.

column3: Not a five stars hotel ! Poor service quality and food
column4: No welcome drink No recharge of toilet paper in the room Bar of the swimming pool closes more than one hour before the sunset and even 15 minutes before they do not take anymore any order Not enough umbrellas in the swimming pool and when we ask they just say ¬´ bad luck for you ¬ª Terrible food at the night buffet and very expensive (but breakfast is OK) Issue with the final bill (charged some beverages that we did not take) Very poor quality of service at the swimming pool (take 45 minutes to bring a diet coke) Clearly not a five stars hotel !! Maximum a two or three stars hotel... very disappointed by these vacation !!!!

column3: Definitely not a five star hotel
column4: We are on day 3 of a four night stay and would like to share our feedback to assist anyone else considering this hotel. We arrived on Saturday after a long journey and were not given the rooms we had booked. My daughter and I are sharing a double bed and our friends are in tiny single beds next door. We were not provided with any refreshments on Check in (despite previous reviewers receiving this service) After checking in we were guided to our basic room in a worn out building with no mini bar, no iron, no hairdryer and no WiFi ! The tea and coffee in the room is not replaced once you have used the two sachets provided and there is no turn down service in the evening. Breakfast is very basic and on our second day we were not even offered any drinks from the lady serving‚Ä¶

Just a short break. 3.5hr from Stanstead. Hotel is lovely. It‚Äôs quiet so don‚Äôt expect entertainment or shows. On the whole it‚Äôs top quality but is a little tired in places. Rooms are simple & comfortable but not opulent. Breakfast was basic but dinner is excellent. The venue is made that bit better by its excellent staff in particular, Naima in the breakfast room ... nothing was too much trouble for her (she should get employee of the year!).

I wanted to say I was very impressed with the birthday cake I requested for my partner. He was visiting Marrakesh solo for his birthday. The concierge team arranged a cake on his arrival as well as on his actual birthday a few days later!! He loved it and will bring some back for me. Special thank you to Amine who handled my emails. Zahra

We stayed four night in the M√∂venpick and we really enjoyed our stay. Despite having more than 500 rooms the hotel is well designed and doesnt tell over crowded. The staff is really welcoming and professional and the bedroom are correct.

I was in town for work and stayed for 3 nights. I found the hotel to be clean, to have good service and the interiors to be very colorful and hip. The gym had quite a lot of machinery and the food was great. i would stay again

My recent stay here was ok but not as great as I thought it would be. On arrival the lobby is grand with huge sliding doors and we received snacks while we were being checked in. Lovely! However, after the walk past the stunning pool area on the way to my room, my expectations took a hit. The elevator was rockery and frankly very tired with faded and patchy carpet. The room was just ok with no iron in the room (had to call the front desk for that) and a shaky toilet. When I turned on the air conditioning in the room, it was so noisy. On the positive side the breakfast is good with many choices and the restaurant by the pool has excellent food. The pizza and burgers were delicious and the bunnies hopping around were a fun, eclectic touch. In addition, the staff is very‚Ä¶

my friend and I stayed 7 nights at the Movenpick in a junior suite, great size room, very comfortable beds, linens, very clean, large terrace with full sitting area and a table for 4. Housekeeping staff very attentive and accommodating to all our demands. the only issue with the room is that windows in the bedroom does not open, it can get a bit warm, but living room area has a slide door you can get lovely brezze at night, but it does not reach the bedroom. spa is fabulous with great prices for treatments, Hammam and massages were fabulous. Great buffet breakfast includes freshly made Moroccan pancakes and mint tea ceremony . ample space in pool area, it can get crowded. The highlight was the concierge staff Amine and specially Safae, went above and beyond with their‚Ä¶

We travelled for a short break from the UK for our dads 60th. No real effort was made for the fact it‚Äôs his birthday. Which is fine but we have stayed in lots of five star hotels that have made a big effort out of no real special birthdays. The staff are lovely. Work so hard and really nice and caring especially the waiters in the evening. They recommended such nice food and wine for us which we appreciated over just telling us to get stuff for the sake of it. We only got to spend one full day at the hotel as we did an amazing private tour on one of the days, recommended by the hotel, he was honestly such a good tour guide, made our trip to be honest. On this one day we , obviously, wanted to sit by the pool. The sun beds are limited , not the fault of the staff and they try‚Ä¶

column3: Awesome place to stay with the most amazing staff and breakfast!!!
column4: I accompanied my husband on a business trip as the company he represents also organizes a spouse program with visits and activities which allows to discover the place pretty well. When we first arrived at the hotel, we were amazed to see the staff outside greeting us as we got off the bus. We were even more amazed once we entered the hotel which is not only beautiful but had the most sumptuous flower arrangements, all over!! We were of course greeted with typical tea and sweets which you tend to have about 10 times a day in Morocco as it is DELICIOUS!!! FYI, if you wish to purchase their tea, do so in the Souq or at the mall, don‚Äôt wait for the airport, you won‚Äôt find the kind they serve in the city. We were escorted to our rooms in one of the blocks closer to the pool so we‚Ä¶

After travelling through Morocco, mountains, desert and all, we chose this place for a few days of relaxation before heading back home. Very good choice it was. The hotel already stuns you with one of the nicest and impressive lobbies ever.You can immediately feel it is nicely run. It is a big establishment (seven buildings?). We got rooms in one of the farther ones, which felt more like a serviced apartment, so spacious it was. Everything seems quite new and very well taken care of (cleanliness, landscaping, etc.). The pool area is nice, and on nice days the number of sunbeds seems limited. Might need to go early. The pool bar is great, has some dishes for a quick lunch break. The gym and SPA are also well equipped and the staff very helpful. The breakfast area somehow feels‚Ä¶

The Dj yassin is one the of best around, full of energy and excitement and it was the best part of the experience for me. The overall hotel experience was pretty awesome. I would definitive reccomand it.

This hotel is lovely. My room is spacious, clean and comfortable. Hotel amenities are great - good breakfast, beautiful pool, lovely staff. Why is there always a ‚Äúbut‚Äù? Yesterday after my room was cleaned, I had no hand-towel or bottled water. Having only been here for one night so far, I asked at reception if water was supposed to be replenished daily. Yes was the answer. Also my kettle didn‚Äôt work. I had to ask at reception 3 times before I received a working kettle, a hand-towel and a bottle of water. Today my room has been serviced and, at 3.50 pm, I have absolutely no towels at all and my used coffee cups have not been cleaned. Maybe it is retribution for asking 3 times yesterday! I have already dried my hands on a bathrobe and have phoned guest services to‚Ä¶

column3: Very clean, comfortable hotel in good location
column4: The hotel has a beautiful pool area and a large choice of restaurants. The room was large, clean and the mattress was finally (after many hotels in Morocco), comfortable. The shower was also the best we experienced, however, ours was not pitched correctly and kept flooding the floor. The breakfast buffet was very good with flaky pastries. Service was attentive and the staff would walk with you to show you where to go. The location is on a main road which was pleasant to walk on and see the train station and royal theatre. We walked back from the souk, very pleasant, but not short.

My sister has reviewed already but I would like to echo her comments Anas and Jihane who work at the lovely pool at the movenpick are a fantastic asset to the holiday experience nothing is too much trouble for them We certainly will be back time and time again

This is our 3rd visit to the Movenpick and it won't be our last. The main amenities we used this trip was the pool area. The beds are so comfortable, very easy to rest and enjoy the sunshine. The life guard Anas is an absolute treasure and as always looked after all the guests superbly. Anas remembered us by name after our last visit in July and the time before that in September 2017. We were also very pleased to see that Jihane the pool waiter was still working at the hotel. She is by fair the most attentive member of the team there. She is always watching and checking that the guests have everything they need and when delivering food she lays it all out neatly to ensure the guest has the best experience. The customer service demonstrated by Anas and Jihane is 2nd to‚Ä¶

column3: Good place to stay for short vacation
column4: The ambiance and decor of the common areas is worth a look. The rooms,though neat and clean, are however a letdown. The service and housekeeping is poor. The property has a number of excellent swimming pools , which are the main attraction during summer months.

Clearly, the toilet has not been scrubbed properly. I am so grossed out. The vanity had hair on it. There are marks & stains on the walls. There are stains on the carpet. The lobby has a nauseating overpowering gardenia smell. I think this is common in Morocco. It‚Äôs like the old lady with too much perfume on to cover up bodily smells.

We stayed in for the first few days of our tour. The staff was very helpful. The room was spacious and well equipped. The bar was well staffed. We ate at the restaurant and found the food tasty. The decor in the lobby was very eclectic. It was a 30 dirham ride to the souk. This hotel is located I. The new part of the city. I would stay here again.

Splendid and Grandeuse hotel . Enormous complex of hotel with convention center . Curated with amazing art and award winning restaurant . Room is spotless and swimming pool is heated . Surrounded by lush garden and fountain.

Wow, this place is incredible, from walking through the main doors, this hotel definitely exceeded expectations. The room was good, we got upgraded, but downfall the rooms were so far from main entrance and back entrance near us had been closed off. Service was overall great, the only one thing was we were after specific Teas, and called room service about 5 times, after waiting for 3 hours we headed to the bar ourselves to request this. We felt we were right on the edge so it was nice and quiet and had our privacy. Breaksfast was great but super busy! Pool and amneties were fab, the restaurant manager was brilliant too, we really felt taken care of (3 girls) even thought the small tea issue. Lovely hotel, would come back.

Friendly staff, nice poolside. The setting is very luxurious and it caters to the comfort of of the guests. My room was well appointed with all the usual amenities. Excellent buffet breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel!

The only true way to review this gigantic resort style hotel is to put the food of it against the bad... The Good: -Architecturally beautiful -Modern services and construction -Nice sized rooms (but not enormous) -Art exhibits around the lobby area -Several restaurants to chose from -Several pools, one of them quite large. -Nice plant and flower filled grounds. -Centrally located -Nice breakfast buffet -Free wifi -Kids club The Bad: -Room was infested with ants; housekeeping never did anything about it -Our hair dryer caught fire after starting it, the hotel change it after 24 hours and several requests at the front desk -Although there are several restaurants they share many menu intend throughout -Service at restaurants can be either efficient or extremely slow‚Ä¶

column3: Worst ‚Äú5 star‚Äù hotel i have ever stayed at. Service and food quality is of the lowest possible.
column4: I seldom do reviews - but after spending 5000 eur on this nightmare it deserved one. lets start with the positive - IF you buy a 600 eur per night suite - rooms are relatively large / clean - and in generel all people are friendly and breakfast is decent. But - Forget any pictures you see on their website - was probably taken in 1999. after 2 hour wait in reception upon arrival as rooms were not finished on check in time - without any offer fro water or any other gesture - we recieved one room out of the 2- well after asking 5 times in reception whats going on as no one comes to you to assist. In insane amount of groups and package tours are slamming check in so you can get an extreme wait in generel at reception area. After 4 calls to reception and another 1,5 hour wait from‚Ä¶

Amazing hotel... best location in marrakech, near to all activities (night clubs, malls, markets). staff super helpful. Big thanks to Bouchra from standard who was very helping with all my requests. To recommand !!!

Has the most amazing stay at Movenpick Hotel as a mini hen break with my sisters. The grounds were stunning. We were upgraded to a suit which was also absolutely stunning. The staff were so helpful and very polite. A big thank you to Jaouad Ed-Dajjany who was the manager for the restaurant and his staff for the hospitality and making sure we were well looked after throughout the evening. Would definitely make a return trip!

Beautiful hotel, amazing service and sites. Not the prime location in the city, but far from being bad. Nice breakfast buffet in a nice setting. The hotel hosts an art gallery, but is has great art prices throughout the property.

Nicely located not too far from the Medina, about 60 to 70 D depending on how you manage your negotiations. The taxis have nothing to do with the Hotel so the latter not to blame if you get caught out. Stayed with 2 adults 2 kids in a small suite perfect for our needs. Staff welcoming and super friendly, big thanks to housekeeping team. Breakfast a bit chaotic from 9 to 10 better before and after. Waiters under pressure to keep up supply of knives and forks and napkins. Good breakfast selection, not the best we have seen in a 5 star but good all the same, thumbs up to the omelette , and traditional Moroccan pancake teams. Other on site food options a bit limited really. Pool side by day ‚Äì best to eat in the restaurant at the back of the pool sun bed service hit and‚Ä¶

column3: Crazy Mommas review.... of Movenpick Hotel...Excellent accommodation in nice location
column4: The Movenpick Hotel is set in beautiful surroundings. Has amazing art & gallery. We were in a-garden room 4010 with small terrace having been up graded because of problems with our accommodation when we first arrived. Receptionists very helpful kind and patient Thank you Afaf & Hind on reception. All the staff were extremely nice nothing was to much trouble the waiters Mouchine & Brahim in the Saray restaurant especially so. And also Warrda our room maid such a lovely attitude It‚Äôs a top class hotel and a great place to escape the manic traffic , hussel and bussel that is Marrakesh . Things to be aware of taxi drivers over charge & drop you off to waiting guides. Be careful when taking photos or you will have to pay. There is constant pressure to give... The Medinas & Souks‚Ä¶

column3: Lovely large hotel on the outskirts of town
column4: Loved our stay out of season. Plenty of space and good service. Evenings by the pool as the sun set while drinking cocktails before good food in the hotel choice of restaurants was a highlight. Would definitely consider staying there again

Unfortunately our stay at Movenpick wasn‚Äôt great! Started off with the staff at the front desk taking ages to even assist us (even though they were available). The room was clean but we didn‚Äôt receive the Cot bed as requested. Service was very slow an any request had to be made two/three times before it was done. Staff for breakfast were extremely rude an inattentive. No cutlery or napkins most mornings. Coffee wasn‚Äôt great! Disappointed with the service at this hotel. Won‚Äôt be staying here again.

column3: Very Loud disco noise outside room
column4: If you are looking for relaxation don't go here, unless you check if they are having an event outside in the courtyard area, with very loud music, which they do, and they know when time it is going to end, which they don't, when asked twice. They need to decide if they are an outdoor event space, or a hotel.

I'm the customer of hotel movenpick I had stayed for 1week I really like the hotel location there is a nice view on the garden also I like the pool but the should some DJ music in the pool for people to have fun to to pass there time ,and even o would like tell you there is really bad service in the spa I didn't like it at all ,there is no changes in the food it's very poor the rooms it really very simple but the mades who that they really have a good service I would like to thank ouaicha khadija she is really amazing women and ait warker najat mdme hilal they are excellent people they know how to talk to people ,the hotel it's not perfect thank you I hope you change this things other wise the other the hotel gonna be so bad

Stayed here for 3 nights and booked 2 classic rooms. One of the rooms got up graded to a junior suite. Anyhow we loved both the room and the suite. The only setback was these rooms are far apart as ours was in front of the main pool whilst our children were in the suite block at the end of the property. Breakfast and dinner were both great. Good food with loads of choices. The location is also good as you can easily walk to Menara Mall in 15 minutes being maximum. It is a huge property as there‚Äôs a convention centre next to this hotel. Staff are great too! Plenty of facilities to choose from - Hamam, Spa, more than 1 swimming pools etc.

Great location, great facilities and seamless customer service! Thank you for having us! The only one negative was the vegetarian options for food were very very limited during our half board dinner and we ended up eating pretty much the same thing every evening which was a real shame. I can't fault anything else though.

column3: Good Hotel, Good Location, Enjoyable Dining
column4: Stayed here for three nights. Good location, good sized rooms, great pool facilities, nice gardens, had a pleasant feel about it. Dined in on two occasions which is unusual for my wife and I as we usually dine at venues outside our accommodation. The tapas at Marcelona was good though the big screen sport is a bit loud. Buffet breakfast in the Saray Restaurant was probably the best we experienced in Morocco. And Ayoub always got us good coffees to start the day. Location is great with the old medina, supermarkets and other restaurant alternatives within walking distance.

We have been staying in this hotel for two days, Firstly when we first entered the hotel room the electrical system of the room was not working, we waited for half an hour to be fixed but they did not find it suitable to give another room, There was no water in the room, we were calling for room service, but they did not bring, and the television did not work again, This morning the electricity was cut off again, we called and they said they would come but they did not, Our room number is 7507 and there is still no going in, I have never seen such a bad service that I have traveled to many parts of the world. I don‚Äôt recommend to anyone

Super friendly and helpfull staff! Breakfast is super, great variety! Really worth its five stars! Beautiful hotel! Good location, did everything by foot but taxis are all day available in front of hotel.

We were so excited to stay at the Movenpick before we left Marrakech. I little bit of lux & relaxation from a the medina before flew back. What a disappointment we had. The 1st floor grounds, lobby, artwork, & general design was beautiful but the service was atrocious. When you enter to check in the staff are not friendly or welcoming. They have a look on their face like you are bothering them. Minimal explanation of the grounds but you are given a half-ass map of the hotel which was barely helpful. We attempted to go to the Marcelona restaurant which was supposed to have Spanish influenced food. Well, don't count on it because they changed their menu & it was Moroccan than Spanish. The hostess did not crack a smile & she told us their was no table for 2 but pointed to the bar‚Ä¶

The Movenpick Hotel in Marrakech is a wonderful place. The cavernous and labyrinthine lobby is simply a delightful place in which to get lost and to explore. It really is a worthwhile maze with lots of art work and beautiful and stylistic furniture to experience; and there is always a helpful employee to set you on the correct path should you be in a hurry to find your room, one of its restaurants or a convenient exit. Our room was spacious, clean, comfortable and well-appointed. Complimentary wifi and a bottle of water were appreciated. Breakfast provided a great array of foodstuff from which to choose and with two efficient egg chefs there was little time wasted waiting for your individually prepared omelette or eggs. With the super friendly and helpful staff this is a great‚Ä¶

column3: Great place away from the hustle and bustle...but not to far
column4: Don't usually stay in large hotels and this is large. However it didn't feel so due to the fabulous service we received whilst staying there from the exceptional staff , from the pool guys who found us sunbeds and towels to the maids who cleaned our room. Special shout out to Brahim in the restaurant who looked after us during breakfast. If you are looking for somewhere to stay and relax after a busy day sightseeing, it's perfect and only ¬£4 in a taxi to the main square so you can come and go as you please, with ease. If you prefer to walk off those fabulous breakfasts it will take you 30mins.

We visited Marrakech for one week and stayed at Movenpick. We loved the artwork and graffiti in the hotel! Although the hotel wasn't excellent the service we received from the hotel staff was. We were particularly looked after by Ayoub during all our meals.

Really nice place for a family .we are here the first time and we like the hotel very much .thanks too much all the stuff for being helpful.special thanks for laila marcelona very helpful mi family very happy of the servise layla ..thnk you

This place is truly a gem! I went with my sister and cousin, staff, food, atmosphere and rooms are all amazing! Initially we were meant to stay at this hotel and one other, as movenpick didn‚Äôt have the availability when we first book for us to stay with them the whole holiday: anyways we stayed here for half our holiday and made our way to the second hotel 3 days later... WHAT A MISTAKE. The other was soo bad we had to return to movenpick. They were actually fully booked because of a Chanel conference but thankfully Nadia managed to find us a room which we were so grateful for because this hotel MADE OUR HOLIDAY ! Special thanks to Hind for sorting all our activities for us and being so lovely to us! This place is a gem and we are looking to come back to Marrakech and stay at‚Ä¶

The hotel lobby is an art gallery, full of paintings and sculptures. The room was very spacious, bed was comfortable, bathroom clean, there‚Äôs a safe, coffee maker and complementary bottle of water. Overall clean room, no complaints.

Good hotel;however, it does need a little updating. The bed mattress not comfortable and dipped causing back pain. Good size bathroom but the toilet area is compact in comparison with rest of the bathroom. The staff are friendly and helpful. Thank you to Warda,young lady, who did a fab job cleaning the rooms everyday with a smile.

Very good hotel with special thanks to Mr Mustapha in Sarai Restaurant for his good service and high sens of professionalism. His smile and his concern to satisfy the customer made of him the right person in the right place.

first of all i would like to thank a young waitress named laila she is very professional , a very nice hotel üòâ the restaurant (Marcelona ) is beautiful and the meal . Thanks for everything Best regards Jean-Yves family

We were a group of 13 friends for a bachelor party and spent 3 nights at the Movenpick. The facilities are great, breakfast is delicious and the staff is amazing. In particular Jihanne who took great care of us at the pool. Thanks a lot to her! Fully recommend to stay there.

column3: Good hotel, helpful staff, very pleasant stay
column4: Obviously mixed experiences here, but we stayed for 4 nights in early March and had a good stay. - no complaints. The main (heated) pool and bar are busy, but the lower (unheated) pool with its bar/restaurant was a calmer spot. Breakfasts are very good, we dined twice in Marcelona restaurant and food was good and reasonably priced. Our standard room was clean, comfortable and well serviced. I agree Reception could be understaffed at times, they do themselves no favours by allowing you to quote any old room number when getting food and drinks, without checks - thus we found a spurious dinner on our bill which took time to sort out. But concierge were swift every day in retrieving our golf bags from storage. We were there during a busy conference in the Palais de Congres next‚Ä¶

column3: Avoid the satellite buildings: no A/C!
column4: Don‚Äôt stay in the satellite buildings! Management refuses to turn on the air conditioning until May. It‚Äôs 86 degrees outside and my one bedroom suite is an oven. Even at night or with a breeze blowing through it‚Äôs still hot. I heard several other hotel guests complaining about the situation to management, to no avail.

column3: Average 5 star hotel. Needs improvement in service level.
column4: The hotel is huge with rooms spread in many buildings. Of course there is no covered pathway from reception or the restaurant to the buildings housing the rooms and this is a problem when it's raining. Reception is very very small and very slow. Very nice lobby and entrance. Very nice pool area but probably small for the amount of people in the hotel. Gym is not bad though a bit small for a holiday destination huge hotel. The rooms are nicely sized. The bed is nice and comfy. Decor is nice as well. There is tea and coffee facilities but strangely enough only 1 mug. Bathroom is nicely sized with a big shower. Some of the towels were soft and nice, others looked older. Toiletries were refreshed every day. I had a very tiny balcony but as i was ground floor, there is no privacy‚Ä¶

Such a shame i have to post this review, as i was really looking forward to our stay at Movenpick in Marrakech. I loved the design of the hotel, the ambience and trusting the great 5 star service and worldwide reputation i trusted this hotel to enjoy our time off. Booked the superior room for our short 3 day break. We arrived very late at night to the 5* hotel to discover our bathroom and bathtub were full of ants, dirty carpet full of stains and the phone completely not working (our building was very far from reception, about good 5min walk through outdoor area). Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the room was beautifully decorated, i loved the design and it was exactly what we wanted, however I expected it to be properly cleaned and prepared for the guests. We had to go a several times to‚Ä¶

Really nice place for a family stay in Marrakech. We are here second time and we like the hotel very much! Thanks to all of the stuff for being helpfull and kind. Thanks to Jihane working by the pool too!

During our visit recently to Marrakesh we stayed at two different hotels, Four Seasons and Movenpick. Both has the same top rating at for example Booking.com. It is a total joke. Our room in Movenpick was small and smelly. Toilet in bathroom a joke as well, it did not work properly. Pool area absolutely packed with people and difficult to find space.

The Hotel is super nice and very clean - and the waitress, her Name is Jihane, is the best!! We really appreciate her Service! We are coming back to this Amazing Hotel - Looking forward! See you soon Movenpick

I had a good time during my work and especially I found your host parents at the reception and at the pool and especially the girl called JIHAN I liked his kindness and his home she is very nice ......

column3: Would expect better from a M√∂venpick
column4: The best part of the hotel was it's staff. Especially during the breakfast, even though that it was too many people, they could still find room for our family. The heated pool was great! The rooms had rather good size, loved the spacy bathroom. Comfy bed. On a negative side - the rooms are really outdated. The carpeted floor was very-very dirty, the carpets should be changed immediately. It seemed that even after room service, the floors were not really cleaned, there was still dirt on floors. We had to wear shoes all the time, as otherwise the feet/socks would get dirty. It was nice to have the balcony, but there was almost no view unfortunately. The elevators were a disgrace. The button lights were not working, you could not understand on which floor you were stopping as the‚Ä¶

My parents and I spent the weekend in this fabulous hotel. The amenities are top notch. Rooms are so confortable, with great quality toiletry. The breakfast is varied, generous and delicious. The staff is fantastic. In particular Mustafa (koukh?) in the restaurant who‚Äôs so friendly and attentive. For example we craved some meloui but the lady making them had left. We went inside the kitchen to order some fresh ones for us. Thank you Mustafa and thank you the rest of the staff for a great stay

We recently discovered this amazing property as a birthday gift for our son. He had always wanted to go to Marrakech and this hotel did not disappoint! From the great care Hanane and Hind took to make my sons birthday special, to Dahjli at the spa, who was amazing! Thank you for making our first trip to Marrakech truly special!

Absolutely thrilled with the service we received! Came for a hen but arrived separately due to pregnancy. Greeted on arrival by lovely team - must point out Laila who was the receptionist who dealt with us, extremely efficient and helpful, even upgraded is. Thank you so much for a great stay!

To think I had almost missed this gem of a hotel. Upon searching for hotels Movenpick had not come up due to being sold out for part of my stay, but I liked the look of the hotel thus had chosen to atleast for the four days here and elsewhere for the remainder of my holiday and I was not disappointed. Arrival - check in was quick and efficient, our room was ready and the receptionist was very polite. Rooms - very clean, modern, comfy and not dingy looking like a lot of the rooms in other hotels in Marrakech. Bathroom - beautiful, showers were powerful and didnt leak too much like other hotels Breakfast - a lot of choice, fresh paratha and omelettes. Left satisfied everyday. Pool - Amazing, jacuzzi and sauna available too Wifi - Good but sometimes cut off but nothing‚Ä¶

column3: Simply bowled over by this hotel
column4: What an incredible start to our tour of Morocco. It was a spectacular hotel with a lobby floor that stretched into a labyrinth of decorated enclaves and art displays. I think the Feng Shui is good as it has a grand water feature in front and a spacious lobby to let the good vibes in. High backed sofa chairs greet our tired jetlagged bodies_ we had flown for 18 hours and coached from Casablanca International airport upom touchdown. The rooms were so cosy and the beds luxurious. All the toiletries were arghan oil-based.. Although we went down late for dinner to an almost empty buffet we did not mind as we were more tired than hungry. The morning buffet was ample and the omelette chef took the trouble to decorate the plate. The pastries were excellent_ loved the authentic‚Ä¶

column3: I would come to this hotel every single I come to Marrakech I don‚Äôt want to try anyone else!
column4: Hands down staying at this hotel was one of the best experience of my life. We arrived in the morning and we was greeted by the most lovely people who helped us move our bags in and more. Leila at the reception (god bless her soul) was the most amazing person to grace this planet, the way she made us feel welcome and greeted us and went the extra mile for everything puting us and our best interest first was just honestly so pleasing and wonderful. In addition, I want to thank Leila for her amazing work at this hotel and she is defiantly someone who really does her job to her best ability and I wish there was more Leilas in the world. I wanted to surprise my partner I decided to upgrade to a suite room from a classic room and now thinking of it was one of the best decisions I‚Ä¶

Me and my partner arrived by taxi at the hotel, where we were received by a helpful young man who took our luggage and lead us to reception. The service was fast and welcoming. We were quickly signed in to our rooms and further details explained. My partner wanted to surprise me and upgrade our room, where we were given a suite with no inconvenience! The rooms are amazing and spacious. The lighting is outstanding and incredible. The views are to die for. And the pools are ever so beautiful. Room service and maintenance is 24/7!! We forgot our adapter and they helped us out with no problem. Overall I love my visit here and hate the thought to leave!! Highly recommend for a perfect gateway, romantic or not, the location is perfect as there‚Äôs a mall just by 15 minutes walk.‚Ä¶

Hotel Lobby was wonderful as a piece of art, didderent receptions distributed arround front office desk every reception reflects a specific stage of Marrakech culture, old African soldiers boat with hot colors and live musician shows all the day with traditional dress and tea as hospitality for audiences Staff are very polite, helpful and descent Restaurant was very clean, providing variety of foods local and western, Desserts very tasty and delicious fresh fruits every day Room was very clean and comfortable. Daily drink water supply, expresso, coffee and tea also renewed every day Heated Pool with different levels Meeting room was huge and well equipped with audio and video instruments Red flowers and very elegant smell everywhere Really it was very good experience

Spend two days at the pool and we enjoyed it a lot. Khalid the poolboy is a very happy guy who made our days even more relaxing! I would really recommend buying a day pass which is including a 2-course lunch.

The Hotel was beautifully designed, in typical Moroccan style, room was quite good. The staffs are helpful and generous. Food and the balcony view were amazing! I highly recommend this hotel to both business and traveling guests.

I would like thank Najia the massage specialist and therapist in movinpuck manssour el dahabe marrakesh spa ,as she is the best in the world , really i have made many massage seesion all around the world ( malasia, hurgada, turky , barcelona) but no one lika NAjia ,U fully recomnend her for any one who visit Morroco or Marrakesh even if you not a movenpick guest she is the best ever seen regarding all types of madassagee

The hotel is beautiful. The lobby is impressive. The rooms are big. The spa is not too impressive. The service lack in some areas. I was charged twice however I already paid and once I told them I paid they still charged me.. The kids club lacks of activity done outside the club. My girls 5 and 6 sears old found it too boring. However they offer free lunch for children. The swimming pool area is very nice however even if heated the swimming pool in December was too cold. The restaurant service is not the best. Extreme long wait even if only 2 tables were busy and the waitress were very moody. We arrive to the hotel with a rented car and they couldn't find the car when we were leaving. Overall it is a nice hotel but I was not impressed with the service.

column3: Very nice hotel- very good staff/services
column4: I spent a couples days there for work and I hope I will have the opportunity to go to this hotel again!! Very nice, well decorated, quite, huge outside (heated) pool, lot of choises for breakfast and a pretty good fitness area. Everyday there's a coach to help you with your work out session. Mohammed Amin gave a 30 min work-out and or felt like working out for 1 hour üòÖ . Very good coach, advises and exercises!!

Such a nice service, actually it was expected because this is not the first time. I've been here in a lot of events and they are always surprising me with their prestigious service. Food is nice. Music and lights are fabulous.

column3: Amazingly elegant and excellent staff, very comfy bedding
column4: Spacious and beautifully well designed areas, elegant reception and very helpful staff. Rooms are spacious, finely decorated and clean. We had fresh flowers every day and the bedding was the best! This trip was planned for my birthday, and the staff noted this event. When we came back to the hotel the nigh of my birthday, they surprised us with our room decorated with rose petals everywhere and a delicious chocolate cake waiting for us in the stay room. Thanks for making me so happy!

We stayed for a week in M√∂venpick hotel, absoluloved every mintute of our stay, very polite and helpful staff. My daughter had a best time of her life. I can‚Äôt thanks enough Turin and Basma for looking after and playing with my daughter. They baked, danced and played all day. Would definitely recommend the hotel, specially the kids club, you can leave your child with them with a peace of mind that they are in a safe hands.

This is not a five star hotel as you know it. It's nice arrival, but I get a feeling that they don't have control. The room is big but dirty. There is a large dark oil stain on the carpet floor and everything is worn. The mini bar is empty and there is a kettle for coffee, but there is only dry milk left in the box. The internet is incredibly slow and I had to give up checking the news. On several occasions the reception does not respond when you call. I guess my expectations were bigger, but this is just sad and not worth five flat ears. The surroundings are nice and the breakfast was relatively good selection. But there were so many people, but it was included which is always nice. If you are staying here, I advise you to curb your expectations. The pizza at the pool was‚Ä¶

Great Hotel and location in the heart of the city.Rooms were large and clean. The grounds of the hotel are stunning from the lobbies to the pools and the spa was beautiful with reasonably priced and good services. Food at the pool and room service both pretty good. Breakfast was very extensive and nice. The staff at the front desk is great especially Hind. A little bit high rate but still looking forward for my next stay.

I was pleased to finally being able to find a heaven spot in Marrakech to practice yoga. OM YOGA studio is definetly the place to be and it's located in Movenpick Marrakech. You are loaded with positive vibes as soon as you step in by meeting the gorgeous Morad!I had the greatest introduction to all the facilities and full explanation about their offer. This guy is a jewel in this studio and I am happy to meet such high standard service in Morocco.

We had a wonderful time in Marrakech, our hotel was very convenient and clean. We were impressed with the guidance of your staff ( especially Hind and Afaf ) they helped us to choose the best tours and outings of the hotel. We now look forward to seeing Marrakech again and MOVENPICK hotel in the next coming opportunity, thank you very much Dariush and Mahnaz Mobasheri

This is a pleasant hotel with beautiful exterior and nice interiors. We liked it for their restaurant. Very good Moroccan cooking. And in the afternoon a perfect dessert place with great European style pastries and cakes .

column3: Pretty from the outside but not so great inside.
column4: This hotel was chosen by our tour operators. The maze of hallways to get to the lifts was very confusing, and then once in the lifts, you realised that everything was only dressing. The lifts were antiquated and dodgy. Airconditioning in the room did not work well, and we were there in July, and they allegedly had someone "fix" it but they didn't have any success. The breakfasts, however, were magnificent, and they had a waiter preparing freshly squeezed orange juice for all. The pool was also lovely for a nice dip to refresh. Certainly could have improved some of the help at desks, as there were receiption, concierge, and other desks located in strange places throughout the maze like lobby.

During my trip to the Movenpick, I was eager to hit the gym during my stay. On entering the gym I was met by Mohammed Amin, the in house gym instructor. I would highly recommend Mohammed Amin as a personal trainer, having trained with him over a couple of days in January. He has a friendly nature coupled with a real focus on training and will certainly help you achieve your goals.

Mohamed Amin is really 1 of the best coach here. Friendly, approachable and definitely professional. He gave me advises based on my requirement and certainly did impress me with his knowledge. Give it a shot and you will understand

I was there with family in january 2019. Wonderful hotel, huge and delicious breakfast, comfy rooms. I would like to specially thank Mohammed Amine, the fitness center coach, who made his best at all times with our big group of 17 persons! He is a very experienced, polite and helpful person who cared a lot about every guest in the fitness centre! And speaks perfectly english, what is not common there! Thank you, Mohammed!

Used Movenpick for the first time And the first day at the hotel was a real disappointment the TV wasn‚Äôt working and had issues with kettle aswell as the iron. Every time I called room service no one would come and at one stage the electric tripped and I had no electrics and was sat In darkness and was getting ready to go out for a evening meal for my wife‚Äôs birthday. I made reception aware of this and eventually some body came up and fixed it. Hour later electric tripped again and I found my self fixing it myself as I knew where the electric box was not something you would find yourself having to do on holiday. The rest of the staff and in the restaurant were lovely and that‚Äôs my main reason for scoring the hotel average score. Yusuf/Jo was superb through out my stay the‚Ä¶

The entrance is very impressive. Rooms are spacious and the balcony offered a great view over the swimming pool. Food is very good and varied. Staff is friendly & professional. The hotel could do with an update as wear & tear is clearly visible. Recommended!

Very pleasant atmosphere in Marcelona restaurant, enjoyed good paella and desserts, can recommend red Marrocan wine Eclipse, very good staff and special thanks to Diego and Khadija who made our two dinners there very enjoyable!

When checking out, we found on the bill almost 1000 euros added extra. One extra night was charged despite the fact that the full holidays were already paid, bills from the restaurant that did not belong to us were charged without our signature, the New Year dinner was charged twice and our credit card was biulled without our authorisation. The programme announced for the New Year dinner was a complete lie and almost nothing was respected starting with the duration of the party and ending with the programme itself. All above was consideredd by the hotel staff as an error!!!! Several errors amounting to 1000 euros. All attempts to have qualified responses failed. We intend to address the competent authorities in Maroc for serious fraud. There is no good choice for having a‚Ä¶

We stayed at the hotel in early January. We had a bigger one in the building opposite the spa. We have been very pleased with the treatment from the hotel. We trained and used their spa daily. I want to thank a person named Abdel Rahman who works at the gym. He was there and helped us with the training in the mornings and his genius, commitment and his personality was super. We are glad we met him. Hopefully we will come back in sha Allah.

I stayed here for 10days over New Years with my family. The staff are fantastic and are the reason I give it 5 stars. They are friendly, helpful and just really nice people (as all Moroccan‚Äôs we met were). They consistently went out of their way to make our holiday relaxing and enjoyable. In particular the staff around pool with special mention for Anas and Amine. The staff in the kids club were also very good and our 3 children enjoyed going there for a couple of hours each day, giving us sometime to relax. The cleaners did a great job with the room beautifully made up and spotless every day. Only issue I had with the hotel was the lack of information on the hotel and Marrakech in the rooms. There is no guest directory or room service menu in the room (a menu was dropped to‚Ä¶

We moved to this hotel after a bit so good experience at Four Seasons Marrakech. I loved the whole ambience of the hotel, it has everything you need for a good price. The staff where super friendly and professional at the same time. Ibitisam at breakfast enthusiastically designed our plates with beautiful Moroccan art. They bedspreads and restrooms were very clean. It was a bit chilly this January so glad the pool was heated. They however need to upgrade the twin beds, not so comfortable.

column3: A wonderful hotel with an efficient and friendly staff!
column4: We spent 4 nights in this hotel during the Christmas holidays and enjoyed our stay for many reasons, and in particular for the location, the ambiance of the hotel and its amazing staff and facilities. We could swim in the large and warm swimming pool, had relaxing massages in the beautiful spa, and we had excellent lunches and dinners in the various restaurants. The staff advised us on many activities to do in Marrakech and areas to visit. I really recommend this hotel to discover this city and spend relaxing holidays.

Whilst on the whole this hotel has a great location, good facilities the staff let it down. I stayed there for 4 nights and it always felt like I was an inconvenience to the team there. Food quality very good and outdoor pool stunning. I placed a shirt in for dry cleaning one morning to where that evening, but the shirt never made it back, even by the next day no shirt. The hotel couldn‚Äôt care less that they had lost a brand New shirt.

column3: A really nice hotel... 20 years ago
column4: The Movenpick Marrakech is a very large hotel with hundreds of rooms. When you arrive, the lobby is quite impressive, but depending on where your room is, it is quite a walk to the room. Our room itself was ok. The room had had some superficial renovation (new carpets, wooden trims, paint etc). The bathroom however was original. The (separate) toilet needed replacing. Indeed, the porcelain had cracks and there was scale which had built up over the last 20 or so years which was not befitting the rest of the room. The common areas of the hotel need more than some basic TLC. The lifts are slow, damaged and unpredictable. They need to be replaced. The paint in the hallways was scuffed and needs re-painting. The breakfast restaurant too had seen better days. In the scheme of‚Ä¶

I Was in this hotel for the christmas holiday with my family, and it was a very nice exeperience... hotel beautiful and very comfortable! ...We‚Äôd like to say many thanks to HIND, the receptionist that organize us two incredible excursions! Hope to be in this hotel in a future! RACCOMENDED A LOT!!

Mohammed Amin is the best personal trainer I‚Äôve met so far. Motivative, energetic and humorous to work with. Also learnt several new techniques and how to focus on specific muscle groups. Real talented guy and he knows what he‚Äôs doing. Hope to meet him again and gather some more experience to take home! Definitely deserves 5/5.

column3: Poor service bar some great individuals
column4: The hotels accommodation is top class. The facilities like spa and gym were excellent, the decor is often beautiful, rooms are basic but they‚Äôre neat and tidy - I can‚Äôt ask for more, basically. Moreover, the location is excellent: 5-10 mins drive to airport, and a 5-10 mins walk to train station and shopping mall (which includes McDonalds and KFC for those who can‚Äôt hack the Moroccan cuisine) My only problem is the service. Any complaints u have with the room, don‚Äôt expect them to sort it out. I had a lizard crawl into my room. Called the staff 4 times, after 2 hours nobody came and I had to sort it out myself. If u get locked out from your room, don‚Äôt expect them to help you. There is no urgency at that hotel, and even more worrying there is no sense of responsibility. From‚Ä¶

I have stayed at this hotel before and so while on my business trip with my business partner Jaouad, I suggested we go to the hotel‚Äôs New Years Eve buffet dinner. The advertisement for the dinner buffet suggested we call to make a reservation which my partner did, and was told that a reservation was not required. So of course we showed up for dinner...and guess what we are told we need a reservation. My partner called back the reservation number we had called earlier in the day while in the hotel restaurant entrance and requested to speak with management.
