Anyway, nothing was done to rectify the situation. The sad part was that we are in the tourism business here in Morocco and was planning to book our future clients here. However, if this is the level of customer server my‚Ä¶

Ok...on first impressions the hotel looks nice, it was clean and looked impressive. In the colder weather the main pool is cold!!..even tho is ‚Äúsupposedly‚Äù heated to 25-26 degrees...u are shivering, this was one of the reasons I‚Äôd choosen this hotel as my son likes to swim in the pools but I greatly disappointed I think he managed 10 minutes on the entirety of our 4 day stay! The bar located next to the pool was terrible at customer service, you can sit there no-one comes over..the staff were always miserable and moody especially the older men working there...they were the same mood it seemed afternoon or evening!! they could do with some lessons is hospitalility. We had a superior room, these rooms are located at the back of the building (a little walk tbh) the room however‚Ä¶

column3: I‚Äôm staying at this hotel next time I visit Marrakesh...
column4: This is a gorgeous hotel, I had a wonderful time. Nice and clean rooms and the staff who went out of there way to make my stay feel like home. The front desk agent Souhail was very accommodating, helpful and excellent. Next door to the Convention Center (Palais des Congr√®s), close to downtown Marrakesh, train station and restaurants... place to be!!!

I'll never forget this place. Beautiful and all that but when i needed their simple service when i was ill they didnt help at all. I called for an urgent wheelchair 3 times when i was rushed to hospital no one acted.

Amazing stay at the Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech. Weather was great - sunny, warm enough to sun bathe and swim. Staff were amazing - especially anas at pool who were hugely attentive and helpful. restaurants and Bar and a Spa will satisfy all your needs. room our room located in masouda building was clean with amazing amenities , special thanks for the room made Soukaina for its turndown service and for its beautiful smile .Also a complete gym with ultra modern cardio machines. Highly recommended!

Great stay at Movenpick Marrekech. The staff were really really nice and welcoming. I particularly enjoyed the spa and fitness area. I did a series of deep tissue mssages - great :)... A special thank you to Mohammed Amin - sport coach at the fitness centre who is a great motivator.

column3: Beautiful hotel close to the old and new town
column4: We are a group of 8 adults and 8 kids and stayed at this property during the X mas season this year. It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel with a great location and ambience. We had asked for connecting rooms as we have small kids, however we were given two separate rooms with a common lobby in the middle. This was acceptable but may not be the best with very small kids. An important thing to note here is that the elevators are small and very scary and we would not recommend using them. The sensors on the doors do not work and the doors tend to bang, they also open up sometimes, thus we would suggest to avoid using the lifts in the main building. The breakfast spread is very very nice. They have hot meals, fresh juice and other juices, a variety of teas and coffees and hot chocolate for‚Ä¶

column3: Lovely Staff, Comfortable Beds, Nice Pools, Best Massage
column4: It's not a 5* hotel in the true sense: Things are slightly run-down; there isn't turn-down service; it can take a long time to get a response when you call for anything from housekeeping to concierge. Breakfast is fine, not amazing. Terrible coffee! Food in general isn't the best. BUT The great stuff: 1. The staff from the restaurants to the spa to the kids club are wonderful. SO kind, so helpful. Special shoutouts to: Khadija from Marcelona restaurant who is so sweet and even gave my daughter a free couscous and veggies dish (off-menu special) one night. Touria, Nheza and Basma from the kids' club. They made my children feel so welcome. They both loved going there. One night, I was late coming back from the Medina with my daughter (rush hour traffic) and Touria stayed with‚Ä¶

column3: A beautiful Hotel with first class service
column4: I stayed for two nights at the Marrakesh Movenpick which is just a few minutes away from the Medina. The hotel is a place of calm from which you can venture forth to the total confusion of the Marrakesh Medina. The hotel has 5 restaurants but I only ate the breakfast at the hotel. Srrvice and food were very good.

I‚Äôm currently staying here & it‚Äôs a beautiful hotel. That‚Äôs where it ends. The service is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced. I‚Äôve been here for 3 days so far. The problems have been... Electricity goes off in the room on Xmas day, takes over 2 hours for someone to change the fuse. I‚Äôve called 3 times & even went to reception. The 4th time I start getting agitated with reception & within minutes it‚Äôs gitten repaired. Key cards are awful- it stopped working, the room was too far from reception so I called them to send someone to let me in. I desperately needed to get in & stated urgency but waited over 45 minutes. After many calls & then a huge rant they sent someone. - again I had to resort to being agitated before someone sorts things out. Oh & the best part- I asked to speak‚Ä¶

Great hotel ,great gym/martial art instructor (mohamed amine) , very professional, helping everybody,don‚Äôt hesitate to ask him for advices ,helped me get my motivation back ,d√©cent breakfast too The whole experience was pleasing

Spectacular service and gorgeous hotel. In particular, restaurant manager Jawed went above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic time. It was my little girls birthday and Jawed made sure she was made to feel like a princess. Absolutely splendid and can not recommend enough. Attentive staff such as Affaf at reception made our stay very enjoyable. If there were more stars I would. All very beautiful.

I always enjoy staying at this hotel. The highlight for me this time was the excellent Fitness Center and Spa facilitates. Mohamed Amin was a fantastic instructor and highly recommended for anyone needing a holiday workout!

a very nice hotel to stay , very scenic and the staff are polite...Good spacious rooms and very good service . the room service in particular is very efficient. the front desk is cooperative and friendly . the restaurants are good ..

Enjoyed my stay here, comfortable rooms and excellent service by Amine, Kenza and Shaimae at the Movenpick Cafe - delighting us each morning! Kasbah like architecture and intriguing banksy grafitti at each corner.

Mohamed was amazing at coaching and making me a program that I can go home with! I came into the gym to do a lazy morning run and he turned it into two days of personalized training aimed and long term targets.

column3: Fantastic hotel; 5 star quality; 3 star prices.
column4: Amazing hotel; beautiful, classy and with superb service. Lovely rooms, great pools and restaurants - very much amongst the best in Marrakech and far less expensive than others. Huge but still with fine personalised attention.

Had a 4 night stay in this hotel and it was great! Beautiful hotel, fantastic rooms, great location and staff. Visited the gym and met Mohammed Amin who gave me a personal training session in the gym, friendly guy and great workout! Only minus is that the WIFI could be better.

I spent 3 weeks at the movenpick hotel,rooms are spacious and clean, breakfast is good and gym and spa also. In those days I‚Äôve been several time at the gym mostly cause there‚Äôs a very good instructor (Mohammed Amin) that really push you up to the limit , he‚Äôs very gently and professional. He choose for me a perfect workout and I saw my body changes! So best hotel!

I did 3 weeks in this hotel and I am here to write a good review for the hotel in general, but I want to say that the gym service is amazing, Mohamad the trainer is very kind and professional, he teachs very well the body exercises and he takes care off you all the time, usually I don‚Äôt like the gym but here I went every day and Mohamad did a very great job. So... go to the gym and ask for mohamad trainer.

column3: Perhaps the best hotel in Marrakech
column4: We had reserved seven nights at the near-by Le Meridien, a hotel not worthy of this famous and fine chain. So we checked out the first morning after a very unpleasant "welcome" by a snooty and unhelpful staff and went searching after breakfast for another hotel. We were very fortunate to find this jewel, the Movenpick, on the same avenue and the lovely Hivernage neighborhood as the Meridien. Although quite a bit more expensive, it was worth every penny! The public areas are grand but in a truly elegant way, the room most comfortable with a state-of-the-art bathroom, a charming balcony, and, best of all perhpas, a superb breakfast included in the room rate. Special mention must be made regarding a breakfast room employee, NAIMA, who excels in her attentiveness to detail,‚Ä¶

Beautiful decor in the hotel. The service was great. Very helpful hotel staff. The breakfast buffet was average really. Better food in the hotel restaurants. Enjoyed my stay here. Had a great massage at the spa. Nothing bad to say really. Rated 4 star because I thought the breakfast wasn‚Äôt that good. The room was super clean and bed was sooooo comfy. Would stay here again!

My family and I had a wonderful time in this hotel. The staff are really helpful especially when they see u with children. I want to thank basma and her team for taking care of my 2 boys in their kindergarten. I also had great time training with Mohamed Amine in the gym. He really cares about his customers and know how to motivate them to push the limits. Don‚Äôt not hesitate to ask him personal advise, he is very kind and helpful and a great coach !! Hope to see u soon

We came to Movenpick to celebrate my husbands birthday, we was greeted at the front of the hotel by the wonderful staff very professional. We fell in love walking through the beautiful entrance leading to the reception. The staff at the reception was so nice and friendly especially Nadia who was always willing to help with anything! Checking in was super fast and went straight into our room. I was a little upset that the hotel did not do anything for my partners birthday as i already sent a request via email and also contacted booking.com to call the hotel which they did and Movenpick did send a email back saying a cake would be put out with a lovely surprise but it was not done. Also the window in the toilet was broke so on the same evening within being in the room for‚Ä¶

Great hotel - very close to the city centre and the old city. Staff were very cool - lots of helpful assistance and offers to advise and make things more comfortable Bedroom was immaculate every day. The cleaning staff did a very cool and thorough clean - like seriously :) pulled out the beds and washed under them etc. Amazing A special thanks to Houda Saltina who was always so helpful at breakfast and at the restaurant Pool and facilities were great

column3: Gate 1 Tour: Impressive but not Impressive
column4: We stayed at the Movenpick Hotel Mansour for 2 nights as part of our Gate 1 Tour of Morocco. Overall, the hotel looks very fancy and refined, and it is for the most part, but there were a few things that could be improved. First off, the property is huge, many buildings, many rooms, a sprawling footprint. Even the main lobbies were a maze of hallways. We were placed in building 1 which is most likely their group building. Rooms were of adequate size, maybe a bit small. We had a toilet that leaked water all night so we needed to keep the bathroom door closed. You will be happy to know, the shower is Western! Best shower of the trip! Movenpick offered free wifi, but the wifi sucked--it was easy to connect to but slower than molasses. We did get good connections out in the‚Ä¶

I just wanted to thank the care takes at the Kids club at the Movenpick Hotel in Marrakesh, specifically Basma who took such good care of my child. My daughter wanted to be there all day. They did arts and crafts, treasure hunts, face painting and the list goes on.... I was able to leave my daughter and leave the resort feeling relaxed and enjoy some adult time on my vacation. Thank you all so much for giving me some time and entertaining my daughter we will always remember the love warmth and kindness!

We had an amazing holiday in M√∂venpick Marrakech. Hotel‚Äôs architecture and decoration is breathtaking and whole area is quiet and beautiful. Breakfast was delicious, room was clean and hotel‚Äôs staff was so kind to us. Especially I want to thank waiter Mouchine and amazing personal trainer in the gym. Only bad thing was wifi connection -it didn‚Äôt work well in our room. Still I would like to recommend this hotel highly for everyone who adores beautiful design and good service. Thank you!

Last week my husband and I arrived in Marrakech for the first time. We travelled to Marrakech to get married and were extremely excited. The moment that we arrived at the hotel we were absolutely impressed, because the M√∂venpick is such a gorgeous hotel, on the outside and inside. The moment we were checking in the staff told us that our suite had a technical issue and that we had to wait. So we waited. After an hour of still waiting I asked the reception if we could maybe get some tea or coffee. That wasn't an immediate yes, she had to discuss that with the manager. Ultimately we got coffee while waiting. After two hours I started to get seriously irritated because no one offered us anything, we just had to wait. No communication at all. After those two hours we decided to‚Ä¶

Excellent personal trainer in this gym. He approached me and was very keen to help plan my workout for the day. He was extremely motivating and very professional. If anyone is a gym goer please ask for Mohammed, he is very willing to help and gave me the best workout I have had in a long time.

Stayed here for my birthday trip The hotel is very nice indeed with great pools and gardens. The rooms are very good with plenty of room and balconies. We had the junior suit which was Fantastic All the staff at the hotel were excellent and could not be faulted. The breakfast was very good with a great choice. We ate lunch 1 day and this also was fantastic in the buffet section We ate at the Spanish restaurant which we felt could have been better and this is why it‚Äôs not a five marking. Would come again for sure 100%

Marcelona restaurant at Movenpick Hotel . This Restaurant is just amazing.One of our top restaurant experiences, The food is delicious and their service is fantastic. Staff are so friendly and attentive.definitely exceed our expectations

Great international standard hotel that reflect the arabic style. Good services, nice decoration, good restaurants, gym, bar... ! The breakfast was on top and the personel was really helpful specially Kenza hostess at Saray restaurant .I will come back for sure. Thanks for everything

Money was removed from my room - very uncooperative management in dealing with my complaint - Got the impression that they felt my complaint was trivial. The issue is NOT about the amount 'misappropriated' [THEFT ] but about the Fact that this happened at this establishment AND the ATTITUDE of the management of the hotel in NOT being willing to deal with it~ Oh ...there is also no CCTV camera footage available on the floors !

Special Thanks to Touria and the friendly team at the kids club for taking care of our daughter ensuring that she was safe and entertained during our stay here. She absolutely loved her time there and couldn't wait to return each day.

column3: Thank you Movenpick Staff, specially Houda Saltani (restaurant staff)
column4: I recently stayed at the Movenpick and I was very impressed with all the services and staff. Especially I want to compliment Houda Saltani who made sure we were very well looked after during breakfast and lunch by the poolside bar. The hotel is amazing and deserves its five stars. Well done to the team. I would highly recommend this hotel because it is close to the centre and old city - all a little walk or a short taxi ride. Thanks guys!

This hotel is a certified 5 star. The hotel arranged my transfer from the airport to the hotel. The service is excellent. It reflects the hospitality of the locals. It was always a warm welcome 24/7. I would like to commend Naima from the buffet restaurant, she is so kind and looked after me during my breakfast, what a way to start your day in Marrakech. Concierge could also arrange tours for you. I just hope that the hotel could organize free shuttle to the Medina, if possible. In any case, Medina is not far from the hotel and taxi is affordable. Menara Mall is just 10 minutes away from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants along Avenue Mohammed VI. I went for dinner at the Marcelona restaurant in the hotel, food and service are awesome. Shout out to the staff of this‚Ä¶

column3: Quite good but could be excellent
column4: Stayed 7 nights at the hotel. Location we found to be very good - Walking distance to the markets in the old part of town but far enough not to be in it all the time. The lobby of the hotel was very nice but oir building Zinade definitrly in need of some repairs. The elevator carpets had partially come off. Our room was on the 5th floor but the view of the aircon units and piping didnt make us want to sit on the terrace. For such rooms probably shouldnt even have a terrace. We found the room nice enough with a large bathroom. Two things about the room were not good: it got extremely hot at night (despite temps of max 12C) and there was noise from the machinery on the rooftop. I am guessing this also caused the heat in the room. Opening a door was not an option unless we want‚Ä¶

I recently stayed in the Movenpick hotel with my family and had a great time there, one of the highlights of our trip was the visit to the Kids Club within the hotel where one of the staff member Touria helped lookafter our children, they absolutely loved spending time with Touria who performed different activities like cooking, face painting, dancing, treasure hunting, gardening, colouring and much more. Touria has a great personality and her interaction with our children was amazing so I would highly recommend anyone visitng Marrakech to stay in this hotel and definitely take their kids to the Kids Club and have them make their trip memorable by spending time with the friendly staff there especially Touria. Thank You Touria for all the good work you are doing, pls keep it‚Ä¶

column3: A chandelier that Sia would be proud of!
column4: I have visited Marrakech a few times and always tend to try different hotels whilst visiting Morocco. Having heard a mixture of reviews my friend had booked this hotel and therefore I decided to stay here. The hotel is located within the Hivernage area of Marrakech and is walking distance from the station and the Menara Mall. Without doubt the entrance and the grounds of this hotel are amazing. The artwork (Banksy style) makes it even more intriguing and adds to the large display of artwork around the hotel. The chandelier in the main lounge is simply beautiful and the concierge explained the names of each of the difference sections of rooms located around the hotel which I found interesting. Unfortunately, as many have explained, the rooms were a tad underwhelming. My friend‚Ä¶

this was our first time visiting Marrakech and this hotel certainly did contribute to a fabulous mini break! Our suite was just perfect - a large walk in wardrobe, huge bathroom and a comfy bed. The only downside that I can highlight was the noise from the nightclub opposite and the associated view from our balcony! The extensive breakfast buffet ensured that there was something for everyone. Service was a tad slower than I would have liked but it did not impact our break. Point to note - the hairdryer supplied was not very effective, take your own.

Front Desk employees should be more courteous when gusts are checking-in.... They should strive to provide the best "1st impression". The check in process was so so - they were all busy chatting between them instead of attending all of us who were in line....Then, only one employee ended up helping the long waiting-line...Front desk should also be more tactful and nice with guests.

It was my first time visiting Marrakech as a winner from Movenpick Hotel JBR Dubai & I‚Äôm blessed to this opportunity that I have had to visit this beautiful Marrakech. Everything went smoothly & up to the standards starting from the arrival & ending to the departure. All staff was very blessed & hospitalized from the doormen, concierge, reception, housekeeping, restaurant, in room dining, call centre & gym. I felt that I‚Äôm in my second home & enjoyed a lot. Restaurant has had the most delicious Moroccan authentic food that I will never forget the taste of it. The experience with the tourist tours was absolutely great & I enjoyed every moment either in Marrakech or even during our stay at Movenpick Hotel Casablanca. I‚Äôll definitely repeat my visit to beautiful Morocco. ‚Ä¶

Fantastic hotel with the best kids club! Our 3 children didn‚Äôt want to leave! Special mention to Touria and Basma from the Kids club for their outstanding care, and especially Touria who babysat on 2 nights. Highly recommended.

The Kids Club at the Movenpick was highly useful and entertaining for my children. The kids loved it here and it was a great place to drop them off and pick them up during the day. The staff were extremely friendly, 3 ladies named Touria, Nazha and Basma looked after the kids very well and were always there to entertain them. Lunch was provided by kitchen staff who always had a smile on their face and stayed positive. Their programme through the day was impeccable, it included cooking, face painting, dancing, treasure hunting, gardening, colouring and much more. Overall the visit was wonderful and Kids Club was a great aspect to the hotel.

M√∂venpick Hotel Marrakech is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy your vacation. The rooms are very spacious and equipped with all your heart needs. With 503 rooms and suites it spreads out on a huge terrain you need a while to get to your room. The walk through most wonderful kept gardens and greenery is a dream. The six restaurants and Bars and a Spa will satisfy all your needs. Most wonderful the different 4 !! pool areas where you can enjoy the day in the sun or under the umbrella. On the pool-side as well restaurants and bars with great service. Specially for families a great deal ‚Äì you will find a kids club as well as a pool for kids and many other amenities. I enjoyed my time at M√∂venpick very much and can highly recommend the place.

Love this hotel. Turia, Basma Nezha really looked after our girls during our stay. The gardening added a nice twist to the ball park and arts and craft activities. Highly reccomended! Great family escape.

We were a party of 12, chaps played golf and us ladies were there for a relaxing few days. We were in block 7, room 7407, lovely room, not such a nice view of the car park. Balcony door didn‚Äôt lock.....The rooms in this block are noisy at night particularly early hours as the night club across the way closes early hours, particularly bad on a Friday night/Saturday morning. Hotel accommodated 2 couples moving rooms but not all of us which was disappointing. We only eat in the hotel at lunchtime and breakfast, unfortunately lunch was very slow although the food was good when it arrived. We also struggled to get an itemised bar bill early evening before we went out. The breakfast area and food was lovely. You do need to do something about the coffee machine queues‚Ä¶

Enjoyed a 5 night stay at the Movenpick. There is a lot to like about it. Rooms are spacious and quiet in building 7. Big balcony to enjoy and the bathrooms are quite large. Pools, spa and main lobby areas are quite lovely. All staff are friendly and helpful. Two major setbacks stops me from rating it 5 stars. Room wifi was horrible. I asked for it to be checked, but don‚Äôt think it was. The property is so large, not sure they have enough routers. Perhaps an IT expert can check this for them. It was very annoying having to always go closer to the lobby area to get good wifi. The second issue was restaurants. For dinner, only one good option for a large property. Would have been nice to have another option for guests who don‚Äôt want to leave the property. Other than‚Ä¶

It s all about the Marcelona restaurant and its amazing authentic Spanish food and great service. I was invited to eat out with some business partner who were Spanish and really missed their food, and it was very satisfying for them and me. The decor is so chic and the colors are so welcoming and as soon as we got in the staff and manager took great care of us, we felt welcomed and comfortable which is rare these days. We ordered lots of food to share and taste and it was just delicious, and had to order more just to try other dishes. The deserts were tasty and very well presented so I would say Kudos to the Chefs for a perfect meal and Big thanks to the staff and manager for really making me and my clients feel like home.

As i l visiting marrakech, one of my friend from qatar advise me to visit Marcelona restaurant, because she knows that i like Spanish food, it was a great experience, the food was so tasty especially the paella and the pil-pil, the staff are very friendly the service was excellent the atmosphere is amazing, unfortunately i will recommend this restaurant to all my friends.

column3: The good, the bad and the ugly
column4: Location: In the middle of an area which is full of Hotels, some 50-70 Dirhams away from the main attractions. Room: The good, a very nice room, big and spacious, a very nice bath and shower, with nearly all in that you could expect. Serious problems with stocking/restocking the Minibar. The ugly: The room was in a building at the far end of the real estate and no umbrellas are available. Going from the reception to your room could get you soaked. Food: The Spanish Restaurant had good food, good drinks and good service. The breakfast is a mixed bag, when it was full, long lines for the coffee developed quickly. For a Hotel of that size nothing specacular. Room Service was fast and delivered good Quality Public Areas: A large pool fo which 2/3rds are pretty flat, otherwise a‚Ä¶

Stayed here 8 days on business. Luxury hotel. Very stylish and lots of art abounds. Great outdoor swimming pools. Rooms very comfortable. Breakfast is pretty good. Staff generally food quality service. Not cheap but reasonable for the facilities. Location means need taxi to town but is taxi rank outside hotel. Takes 5 mins costs 50 to 100 Dirham.

Excellent hotel. Perfect place for a vacation. Attentive service, great food. Poolside facilities wonderful, all the guys at the pool couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. Lovely suites. It would be hard to fault anything. Breakfasts were just a great start to the day. A amazing display of SO many food choices.

Excellent hotel , the crew was fantastic . Special thanks to Sana el Farassi for her hard work in housekeeping , she went the extra mile to make sure everything was perfect during our stay . The food was excellent as well , plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Very large modern rooms came with two double veds, with excellent air conditioning. Beautiful and functional shower. Also important in this day and age of technology is plenty of outletss that work! All the roooms provide safes. The hotel lobby and commib spaces are stunning.

I had a massage at their spa and it was the best. Fatine really did a wonderful job. I had a deep tissue massage, and it was very good. Fatine was professional and very polite. Thank you so much for a wonderful massage

The location is really great,settled in the ‚Äòrich‚Äô area of Marakech.Fountains all around the structure are breathtaking and so the swimming pool.We had a bit of delay at check in since the room wasn‚Äôt ready but despite that everyone was nice.

This was a lovely hotel. Rooms, restaurant, bars and pool all very good. The check out was very slow. Location is good as it has a number of other places to spend time very close. Most attractions are with in 15 mins travel.

it was an amazing experience , hospitality , good service, good moments , discovering new things , excited to do it again!! thanks to all employees ,they were kind and helpful ,specially tarik thanks to him !! it was such a confortable trip!

column3: Not perfect but highly recommend for the price
column4: The hotel has a great lobby, pool area, and rooms but certain areas let it down in terms of being a little tired for a 5 star hotel - the lounger cushions are very comfortable but a bit worn out, the lifts to the hotel rooms are very shabby and the spa could do with a paint in the steam rooms and locker rooms. Having said that it is priced lower than other 5 star hotels in marrakech so you have to take that into consideration. We found the service to be excellent throughout especially the waiters at breakfast who always served us quickly and kept us topped up with coffees and freshly squeezed orange juice. The breakfast is excellent with lots of choice. Overall we had a great stay, we'll return and we'd recommend this hotel.

I have been to the mansoo more then once, with friends and family, I gotta admit I am still going back because it's one of the best places in marrakech ! The service is top notch and the food is incredible ! Definitely going back !

hotel was soo beautiful, clean rooms, very classy, front desk are very very professional and smiling all time, waiting just to serve you and make sure your stay is very comfortable i say thank you yo Said and Abdellatif for making my stay great i recommend this hotel.

column3: Good Hotel - Could be a great hotel
column4: Great Pool - some of the deck side chairs need to be recovered , a number of the umbrella‚Äôs are broken or in disrepair. Pool staff are reasonably attentive, but there is no place for a tip when you do a room charge, so you need to take cash to the pool. Restaurant food is acceptable, breakfast buffett is outstanding. Bar service is adequate. Hotel rooms are nice, comfortable, air conditioned.

This hotel has all the makings of a great hotel but falls down in a few areas. The rooms are great, spacious, comfortable and very clean. Pool area is lovely and well maintained. Breakfast selection is very good with great omelet station. However, the hotel is like a maze with no signage to find your way around. After 4 days there, I was still getting lost trying to find anything, especially in lobby area which is enormous and very confusing. As many others have said, the service here is not good. There are lots of staff but they don‚Äôt know what they are doing. Six bar staff and it takes 20 mins for them to serve a gin and tonic. I was close to offering to do it myself. The most frustrating thing was that many people in our group had minibar charges on their bill when‚Ä¶

column3: Great hotel but service could be improved
column4: The Movenpick is a wonderful oasis in busy Marrakech and the hotel is very modern and clean. The room we had was in beautiful shape and the grounds are kept very clean. The one fault would be the service, particularly in the restaurants and with the concierge and front desk staff. It could be very slow at times and the concierge could not respond to some pretty basic requests for information. Overall, you will enjoy this hotel for a relaxing break in Marrakech and the amenities, property and rooms are all wonderful.

Have 0 complaints about this hotel, everything was perfect from top to bottom. Khalid Mawloud and his team were to hand to accomadate all queries, from restaurant recommendations, currency exchange, sim activation, to taxi advice. The room was absolutely beautiful, and I would have 0 qualms about staying here again. It‚Äôs well located, the breakfast is great and the pools are fantastic. Highly recommended!

9.45pm, 2 restaurants out of 3 are closed. Only one left open is Spanish: Marcelona You walk into the restaurant, no one to greet you. Finally they sit you at a table which is not clean. 15 minutes later take the order (ham and bread, gambas al ajillo, croquetas). 25 minutes later arrives the ham and bread. Still no drink. 35 minutes later arrives the gambas in some kind of tomato sauce, with the drink. The croquetas never arrived. All the staff are running around, the managers also. Some restaurants are better closed.

column3: Amazing hotel walking distance to everything.
column4: I stayed hear for a week and I can not fault their excellent service especially Sana and another lady at the reception. Sanas customer service was the best when we checked in to our room it was filthy and we got upgraded to a presidential suit which was perfect with the pool near and it was such an amazing experience I would recommend this hotel to any one and everyone who visits Marrakech.

This was our second stay at M√∂venpick (in Marrakech) and it never disappoints. We also stayed there December 2017. The service is great with all staff being helpful and ready to be of any assistance. Both times we had our 6 year old son with us and he thoroughly enjoyed the kids club. Even when he was in the pool the lifeguard and pool staff kept an eye on him even though we were sat right there. We are going back in October (next month) and staying at M√∂venpick again! It‚Äôs a great location, short walk away from local shops/ cafes/restaurants. The buffet breakfast also has a lovely variety of hot and cold food. I cannot fault the hotel or its staff! Definitely recommend!

column3: Outstanding hotel design confort and kids club
column4: H√¥tel design is really awesome, Rooms so comfortable and spacious the suite makes you feel like home. Kids club is really my biggest super good surprise, the staff is so lovely with the kids and really passionate, kids didn‚Äôt want to leave them they made our stay memorable and relaxing. Thks to the lovely instructorsüëèüèº Breakfast was excellent and varied but food for lunch or dinner a disaster a scam!! Service not worthy a 5star, staff quite nice but you need to be behind to have service completed.

Stayed for one day before heading to the airport. It's a gorgeous hotel, recently renovated with fabulous pools. Rooms are great, too. But as with many places in Morocco, it's the service that lets the place down. From a disappearing concierge, dismissive reception staff and impossible-to-find bar staff by the pool, it became a bit of a running joke for us. We foolishly forgot our sunscreen at the last hotel, and with a 3 year old in tow needed some. Concierge says "there is none in the hotel". Ok, where can we buy some? "At the pharmacy". Right, where is that? "It's a public holiday so they're all closed". Any other suggestions for sunscreen? "No". Hmm, not the service expected at a 5 star hotel. Thankfully we stumbled across the kids club and, as expected, they had some and‚Ä¶

Decor was brilliant, extraordinary hotel lobby designs, spectacular furniture, fixture and fittings in lobby. Rooms were average designs, our AC didn't work very well but staff did offer us an alternative room but that was too warm with the AC not working very well. We just stuck with our original room and the nights git very warm sometimes a bit difficult to sleep, that was the only down fall from the hotel. Hotel was very busy but still had time for you. Afternoon tea and snack was complimentary and was a good touch. Childrens club was excellent and staff did everything to make your child feel special, a great team. Swimming pool was good but again very busy and you hardly got any sunbeds during the daytime. Breakfast was good with a lot of variety and fresh omelettes‚Ä¶

Hi Guys, picked the family up from our family home in Rabat and head over to Marrakech. Firstly we arrived early at the hotel so we assumed we will be at loose ends until check-in time. Reception could see we had kids so Kindly searched for an available room that will allow us to check-in immediately. They could have simply said "computer said no" but from the start, you could see that staff want to be helpful and not resistant. Not only did we get an early check-in but also got an upgrade... what a lovely result. We stayed in room 5002 which was a suite, very clean and the bed was so comfortable, you just sink into the pillows. I want to give a special mention to the kids club, they were really friendly and really worked hard for the kids. I have a 6 year old boy and 7‚Ä¶

If you want to rest, this is a terrible place. Plenty of noise from surrounding discos and aquapark at night. Beds are comfortable, pillows way too soft. After two nights you will feel broken. Most of the staff isn‚Äôt very motivated nor helpful. Lovely swimming pool but not enough sunbeds/umbrellas. People have to lay in the grass. Fitness was lovely before now moved to the spa. Way too small and packed. I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel

column3: Spacious Rooms, delightful service, good food.
column4: Although we only stayed for one night, we could not fault the hotel. Check in was smooth, our family room was spacious and modern and the food was tasty and of a good quality. Communal areas were clean and of a high standard whilst all the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful.

column3: Excellent hotel and a memorable stay
column4: At first, I was a little hesitant to book this hotel after reading entirely different reviews. After long thought and seeing the beautiful interiors, I went ahead and scheduled my visit. Please take into consideration that I visited during the low season (July), so the hotel was not as busy as it would usually be. Upon arrival, the staff were very welcoming and directed me through to reception where I was able to check in quickly and efficiently. As I was guided through to my room, the porter informed me of where the restaurants and facilities were on the grounds which came in use as the hotel does not have a directory or a map so there could be parts of the hotel that I never discovered. I stayed in a classic room and was surprised by the size. It was very spacious and had an‚Ä¶

column3: Lovely hotel but could be run better
column4: I think the Movenpick was having a bad week when we stayed. Check-in was quite chaotic and queues were long. We were assigned the wrong room at first (a twin room rather than a double). A few other guests were having similar issues from what I could gather; I heard someone complaining to reception because they were given a room with somebody already in it! Our room key stopped working intermittently, so we were back and forth to reception a lot. Then the lift broke, so we had to walk up and down 3 flights of stairs multiple times a day for our whole stay. Not too much of an issue for us, but it did make me wonder about the disabled guests. The air con in our room was more of a lukewarm fan (I assume it was faulty?) so sleeping was uncomfortable some nights. We asked someone‚Ä¶

I can say this was probably the best hotel I've stayed at! The reception was absolutely breathtaking and always smelled amazing. Our room was very neat and tidy, the bathroom was big and clean. Overall the decor of the room was very luxurious. The staff were really welcoming towards us from the moment we stopped into the hotel, they were really attentive and took very good care of us. There was also a breakfast buffet included with our room and it was just simply amazing, they had a wide variety of foods to choose from and the food was delicious. On the hotel compound they had about 5 restaurants to choose from, we ate the main one ( I cannot recall the name) and the food was amazing. I definitely recommend staying at this hotel you will not be disappointed!.

column3: Summer Holiday with Sister - 16th July 1 week
column4: This was our 2nd visit to the Movenpick and what was really lovely to be remembered by some of the staff there, who deserve a special mention. Omar, in the restaurant at breakfast, looked after us so well, and even delivered fresh coffees to our sunbed. And then there was Anas our pool butler, so helpful and friendly. A little child was falling asleep on the sunbed so he went out of his way to find an umbrella and cover the sun so the little one could sleep - how lovely is that. We also met Jihane, one of the waiters, on this trip who joined the hotel in March. From the minute we arrived on Monday afternoon she could not do enough for us, her English is really good and she couldn't do enough for us during our stay. It was so hot on this trip and we were given buckets of ice‚Ä¶

Negative points. Prior to arrival we booked a transfer via the hotel concierge to collect us from the airport. It never arrived! After 40 minutes of waiting, we called the hotel to chase this & eventually a car was sent for us. Not what we‚Äôd expect when paying a premium for a transfer. Shortly into our stay we heard from other guests that an event/ conference for 700 people was taking place at the hotel that day. This meant paying guests could not use the main pool or bar for the entire day. In the evening as part of the event a party took place around the pool. Paying guests were not permitted to enter. The music was horrendously loud, with heavy bass. At 10:30pm I called reception to enquire as to when this would end, I was advised 11pm. At 11:30pm the music continued, I‚Ä¶

column3: Superb service from Khadija, Mehdi, Essef, Jessus and the Manager Jaouad
column4: I arrived at the hotel on Monday and being a vegetarian didn‚Äôt find much on the menu to eat . I was not very happy about that and conveyed my feelings to the waitor and waitress. They then called Jaouad Eddajjani, who was the manager who sorted all the problems out. The chef called Jessus came out to talk to me and offered to make me whatever I wanted. Jessus was very helpful and made many dishes for me and my family , which were all very tasty and wholesome and fresh. He was very patient and sincere and made the food with much love and passion . He took great joy in knowing that I was enjoying his food which conveys to me a very loyal and good worker. The staff Khadija, Mehdi and Essef were very accommodating , polite and kind. . They were doing their best to‚Ä¶

Having had our flight cancelled and turning up to this hotel, we were expecting a very solid nights stay, with top quality service and 3 meals that Easyjet had said we were going to have, and the maddest few hours ensued. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 10pm and a whole flight's worth of people got off and were told to go to reception to get allocated rooms. The people behind the reception desk were relatively good, albeit quite rude, but understandably so as having to check in nearly 200-300 people at 10pm was not expected at all until nigh on one hour before, but still, nothing much that could have been done so they could have been a bit less rude as no one wanted to be in that situation. Once allocated the room, and very quickly may I add, I was pleasantly‚Ä¶

Luckily we were only there for 24 hours, after a flight was cancelled and we were put up here for the night. Staff were rude and completely incapable if communication, producing itemised bills, telling you how much sonething cost, bringing food out and there was something dodgy going on with the card machines. Not expected at all from such a chain and when we first arrived looked so beautiful. Wouldn't return, not even for one night

I stayed at movenpick eddahbi during the months of June for 4 days and initially had a few issues with my room and not being attended to correctly by some staff on the first day which was slightly upsetting. However, we eventually managed to speak to Mr amine Berre the guest relation manager who was very helpful and hospitable and immediately assisted me and my friends and rectified our issues. I would like to thank Mr Amine Berre for his excellent service and would like to express that he is a fantastic manager. Due to his help we enjoyed the rest of our stay at the hotel. The breakfast menu was nice but i feel Could have provided an extended variety of food considering it is a 5* hotel.

I stayed in Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi from July 14 to 16, 2018. I was travelling with my family. We had a very enjoyable time and stay the superior room given to me was amazing, it was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel has very nice facilities, aside from the the Pools and the restaurants, overall ambiance was great. We had dinner in the restaurant the Food attendant was very friendly, cant remember his exact name probably Mehmed he is a young good looking guy with a very good english diction. Also a very accommodating Manager who was there to look after us as well Mr. Jaouad Eddajjani. Their kids center is amazing, my daughter had so much fun with their 2 staff who was very friendly, Rouua? (she was wearing eyglasses) and Ikhbal. Front desk staff was very helpful I‚Ä¶

Big nice hotel, grand designed of the lobby. All The staffs are welcoming, service good. But the rooms are quite disappointing. We booked two rooms for a family holiday. But both of the rooms are not that good as show on the website. Room size are ok. But carpet dirty, sockets failed, broken curtains,broken coffee machine, toilet locks broke, broken bathroom door, some light bulbs broke, birds poo on the fence of balcony, balcony glass fence was full of dust and ashes, balcony floor dirty leaves ours feet grey and dark. Ordered two extra pillows but wait for four hours delivered after chasing them. Overall the rooms are disappointing but hotel environment and staffs were good . It‚Äôs a over rated five stars hotel.

column3: luxurious overall but room for improvement
column4: I just stayed for 3 days. Check in was brutal. Argument over extra person which was my teenage daughter. They wanted to charge me extra since the reservation did not include her by booking error on the app. Then came the room assigned. Moldy and not a garden view. Then tears, more complaining. 1 hour later finally in my room which was booked as a king but ended up a queen. The room was ok, pretty pool view which I guess was their version of an upgrade?? Said, the manager finally tried to make me happy after they pushed me to a meltdown. So besides a terrible check in, the actual room was small, It had a dirty carpet, the bathroom counter was not cleaned. and some stains on the setee. The location of the room was noisy so beware and don‚Äôt get a room near an elevator or above the‚Ä¶

On our second visit to Marrakech we stayed for 2 nights here. The hotel looks stunning from outside including the walk from the entrance to the reception. Our room was as you would expect from a 5 star hotel however only negative is no usb charging slots and reception did not have adapters for the UK plugs however to be fare we did find one 3 pin socket but it was away from the bed. What I really liked about our stay was the service. All the staff including Mr Said at reception were the most welcoming we ever met! We asked for a late check out no problem. Room service staff very polite and smiling. The staff at breakfast were very polite and kept asking if we were ok and offered to serve us with drinks! Mint tea served as we pleased. All in all they made us feel welcome‚Ä¶

My husband and I stayed at the Movenpick in Marrakech for 9 days. We came primarily for work and brought our 15 month old daughter with us. I was a little nervous about finding a babysitter in Morocco since she is so young, but the idea of leaving her behind for one week made me more uncomfortable. So, I arranged for a babysitter through the hotel. First of all, the Moroccan culture is extremely warm and welcoming to babies and children, so it felt right that I brought my little one along. But most importantly, we had a fabulous babysitter at the Movenpick. Her name is Raouia and she is on the staff of the kids club at the hotel. She was so kind, responsible, helpful, calm, and easy to communicate with. She speaks multiple languages and put me at ease upon meeting her. My‚Ä¶

Amazing hotel near to the city center. Rooms big and clean with city view. 2 main pools to enjoy and relax. Bar with Projector that you could see also Soccer match of World Cup. Interesting breakfast with local products. The cuisine is the only thing that needs a slight improvement (both quality & quantity).

The kids club is very nice within the hot. My daugther and niece loved it. They do everything to amuse the children. Nice games, dancing, painting, good food and very gentle supervisors. If you have children I would definitely recommend this resort.

Duration of stay: 7 Nights (23rd to 30th July 2018) Type of stay: Couples holiday Board: Bed and breakfast Room Type: Superior King Size Written on last evening prior to AM departure. I have been fortunate to visit Marrakech 6 times now and have stayed at various locations throughout. This was my first time attending this hotel with a view of experiencing a mixture of a relaxing and leisurely holiday. Staff: Throughout the duration of our stay the staff at the hotel in all areas; from the bedroom maid to reception staff, were very polite and attentive to our needs. Some spoke English fluently, but others who did not were able to understand my broken French and actions. In our experience we felt this did not hinder our experience with the staff or any requests. Although for‚Ä¶

I loved my stay at that beautiful hotel. However, one person - Mrs. Naama that works at the morning restaurant made The difference! She paid attention to me from the moment I walked in until the very last minute when I got up to leave. Her sensitivity, her kindness and exceptional professionalism, made me feel pampered, cared for. She took the 'extra step' even in sending me a card with dozens of roses when she found out that it was my birthday. Mrs. Naama is an asset to the hotel - a blessing to every guest who meets her. Dr. Henya Shanun-Klein

The kids club was so Fun I enjoyed it a lot we didn‚Äôt so many activities from building lego‚Äôs to swimming to baking I really enjoyed the kids club I recommended a lot if you want your kids to have fun just go to the kids club

column3: One of the best hotels to Visit in Marrekesh
column4: This place is simply awesome. It's a beautiful resort hotel. Stunning pools, resort style environment with rooms that are 5 star quality. Very upscale and relaxing environment with great food quality and numerous selections for breakfast. I highly recommend!

Had a lovely 7 nights in M√∂venpick hotel,lovely friendly atmosphere and the staff were so helpful. I would like to mention a lady Nayna at breakfast time,she was absulutely a lovely lady and looked after us so well,and very professional with her job. Thank you once again till we visit you again. Harshika Hirani

column3: Best staff ever at the hotel (Bahija) üåπ
column4: We are from the UK and have stayed here for 6 days (12-17th June) and during our breakfast we had the most amazing waitress. Bahija looked after us above and beyond her duties, she was so helpful and always had the biggest and heartwarming smile. I would deffinately recommend her to anyone that visits this hotel to see her. We stayed at room 2319 which had the swimming pool view from the third floor. Bahija gets 10 out of 10 from us

column3: Excellent !! Recommended stay everything you need
column4: I have just returned from a weeks stay at the M√∂venpick resort. Grounds; lovely surroundings the lobby area is first class, beautiful touches with the velvet chairs and water fountains. The entrance is very impressive huge attention to detail has been well thought of here ! Rooms; nice size and equipped with everything you need. Staff were very happy to give us two sets of brand new hangers when we asked for some and more and tea and coffee on request this was never a problem. Rooms are cleaned to a good standard. Gym and Spa; used this most days. Excellent equipment in the gym with everything you need. My only reservation would be that the air con needs to be on and windows closed as it did get very warm! It also could be cleaned more regularly as the bin was usually full‚Ä¶

My stay at M√∂venpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech has been wonderful. After a long plane ride it was a pleasure to be greeted with mint tea. The staff were warm and welcoming during my stay. I enjoyed my accommodations and will book this hotel again whenever I vacation in Marrakech.

column3: Amazing amazing Super with amazing service.
column4: As u are aware Dubai is fake ( and human right ,,,, whattsssssss?..); South Africa is a place where people CAN t live toghether, My Italy.. I prefer to keep silence about rude, impolite manners . dirty expensive places ( sorry but is true) and London ( where I live is becoming a dangerous town. , Morocco is a place where u can find peace , respect, kind people, like YS Laurent said. The Movenpick hotel reflects the spirit of Marrakech! It s an amazing Hotel with 4 amazing swimming pools ( 1 for kids),It s make me feel relaxed. Beautiful , rich breakfast , amazing spacious rooms, flowers and grass and plants are everywhere. . The Spa is fabulous and people are friendly , polite, generous, Professional. Marrakech is a charming place! I haven t seen rubbish in the‚Ä¶

Just got back from the Movenpick hotel in Marrakesh after a 3 night stay. had a nightmare with signing food and drink to the room. 3 hours wasted to and from the reception and on the phone to bank . Eventually was made to pre-pay money before hand . This is before we had even spent it . The icing on the cake was been told the money I don't spend can't be refunded as it's a "chore " for them . Basically robbing me . Apart from the embarrassment of looking cheap the hotel is beautiful . I would recommend staying there in a heart beat as you really have to see it to believe it . Just a shame they fell at the last hurdle .

column3: clean but staff need some polishing.
column4: OK, not a bad hotel by any means but some significant irritations during our stay which a little bit of staff training could resolve. There is obviously a culture of extracting cash from tourists in Marrakech, and I get that. However, the guy that took our luggage to our rooms didn't take it to the rooms for 30 minutes so we couldn't change. To add insult to injury I tipped him for all 4 couples but he then took a further tip which my polite brother offered. The dining experience left a lot to be desired. Although the dining room was nearly empty we had to share menus. One member of staff repeatedly took the wine list away (perhaps for religious reasons?) but then when we did order a bottle of wine the cheeky wine waiter told us one bottle was insufficient!!!! - A new‚Ä¶

The standard of food at this hotel is terrible... I don‚Äôt need to say anything, the picture says enough ü§¢ I can honestly say I have never had such bad quality Save your money and go to McDonald‚Äôs- thank me after !

We jyst cane back from Marrakech today where we stayed at the Movenpick and had a great stay. We were in the 2 bedroom suite which was new, clean and modern. We had great house keeping service including a turndown service. Will definitely stay again next time.

The hotel is located fairly closely to the airport and a short taxi ride (‚Ç¨5-8) from the old town. We stayed at the hotel for five days and had a "family room" (i.e., two adjacent rooms) on the ground floor of the Zidane building. The hotel lobby area and the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are fine, although they feel a bit dated considering that the hotel was renovated fairly recently. Also, the kids club (free and starting at age 4) is good and proved to be pretty helpful during the rainy days we had. Similarly, the buffet restaurant offers nice breakfasts and ok dinners (although dinners are fairly pricey given the quality). The main thing that lets this place down is the service. On the day of arrival, I asked about a pressing service for my shirts and suits and was‚Ä¶

We ( 2 adult and 3 boys, age 11, 9 and 5) spend 1 week in this beautiful hotel. We had a really wonderful time. Every one of the staff was so friendly. the entrance /lobby of the hotel was amazing. The rooms Nice and clean. A special Thank you to naima in the restaurant during breakfast. Every morning she was always so Nice and positieve, such a Nice way to start the day! Lots of choice during breakfast. Annas at the pool so friendly and and also keeping the kids safe. And Sweet Ghislaine and the Spa gave me such a Nice moroccain hammam experiense , it was super! All together we had a great time and hopefully we Will come back next year. Souad el Aouaji -Farouk

column3: Great hotel, especially the bar staff
column4: This isn‚Äôt my first visit here and I‚Äôve been meaning to leave a review. This hotel is amazing and highly recommended to everyone even family holidays. The hotel staff are so curteous and welcoming especially the bar staff. There was a gentleman in particular called Ayoub, I believe that was his name... he was very pleasant and always made sure that me and my partner were well looked after. I will never forget his smile and how he was so attentive and treated all the guests the same. I wish I could give him more then just 5 stars. üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü We will def be returning here again!

We have just stayed for three days in May and we love the hotel . But it definitely has a great kids club , the staff are friendly and caring and my kids want to spend the holiday in there . For families with younger children this is definitely worth being top of your list. All the staff are friendly and attentive but the ladies in the kids club are superb and have really made our stay both relaxing and fun.

Stayed at Movenpick with my two children ages 1 & 3 Years Hotel was great food was good kidszone is a great place in the hotel to leave your kids or stay with them so they get to interact with other kids it is provided free of charge by the hotel kids get to play, dress up and learn about the Moroccan culture as well as painting and story time. My daughter loved it so much she wanted to stay there.

This is not my first stay in this hotel ,already been here many times, the kids love it here üòäespecially the kids club where the stuff is amazing , very good with the little ones , creating many activities for them and very helpful and patient.. would definitely comeback especially where my kids are happy so I can relax and enjoy the sun while they are in safe hands üòä.

We stayed one night in this hotel. This hotel is new and location is good. The lobby is big and comfortable! The room is cleaned and standard five stay hotel room sizes; services was good and foods ok , highly recommended!

A very nice place I went there with a few friends and we had a great experience one of the waiters was very professional and attentive We went to marcelona and we had a delicious dinner composed from a several tapas, A good Moroccan wine (lumiere) THANKS MEHDIIIII üíôüíôüíôüíô coming back soon

It is undoubtedly an attractive place, but that‚Äôs where the allure ends. Food options are limited and the meals I had (Jambra, room service) were bland and overpriced. It‚Äôs not hard to make a decent chicken panini... I had to ask 3 separate people and wait over 24 hours just to get a kettle sent to the room, despite tea bags and coffee being in there already. I had to ask a guy to show me how he would make a cup of tea before the penny dropped. Check in and check out experience was too long, badly organized and with staff more interested in talking among themselves and looking at their phones. My company got me a basic room which had a wonderful view of an air conditioning unit. The air conditioning in my room did not work and just blew hot air around. I asked to have it‚Ä¶

I recently stayed at Movenpick after leaving a riad I had booked in the medina due to its poor condition and bad area. When I stepped foot in Movenpick I was delighted with the beauty and service. The room was very spacious and the bathroom high end. One also gets free access to the wonderful hammam if you are a guest, which I took advantage of and loved. When I return to Marrakech I will definitely stay here again.

House keeping is asleep and simply does not bother to respond to requests even repeated requests. I thought this was just my bad luck until I met another guest who had an identical experience. It's a pity as it's a beautiful hotel.

column3: Rooms lack basic items though hotel design is beautiful
column4: Rooms do not have a hairdryer, iron, or conditioner (for hair). The water kettle and desk lamp do not work. I am here for a business conference and have no way of ironing my clothes to look presentable. We are 350+ conference delegates here and many of us are complaining about this same problem. As a top-end hotel, the Movenpick should provide these basic amenities in all rooms. However, the design of the hotel is stunning and the decor beautiful. The staff have been warm and friendly. I am still here and hope management can address this issue quickly.

Absolutely loved my stay, everything was amazing: great selection of food for breakfast; delicious dinner buffets in Moroccan style; well-equipped gym; several pools. Marcelona restaurant is serving Spanish cuisine in Catalan style - amazing tapas and main dishes, felt myself like in Spain but loved it even more. Chocolate hours are the great opportunity to try signature Movenpick chocolate and sweets. Highly recommend this hotel for vacation in Marrakech or short comfortable stays as it‚Äôs very central located and Medina with all the main attractions are in walking distance.

The hotel is very modern and well fitted out. The reception staff were very helpful although at times there could be more at peak times. Both pools were clean and the pool staff friendly and the pool bar served good food. The half board menu is very tasty and has many very varied tagines and all fresh and plentiful. The only issue I have is the sound of car horns at 5am every morning from people leaving the night club next to the hotel. Would recommend it as a convenient location for exploring Marrakech.

went with 11 year old son, great luxury hotel for children, they are really welcomed. Junior Suite was fantastic Service great Atmosphere was perfect Pool scene great, large pool is heated all year, this for some reason is hard to get confirmed, but it is heated to a temperature you are able to enjoy it. Special mention to whoever runs the team around the pool and pool restaurant - extremely organised, staff excellent, got beds and towels for you, food and drinks served etc Medi Terra restaurant was fantastic service, please do go in here, it may look exclusive but everyone is welcome and my son loved the tapas, the cost is also very competitve - service and staff couldnt do enough for you Dont understand the bad reviews, okay there are some strange little things but these are‚Ä¶

the hotel looked newly renovated (at least the rooms we were in) with a nice mix of modern and authentic style. we took suites and they were very spacious. service was super excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful and that includes house keeping, concierge and waiters at restaurants. the only downside though was the room service menu which was in french only and had only like 6-7 options to choose from. Nevertheless, there are few restaurants in the hotel to dine in. i highly recommend this hotel for families and couples.

This is a beautiful hotel so it‚Äôs such a shame they don‚Äôt have the staff there to run it. My room was lovely and spacious with a stand-alone tub and separate living space. But the rooms are not sign posted at all. And nobody from reception takes you to your room in the vast complex, so it‚Äôs a miracle I found my room at all. Nobody on reception answers the phone. Nor room service. So I was unable to arrange breakfast before my 6am check out. Not a 5* hotel in my book. Wouldn‚Äôt go back.

There are many 5 star things about this hotel --beautiful grounds with water features and nice pool --comfortable rooms including excellent linens (great pillows and towels). very comfortable bed --rooms with nice terraces --nice bathroom amenities --big spread at breakfast buffet --40 or so minute walk to main square and less than 10 minute walk to mall But the understaffing easily knocks off a star --huge line for eggs at breakfast. Another egg person is needed! --no one at either reception to be found. We got caught in the pouring rain on our walk back from the center and wanted to ask for an extra hair dryer or see if we could pay to get our clothes dried. Not one person in sight in either reception area. Earlier in the day we waited for ages for a concierge so we‚Ä¶

Movenpick was a brilliant hotel! The room sizes were good and they had all the appliances you would need. There is also different languages in the entertainment so anyone can enjoy. We had a big balcony with a table for dining and the view was spectacular. The food was delicious. There was a lot of variety for anyone. The crockery was very clean as was the food itself. The breakfast and dinner had lots of fab options and I thoroughly enjoyed. The pools were of a massive size and the heated pool was just warm enough and not too hot. The cold pool wasn‚Äôt cold enough to freeze you but was still cold. Movenpick‚Äòs location was just right with a mall next to it. It was an amazing hotel and I would recommend that you choose this one.

Very nice staff. Extremely friendly. Especially Mustapha et Hanaa at breakfast. Will definitely be back. The room is very comfortable. Bed extremely nice too. Large choices for buffets. Highly recommended.

Such an amazing hotel with such amazing staff. Nadine .... was a staff member that made my holiday... multilingual.. smiley... service fabulous... I left my wallet and the same hour she returned it without a cent missing. She even refused the 100 euros I offered her. Where in the world do you find such trustworthy gems. Certainly a hotel on your must visit list. I never return anywhere but here... I will be back.

This hotel is so nice. It‚Äôs absolutely huge. So many buildings, pools, restaurants within the complex as well as a very large and professional spa. Check in and check out was very quick and all the staff are very well spoken. Rooms are very spacious as well as a walk in closet and large balcony equipped with table and chairs The variety and quality of the food in the breakfast hall was one of the best I‚Äôve seen so far. The location is perfect within the area of Hivernage which is known to have the best resorts/hotels, restaurants and stores Whilst there we visited the main square a few times, it‚Äôs only a few minutes drive from the hotel. Here you will find the never ending semarina souk In the evening we went to jad mahal and Buddha bar restaurant for dinner and‚Ä¶

Really enjoyed our stay at the Movenpick. The restaurants were great - particularly the breakfast buffet. All the pools were lovely and we had a very nice room. Special mention must go to the kids‚Äô camp and their fantastic, friendly staff and amazing daily activities - our kids didn‚Äôt want to leave when they went there! Also very well located from airport and center.

column3: Very helpful staff and great service
column4: Beautiful hotel, very opulent and spacious rooms. Have to mention the Kids Club was great, the girls Raouia andTouria were excellent with both my boys who had lot‚Äôs of fun while my husband and I went to the souks and wanted some time by ourselves. The breakfast spread is great although the coffee from the machines never seemed to be hot enough, but that‚Äôs a small inconvenience . Didn‚Äôt see any alcohol on any of their menus , so if you decide to buy your own make sure you also carry a bottle opener as they don‚Äôt have one at the hotel. (We borrowed one of the Staffs personal Swiss army knife that he happened to have). Other than these small glitches it was a wonderful stay is a fabulous hotel.

column3: Great Hotel, excellent serviceb and kids club
column4: We had a great time, my daughter loved the kids club and their staff, she would go everyday to play and feed the rabbits :) restaurants are very good, one of the pools is warmed for the colder days, and the staff at the pool are so nice. I highly recommend!

Checked in for 3 nights having spent most of our time in a Riad. Comfort level is exceptional. A couple of useless people in reception which makes life difficult but overall our stay was perfect - I wouldnt stay here for over ‚Ç¨150 per night

column3: Plush hotel near centre of Marrakech
column4: Opulent hotel with huge suites, ours looking over the gardens. Enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend... helpful staff and delicious breakfast with a vast range of food. Dinner was a little limited, but that could have been to the time of year we visited (March 2018). Rooms a little walk from main hotel building, but a choice of four pools. Go for the Hammam Scrub!!

column3: Worst hotel ever !!! Gave a bad impression of Marrakech for visitors.
column4: First time ever in a Movenpick, it will definitely be my very last. I stay in hotels 80% of the time in a year and hotel by far is the worst of the worst. Service is extremely poor and rude on the service center hotline, I don‚Äôt care if you have 500 rooms as an excuse to find me a iron and ironing board and having 500 rooms you do not have enough for your guests? Or rather you think your guests would love to go out with wrinkled shirts and pants ? Totally unacceptable. Food. Breakfast was ok but don‚Äôt except good service. Rooms. Doesn‚Äôt deserve a 5 stars, I was pretty excited to visit at first after looking at all the pictures online. When I got into my room, wow I was shocked, fourpoint Sheraton or doubletree could do a better job. Don‚Äôt expect your Air condition to‚Ä¶

column3: AWESOME HOTEL AND NO.1 SERVICE.... MUST READ :)
column4: I and my wife would like to thank everybody at the Movenpick Marrakech for a wonderful stay we had here. From the minute we checked in to the day we left everybody was so attentive to all our needs. The suite was amazing and had everything required for a perfect stay with great comfort and services. Mr Khalid and the reception made every effort to ensure we where welcomed into our suite with VIP experience and Emmanuel ensured our dining experience in the restaurants were spot on throughout our 5 nights. The concierge where always on hand and ensured we had all the information required and assisted us not only during our stay but before arriving also. The Spa team (I forgot the names) where very helpful throughout are stay and always smiling and pleased for a pleasant chat if‚Ä¶

Wonderful visit for CAF Women's Football symposium in March 2018. Everything was surreal and like jumping out of a genie lamp!! Rooms and entire hotel so beautiful. Reception. Area mystical. Wonderful food with so much variety on menu. Bar with lovely music and chocolate snacks. Was like being in a dream!!! Thanks

column3: So much better than I thought!
column4: Was apprehensive booking this hotel due to few bad reviews, but needn‚Äôt of Worried , the staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for you,my husband was gluten free and The found gluten free bread ! The standard room had a small problem so we were upgraded straight away To a really lovely room and bathroom,felt so comfortable there. I loved the pool, once again pool staff were there for your every need Breakfast great ,was in a very convenient position ,u can‚Äôt go wrong !

Initially we were super impressed with the hotel. The grounds were beautiful and dazzling at first glance but once you got pass the initial wow it goes down hill quick. The staff at the reception desk were moderately friendly but it was clear after residing there a few days that they were overworked. It appeared that one young lady was at the reception desk for a period of over 16 hours. Our first room, was less than what was expected for a 5 Star Hotel, especially since it took 4 years to renovate. On outside of the elevator doors, the dry wall was cracking and falling apart. The fine details were totally missed in this hotel and the rooms were lack luster. We had to change rooms three times because of the room conditions. One evening it took over 30 minutes for someone to‚Ä¶

We liked this hotel, it's a good 4*+ clean, well kept and modern. Our room 7208 was large and very comfortable with a big terrace balcony. Monster bath and multiple showers with ample pressure and hot water. 3 restaurants and 2 bars. It could be better: house keeping, tv channels and information about the hotel and services it offers.

I stayed here for 4 days last year as a relaxing end to 10 days spent climbing in the Atlas Mountains. The hotel is absolutely amazing, really clean and tidy with a very nice atmosphere and great facilities. The location is good also and within walking distance of both the new malls and food chains in one direction and the old town/ square in the other. The breakfast options and service was also excellent. However the hotel was let down by the staff. I was ignored/ left waiting to check-in likely due to coming straight from the mountains so being in scruffy clothes.. they then tried to make me pay upfront when I had already booked and paid via Amex. All in total it took around 30 mins to get checked in. This was evening and the following morning I noticed that despite‚Ä¶

column3: Unusable WiFi, poor service and security
column4: We stayed 2 nights in this beautiful hotel, but looks are deceiving. The WiFi in our room was unusable slow and unreliable- we told the front desk on our first day, and while they said they would address it, it was neither fixed nor did we hear back. Several rooms in our group experienced similar WiFi issues. On the second day, another group of friends checked in and they were given the room key to a stranger‚Äôs room. They found out when they saw a stranger‚Äôs luggage after brushing their teeth and using the bathroom. Needless to say, lock up your valuables in case the wrong people gets access to your room.

We've just returned from a family trip and had a good time, hotel was very nice and the coffee shop in particular was good with some very good service from the waiter named Mourad, was very personable and made a very good cappuccino. Overall the stay was pleasant but we did have some issues with what we were told about 2 excursions we booked with the hotel, seems the concierge and reception teams are not in sync and have their own people that they use for the trips and this caused confusion and some stress for us as we had to deal with the guides and drivers when what we had signed up to was different to what the tour people thought was agreed.

Clean rooms, very kind staff, good breakfast, strong wi-fi. The hotel is really OK. But take care! If you go beyond the standard services of the hotel, you have to prepared to be cheated - like everywhere in Morocco. Taxi was about 20 EUR from the airport, but back to the airport it was only 15 EUR. Concierge was saying a totally different amount. We ordered a private tour quide at the concierge and payed for it. At the end we got only a driver with a car but he was not a tour quide. Etc etc etc... Be prepared that you gonna be cheated each time wherever you go.

column3: Birthday trip made special thanks to Safae & Khalid
column4: We got there and the welcoming part wasn‚Äôt as expected. However we were then introduced to Safae and Khalid who gave us an exceptional service and ensured to look after us the whole stay. Thanks to both my husbands birthday was a lot more memorable! Thanks for going the extra mile! I would recommend this hotel as a stay in Marrakech as it has a lot to offer, the interior and exterior is beautiful and well maintained and it‚Äôs a great location!

Had large corporate event at the Moevenpick and all was arranged very well. Food, accommodations and presentation areas / ballroom were all up to high spec. It took participants a bit of time to get used to the confusing lay-out of the hotel but rooms were good and clean. Bar and pool area were also good. Only let-down was the slow service at the reception desk. They take way too much time to check-in and/or check-out guests. Nice place overall though.

Good hotel, friendly staff, lost my phone and cleaning hijabi lady and their supervisor helped find it! Clean rooms and facilities! Nice area with shopping mall, McDonalds, kfc and train station within walking distance.

We stayed in this hotel because of attending a Congress next doors. It‚Äôs a big hotel where it takes some time to get to know the way. The rooms were nice with very comfortable beds and bathrooms. Our view was nothing and I believe a big part of the rooms doesn‚Äôt have a big view as it‚Äôs closed in by the other hotels. Breakfast was wonderful, very diverse and tasty. Nice was also that just 50 meters from the hotel are the Medina bikes that you can rent. There are several stations in Marrakech, mostly at the main attractions. This brings you quickly in the centre, nobody is bothering you and you don‚Äôt have the hassle with the taxi drivers.

Me & my wife went to Marrakesh for 9 nights for my birthday. We stayed at this Movenpick Hotel thinking we will be getting excellent service but apart from the birthday cake which the hotel provided I got to say we were let down from the start. As soon as we got to the hotel there was a problem in finding our booking so it was a good job I had my hotel confirmation with me and I showed this to the receptionist. Now to my shock I was asked to pay ¬£160 deposit for the room even though I had already paid my hotel in full. I knew that I had to pay tourism tax for the hotel but this I wasn‚Äôt expecting and as I only brought cash with this had affected our holiday. When we got to the room I noticed stains on the toilet floor and also a water leak next to the toilet. I reported this but‚Ä¶

I went with my wife in the first week of February for 5 days. Even though the weather wasnt as we expected (it was 8 degrees with some wind and rain) we made the most of it. It's in a good location away from the hustle and bustle, but within good within of the main attractions with taxi. The hotel decor was amazing and the rooms were clean. The buffet breakfast was spot on with plenty to choose from. The staff were very helpful whether it be the reception, cleaning staff or the restaurant staff. During our stay there was a Chocolate Hour at 6pm and wow the varieties/taste of chocolate were amazing. We asked for a room upgrade (to a suite) on the 2nd day and our request was accepted. The only thing that bugged me was when we first went to check-in, one of the receptionist was‚Ä¶

I recently went to Marakech for a girls trip, I went in Feb the weather was nice, it rained when we arrived but after this the weather picked up. I chose a hotel as I have stayed in a Riad before. When you arrive at the Movenpick the entrance is grand and the smells are lovely, the staff were friendly and easy to deal with.
