The manager was mean and unprofessional. Unpleasant experience, i don't recomand it. I hope the direction will deal with‚Ä¶

I have stayed at other Movenpicks in the past and so I knew the quality of service which you would expect from this chain of hotels. Well my expectations could not have been more wrong. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable and clean, however, the service is diabolical. Our trouble started on arrival when we were told our room would be available at 3pm and it was not ready until 5pm. When we finally got to our room and started to unpack so that we could get showered and changed for dinner, we received a call that we were in the wrong room and would have to move. We were informed that someone would be with us immediately to show us to the correct room but they did not arrive for 40 minutes! In that time we called reception and nobody‚Ä¶

Stayed at this hotel with my husband and two boys. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with amazing decor. The pool area is nice and relaxing and very clean. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. They do have a few service issues with regards to the housekeeping staff - many of whom do not speak english, however the Duty Manager - Amin, Karim in the restaurant and the General Manager went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The staff were brilliant with our little boy he loved it here. The kids club needs a little work - maybe more organised activities during the holiday periods and an outdoor childrens play area. Would not hesitate staying here again. Thank you for a very relaxing 7 days!

column3: Very bad service. Chekking in or chekking out just for that reserve an extra day!! Lack of respect and uninterestesd per
column4: Bad! Bad! Bad! Never again. I prefer to stay at ibis hotel !!!!!! Much cheaper and much better!!!! Personel badly educated. Not aware of 5stars at all. No mini bar. Ok an empty one and if you complain about it they tell you it s not necessary just call room service it s much cheaper. If you call for a service just wait and forget because they wont come. There s even no bottle of water in the room so if you re with a baby or child ............... so don t go there

column3: The place to be in Marrakech
column4: Beautiful hotel and location, warm Morocan welcome and great service. I was there for business and took few days off to enjoy the city or Marrakech The architecture of the hotel is a nice mixture between Marrakech style, oriental and modern trends...the breakfast service is top notch and the bar Manso is very cozy offering a soft atmosphere. The bed is very confortable and the bathroom amenities are of good quality. I recommend this hotel to travellers coming for leisure or business puposes

This hotel is advertised as a 5 star hotel, but it misses the 5 star hospitality. The positive: the decor is beautiful, the rose smell when you walk in is lovely, the pool is beautiful (no jacuzzi), breakfast is good, the rooms are a nice size. The negative: check in/check out is very slow, room service and restaurant food takes a very long time, my shower flooded and no one rectified after a complaint, my room keys stopped working out of no where, when I went to put my meal on my room it said I didn't exist as a guest and that my room was under someone else's name now, which was strange because I wasn't checking out for two more days. The hotel is beautiful, but these hospitality issues definitely are something to take note of.

We've booked a nice, modern and quiet Suite which wasn't very expensive. Unfortunately, this is the only good thing in this hotel. Reception staff is unfriendly and we didn't feel welcomed at all ; the lady at the reception even rolled her eyes to heaven because she didn't understand the name of the booking. The service at the pool is very slow and poor ; it takes more than 20 min for your fruit juice to arrive and sometimes you don't even get what you've ordered. However, the worst is the Spa. I had a ''semi permanent gel manicure'' and it took them 3h30 and 4 unsuccessful attempts to paint my nails. The treatment was very painful since they used wooden sticks without any gentleness and even made one of my nail bleed while pushing the stick under it. To sum up, if you plan to‚Ä¶

Very nice stay with comfortable atmosphere. After a city tour you can relax by the pool or the SPA. To recommend is a drink at the bar with pleasant live music. Nice to have breakfast outside. Thank you for the lovely stay. We like to come back.

column3: "Great hotel, service not up to par ..."
column4: We arrived at the hotel there was no welcoming no bellman to carry our laggage , just some security guard standing at the front door , almost 30 min for the check in , still no bellman, until the receptionist had asked a janitor to carry our luggage who by the way was very kind , polite friendly and so happy to help., speaking very good english , his name is zakaria , that We highly recommend him as a billman .Beside , the hotel was spotlessly clean with its entrance and the lobby , the pool area is nice and clean , excellent food at the restaurants , rooms are clean and comfortable, I definitely plan to stay here again.

Beautiful lobby and public areas including large pool area. Room and bathroom spacious and modern. Excellent number of options at breakfast. Loved the chocolate hour. Only negative was the service levels by some hotel staff.

had a very pleasant stay at the hotel , staff were very helpful , breakfast was very good , would recommend this hotel , has a lovely swimming pool , rooms were very clean and a lovely size bathroom ,

column3: Great hotel if you don't mind a couple of service issues
column4: The hotel is fab. If the service is polished especially in regard to housekeeping it'll be perfect. I was on business and asked housekeeping for an ironing board twice, it never came. Not a huge issue but not great either. othewise a lovey hotel.

I was nicely welcomed and served, I still remember being welcomed by a receptionist called Dounia with an exquisite smile and a charming persona that pushes you to wanting to get back to visit Movenpick again.

Large attractive hotel in the new area of Marrakesh. Only several minutes from the airport and souks. Good size rooms, very clean with an excellent pool area. One of the pools is heated which was a Hugh bonus during March. Staff were very attentive and polite. Food and drinks were alittle expensive.

Located outside Marrakesh city wall, this hotel is in the recent neighborhoods close to other newer hotels. Room are clean but not luxurious. The pool side is good and ideal to stay in the autumn and winter when weather is great (not too hot) to enjoy the pool. The breakfast presents a great variety of locals products as well as the typical international options.

We had a beautiful corner suite, but our friend had a normal dobbelt room, that was dark and small. We felt that we had a lot for our money, but she didn't. The breakfast vas all right, but nothing to talk about. If you vas hungry between 16 and 19:30 you have to go to another hotel or restaurants.

column3: Nice Stay and wonderful package of Location, Service and Hospitality
column4: Good experience for a short stay in this hotel, I will return for sure next time but for a long journey to enjoy what is offered in this Hotel. I recommend this hotel for both kind of stay Business and Leisure.

column3: Luxury prices, not very luxury service
column4: Wifi was awful never experienced wifi so bad for a 5 star hotel. Service was very average staff weren't very friendly nor did they go out their way to make you feek special. Our door card stopped working numerous times which was very annoying. However location was good and hotel grounds was beautiful. Very overpriced for what it is. We paid ¬£5 for a sprite in a glass bottle worth 30p ridicoulous!! Would not stay here again.

We had an overall very pleasant experience. The hotel was lovely and we were really impressed with our room. The hotel itself and poolside areas were very clean and well maintained. We were most taken back by the service we received, we were made to feel really welcome. The staff really went over and beyond what was expected to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

An excellent 5 star hotel with excellent facilities to suit everyone..the staff were always heplful and cheerful and went out of their way to make this an excellent stay. The only small complaint I have is that they seem to cater more for the travelling business clientele than the average tourist as there was very little information or recommendations from the reception on what to do in Marrakech...but this did not affect our opinion that this is a wonder ful hotel and we had a wonderful stay.

column3: Amazing entrance, beautiful grounds, modern rooms, mixed service
column4: This recently renovated hotel has a beautiful entrance and lobby area, with lush, well maintained grounds. The rooms are of a reasonable size and are well maintained with regularly replenished amenities. The hotel breakfast was satisfactory, with freshly made eggs/omelettes available, however it would have been nice to see a greater variety of fruit on offer. The hotel is well located, 7-10 minutes walk from Menara Mall (and its restaurants) and a 5 minute taxi to the main square in Marrakech. The hotel has a significant security presence, with 10+ security staff visible at any one time. This can be rather confusing, especially when you enter the hotel for the first time, carrying your luggage yourself after a long flight whilst those who appear like staff members (although‚Ä¶

Very nice stay, super friendly and welcoming staff. The suite was amazing! We enjoyed the comfort and we valued the extreme kindness of the employees, specially the restaurant staff. I would definetly recommend it!

We enjoyed a gorgeous stay in beautiful surroundings. The staff were fabulous and the breakfast legendary. The pool guy and the maitre de at breakfast deserve special commendation they made my mum, my aunt and myself feel like Queens for a weekend. Thanks so much movenpick

column3: Lovely hotel in a good location
column4: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it's set in lovely well kept grounds. The good points are: Good location Nice room Good breakfast Friendly staff Lovely pool area Negative points: Ridiculously over priced spa Overpriced food and drink Bad food & beverage service at the pool The room is kept clean but sometimes things were not replenished i.e. flannels, water, tissues, bathrobes Having said all this I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends.

I had a great stay at this hotel we practically had the entire hotel to ourselves! It was peaceful, quiet, a nice location close to the city centre but far enough away to feel out of the madness, and the spa with the complimentary jacuzzi and steam rooms open until 9pm every night was beautiful and right next to our part of the hotel! The grounds are beautiful the pool is really clean and the staff are happy to do anything for you, you just need to ask as they won't approach you asking for drinks at the pool but if you ask them for a snack or a drink whilst you're sunbathing they will go out their way to accommodate you. I felt the prices of the food were a little steep but noticed that in general everywhere half decent in morocco shared the hefty price tag. I feel if the hotel‚Ä¶

column3: Room was too noisy, sound of moving furniture from about 5 am to 2 am
column4: I could have handled any other issues but this one. I could barely get 2-3 hours of sleep due to this issue. I spoke to the front desk and nothing was done. Service was OK, sometimes you had to ask for things twice. Hotel is located close to the Menara airport, so in about 10-15 mins you reach the hotel from the airport. There is the Menara mall nearby, and some shops restaurants. As I was on a business trip, I did not have the chance to look around much unfortunately so I cannot tell how good/bad the location was.

Overall, our check-in process took half an hour. Four staff dealing with one customer, then, twenty minutes to check us in, despite everything being pre-paid. Our key car failed 9 times in a four days stay, and as our room was at the far side of the hotel - the walk back to reception was not welcome. There were six restaurants, but no price information available to guests. The best example of the weird service standards is probably this - Our bathroom got flooded from a blocked drain, so we put towels down n the floor to soak it up.Maintenance came and fixed the drain but left the soaked towels on the floor!

column3: Excellent hotel . Extraordinary much personal attention
column4: Beautifull Hotel as good for townvisit as relaxing in luxury Personal showing of all the parts of the Hotel by Guest Relation manager Othmane . . Personal service during whole visit by every asked personal . Excellent food . Three restaurants . Swimming Pool heated outside . . Stay here from begiining till end a happening !

I visited m√©diterran√©en restaurant food was Nice and the service was super special mention is Khadija, who provided us with the most super service. We were a team of 06 persons, totally satisfied this saint valentin's day evening. Jude Ambe and Romeo Tessa.

column3: Great hotel with good services, close to everything :)
column4: With an astonishing entrance you are captured of the magic of this hotel upon arrival. The staff of reception made a quick check in and then the tour to the room guided by the bellboy gave only better tate of our stay. The room was big and comfortable and with everything you should expect from a hotel of this category. Nice and very friendly staff all over, they really took care of us during our busy stay. Definitely recommendable.

Visited here for three days at the end of Jan with 120 colleagues from around the globe. The hotel was a fantastic base to work from, being linked directly to the conference centre next door. Being refurbished in 2015 the general decor and rooms where excellent. The food for breakfast, lunch and dinner was also very good with the staff being most helpful. Maintenance issues were not dealt with quite as quickly but overall a excellent place to stay. The hotel was also close to the Medinah square and other Marrakesh attractions. Would recommend depending on the rates paid.

The check in process in the hotel is extremely slow . You need to fill a paper form yourself . it looks like a 5 star hotel from outside but once you got in you can feel it is lack of maintenance . The lift in our building 3 has at least four faulty buttons . The breakfast is good ,and staff are overall very nice and friendly. But I have to say no one is actually trying to help out . They just stand there and we have to call for help . ( on one helped out with luggage/ and they refused to tell us where to find a taxi ?! But why ? ) it is not value for money

The service at the hotel was extremely poor! The bath in our room leaked water and the entire floor became wet.. it took the hotel 1 hour to solve it The only good experience we had was with the concierge, Abdulhaq was amazing and planned great trips for us.

A very good and excellent renovated hotel, but the service staff in the restaurant is not as goog trained as it should be in a five-star-category-hotel. Spa is very expencive and not worth. Not all of the restaurants were opened.

We appreciated the relaxing and calm atmosphere of the Movenpick despite it is not far from the inner city. When the hotel is full, the breakfast room is very crowded and the service a bit chaotic. All in all a nice, recently renovated hotel.

Read the reviews, deliberated over this and many other similar nearby hotels and trusted the trip advisor community, so thank you great choice this place is for film stars and A listers, luxurious rooms our Queen was a bit small and lacking storage space so perhaps upgrade! breakfast buffet is magnificent loads to choose from. Full Scottish minus the black pudding n beans. Continental, Moroccan fish options great thick black coffee. The pool area and spa are spotless we even have a group playing live music today by the pool bar. Move tomorrow to another hotel it has a certainly its work cut out keeping up with this one. Great way to spend your New Year. it is very French influenced but most staff understand English very well.

This hotel is a 5 star hotel but with a quite low rating in Hotels.com. After booking I read quite a few of the comments from precious guests and was a bit worried before arrival. However there was no reason for worries. From the minute we came to the hotel we only met extremely nice and helpful staff and the hotel itself is definitely wonderful. The interior design throughout the whole hotel is very tasteful. There is a large swimmingpool and several smaller pools placed around the large complex all cosy and we'll kept. The large garden is beautiful and constant being nicely kept by a large garden crew. We stayed in a superior room on 5th floor with a view of the rooftops of Marrakech on our extensive side and the Atlas mountains in the horizon of the other side - beautiful -‚Ä¶

column3: Recently opened, the hotel has almost all ingredients
column4: Recently opened, the hotel has almost all ingredients for its 5* standard. Very friendly and competent staff, the heated outdoor swimming pool is a must, everything much better than at the Radisson. The fluidity of the service needs to still improve but I'm sure it will very quickly.

column3: The Best Hotel in Marrakesh By Far
column4: Having visited Marrakesh Several Times , staying in Various Hotels, This Hotel is by far the best I have stayed in. The Photo's on the Website simply do not do the Hotel Justice, it is a stunningly beautiful Hotel, There are 2 different reception areas, both Beautiful, The staff were all very Polite and Professional, Nothing was too much for any of them. The location is perfect for Marrakesh, walking distance from the Menara Mall , and just a short Taxi Ride from Medina, and other tourist spots. We chose the 1 bedroom suite and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was the most luxurious and spacious suite My Son's and I have ever stayed in, They didn't want to leave the Hotel ! The Pool area and all grounds are beautifully designed, a very well equipped Gym, which my Son‚Ä¶

Hotel had excellent gym and swimming pool facilities. Good restaurant for breakfast, though I wished they vary the menu - practically same range for two weeks - scrambled eggs, Moroccan soup, Moroccan harira (ala Singapore Kacang Pool -the Singapore version had mashed kidney beans unlike the Moroccan's which had whole kidney beans), boiled eggs, sausage, pancakes, prata, selection of bread and cheese, fruits dates. The range of flavored butter was amazing, though. There was apricot butter, dates butter, fig butter - deliciously sweet and creamy - lovely on your bread. Moroccan tea was also served but you had to order from the waiter. The only snag is that me and some other fellow hotel patrons had problems with our room key cards - my card had to be validated every time before‚Ä¶

The hotel has been renovated rooms are luxiourious and food is excellent. Nevertheless some rooms had poor internet access. Building are quite far from the reception so when you have a problem with your magnetic card, which happened to me at least 5 times you have to walk a long distance back to the reception, which is not very convenient. No phones at the floors to enable you to contact the reception when you have a problem with your key and it's very hard to bump into one of the hotel employees.

This is lovely and calm hotel to stay and experience the top managing of the such luxury hotel. Location staff and service in high managing. I would like to recommended all to go and experience the relaxation.

Was lucky enough to be bought a birthday dinner by my friend in the restaurant here and it was absolutely fabulous. A delicious mushroom soup with foie gras and perfectly poached egg; excellent fish (John Dory) and a wonderful chocolate mousse cake. I drank Casablanca beer (which I thoroughly enjoy). Lovely room; great service. The hotel is most impressive looking.

I am impressed by the hotel. Everything was excellent - quality of staff, comfortable room, beautiful surroundings, tasty food. This is a place where you can rest as well with clean swimming pools. I would really stay there next time!

Just returned from THIS HOTEL and loved it. , first time on this HOTEL and it was really wonderful. Food was outstanding, best we've had , and drinks were mainly branded and flowed very freely for all inclusive. What really makes this place is the staff, spacialy the housekeeping staff their services were good during the day  but it was better at night  , The room attendant  at night was so professional and so polite and well mannered that we took a selfie with him ;) , i liked the fact that he could speak a very good english  , the room was very clean and tidy indeed. The bar staff were fab, cocktails were super and the waiters were good fun. the gym was clean with the best equipment , only one problem there was no showers and only one rest room . the public areas   were very‚Ä¶

column3: Rude, grumpy, slow, unresponsive and inattentive staff.
column4: I was here for a UN meeting as a country diplomatic delegate and I was greeted with by far the worst service attitudes I have ever seen in my life. Toiletries and tea/coffee are never replaced in room. Had to call and beg for these things every night. Room service leaves door open after service. Some of our staff had people entering their rooms unannounced. My room was near a stairwell which had slamming wooden doors. But I think more than 20 rooms could hear the slamming. Breakfast was in a mess- coffee never comes, never a clean table in sight. Rude staff scolds you for moving tables or asking for new cultery. Also unhygienic practice of giving you used cups when they are lazy to get a new one. Conceirge confiscates unsanitary items before entry to hotel. Be prepared for‚Ä¶

column3: Beauiful outdoors and amazing pool ,but average rooms
column4: Nice hotel with beautiful outdoors and internal decorations but room on the ground floor would get flooded. Breakfast was quite good, but room service was too expensive. Pool was great and location perfect for my business travel attending the Climate Change Conference.

Movenpick is a truly beautiful and extravagant hotel. I was generally happy with its service and facility. One suggestion is for the hotel to change its breakfast buffet menu once in a while. While the food served in the morning is good and tasty, eating the same food for two weeks had its toll on us. And it would be good if the room service staff spoke English as well.

Wonderful hotel with excellent service most of the time - it fell down at check-out and I nearly missed my flight. The breakfast was superb, with so much choice and lovely staff - especially the lady who worked at the omelette station ( the one on the left!). The rooms were nice and large and kept scrupulously c lean.

The hotel is beautiful, and I mean both the public areas and the rooms. The lobby is quite compelling and there are many spots where one can simply lounge and take in the view. My room was huge and had a balcony, large bedroom and spacious bathroom. However, there is an issue in the design of the shower cubicle, as using the angled shower caused a little flood in the bathroom (other colleagues reported the same adventure). Housekeeping services need to be improved. When I asked if I could borrow an iron to press my business clothes, I was told that they do not lend irons out and that I could send my clothes for laundry service if I wanted. One evening, someone from housekeeping tried to enter my room at 10:00 p.m. to turn my bed down. I received a jolt as someone tried to‚Ä¶

column3: Nice hotel with superb swimming pool and friendly service
column4: I was there for the COP 22 in November and I enjoyed my stay at Moevenpick! The only issue was the mini bar in the room much too expensive and I was invoiced wrongly although I had never taken anything from the bar! The facilities, the gym, swimming pool, breakfast were excellent!

Recommended to stay at this wonderful hotel. Breakfast is very good with various foods. The room and the swimming area are very clean. Hotel staff is friendly and always there to help. But the room-service and restaurant is very expensive.

Friendly staff. Nice poolside Good breakfast Nice layout of hotel compound Birthday cake for customer on birthday Card key tended to malfunction easily Cleaners might forget to give you towels or tea bags

Somehow I felt that individual room thermostat did not function very well. This is vital item for guest stay. Sometimes it is felt attendance on request is slow. Had to remind the Reception a few times before it is done within an hour!

I was very satisfied with my stay at Movenpick in Marrakech. The setting is very luxurious and it caters to the comfort of of the guests. My room was well appointed with all the usual amenities. Excellent buffet breakfast.

column3: Luxurious place. A few details to be worked on
column4: The hotel is nicely designed. It offers luxurious spaces, a large swimming pool, a gym, etc. Breakfast food is quite good. It lies some 15 min walking from a large shopping mall, supermarket and restaurants. This is clearly a five star hotel, although a few details (faulty room keys, overwhelmed service staff during breakfast, no ample supply of drinking water, deficient room heating) lead me to discount a star.

column3: fantastic facilities. Staff a way to go!
column4: Great brand new hotel. The staff seems to be still getting to know how things work. No concierge and staff with no idea/no interest of providing guidance for dinning options and the alike (and the one restaurant they recommended had awful reviews in Tripadvisor....). No information int he room about hotel facilities and it is a huge hotel so you feel lost until you discover things by yourself. Food was fantastic!.

Recommended by gallerie of yahya to visit. King assembled the best artisans and artists for this hotel. Refined and exquisite - more understated than typical Moroccan. Once inside it feels like a completely different world.

good hotel i have been there for 6 days and was really pleased by the staff welcoming, i wiil mention zakaria the room attendant who served me twise he was very friendly and amuzing he speak very good english and french too . the food also was very good ; and i liked the pool and the gym . i wish the best for this hotel ; it is already at there .

column3: excellent staff, amazing breakfast and comfortable rooms
column4: the hotel is totally renovated, with friendly, smiley and devoted staff - particular thanks to concierge Bahia - with brand new facilities and super comfortable rooms. the food in the hotel restaurante is extremely good and diverse, for all types of taste and diets.

Excellent hotel , good service and food, very comfortable rooms. Definitely a great place to stay in Marrakech . The staff were very helpful too. Beautiful swomming pool and located near town center. Thanks
